Psalms-1-1: Book 1 (Psalms 1-41) 1 Great blessings belong to those 1 Great blessings belong to those     who don’t listen to evil advice, who don’t listen to evil advice, who don’t live like sinners,     and who don’t join those who make fun of God.[a] and who don’t join those who make fun of God.[a]
Psalms-1-2: 2 Instead, they love the Lord’s teachings     and think about them day and night. and think about them day and night.
Psalms-1-3: 3 So they grow strong,     like a tree planted by a stream— like a tree planted by a stream— a tree that produces fruit when it should     and has leaves that never fall. and has leaves that never fall. Everything they do is successful.
Psalms-1-4: 4 But the wicked are not like that.     They are like chaff that the wind blows away. They are like chaff that the wind blows away.
Psalms-1-5: 5 When the time for judgment comes, the wicked will be found guilty.     Sinners have no place among those who do what is right.[b] Sinners have no place among those who do what is right.[b]
Psalms-1-6: 6 The Lord shows his people how to live,     but the wicked have lost their way. but the wicked have lost their way.
Psalms-2-1: 2 Why are the nations so angry? 2 Why are the nations so angry?     Why are the people making such foolish plans? Why are the people making such foolish plans?
Psalms-2-2: 2 Their kings and leaders join together     to fight against the Lord and his chosen king.[a] to fight against the Lord and his chosen king.[a]
Psalms-2-3: 3 They say, “Let’s rebel against them.     Let’s break free from them!” Let’s break free from them!”
Psalms-2-4: 4 But the one who rules in heaven laughs at them.     The Lord makes fun of them. The Lord makes fun of them.
Psalms-2-5: 5 He speaks to them in anger,     and it fills them with fear. and it fills them with fear.
Psalms-2-6: 6 He says, “I have chosen this man to be king,     and he will rule on Zion, my holy mountain.” and he will rule on Zion, my holy mountain.”
Psalms-2-7: 7 Let me tell you about the Lord’s agreement: He said to me, “Today I have become your father,[b]     and you are my son. and you are my son.
Psalms-2-8: 8 If you ask, I will give you the nations.     Everyone on earth will be yours. Everyone on earth will be yours.
Psalms-2-9: 9 You will rule over them with great power.     You will scatter your enemies like broken pieces of pottery!” You will scatter your enemies like broken pieces of pottery!”
Psalms-2-10: 10 So, kings and rulers, be smart     and learn this lesson. and learn this lesson.
Psalms-2-11: 11 Serve the Lord with fear and trembling.
Psalms-2-12: 12 Show that you are loyal to his son,[c]     or the Lord will be angry and destroy you. or the Lord will be angry and destroy you. He is almost angry enough to do that now,     but those who go to him for protection will be blessed. but those who go to him for protection will be blessed.
Psalms-3-1: A song of David written during the time he was running from his son Absalom. 3 Lord, I have so many enemies. 3 Lord, I have so many enemies.     So many people have turned against me. So many people have turned against me.
Psalms-3-2: 2 They say to themselves, “God will not rescue him!” Selah
Psalms-3-3: 3 But you, Lord, protect me.     You bring me honor; You bring me honor;     you give me hope. you give me hope.
Psalms-3-4: 4 I will pray to the Lord,     and he will answer me from his holy mountain. Selah and he will answer me from his holy mountain. Selah
Psalms-3-5: 5 I can lie down to rest and know that I will wake up,     because the Lord covers and protects me. because the Lord covers and protects me.
Psalms-3-6: 6 So I will not be afraid of my enemies,     even if thousands of them surround me. even if thousands of them surround me.
Psalms-3-7: 7 Lord, get up![a]     My God, come rescue me! My God, come rescue me! If you hit my enemies on the cheek,     you will break all their teeth. you will break all their teeth.
Psalms-3-8: 8 Lord, the victory[b] is yours!     You are so good to your people. Selah You are so good to your people. Selah
Psalms-4-1: To the director: With stringed instruments. A song of David. 4 God, you showed that I was innocent. 4 God, you showed that I was innocent.     You gave me relief from all my troubles. You gave me relief from all my troubles. So listen to me now when I call to you for help.     Be kind to me and hear my prayer. Be kind to me and hear my prayer.
Psalms-4-2: 2 Men,[a] how long will you try to dishonor me?     Do you enjoy wasting your time searching for new lies against me? Selah Do you enjoy wasting your time searching for new lies against me? Selah
Psalms-4-3: 3 You can be sure that anyone who serves the Lord faithfully is special to him.     The Lord listens when I pray to him. The Lord listens when I pray to him.
Psalms-4-4: 4 Tremble with fear, and stop sinning.[b]     Think about this when you go to bed, and calm down. Selah Think about this when you go to bed, and calm down. Selah
Psalms-4-5: 5 Give the right sacrifices to the Lord,     and put your trust in him! and put your trust in him!
Psalms-4-6: 6 Many people say, “I wish I could enjoy the good life.     Lord, give us some of those blessings.”[c] Lord, give us some of those blessings.”[c]
Psalms-4-7: 7 But you have made me happier than they will ever be with all their wine and grain.
Psalms-4-8: 8 When I go to bed, I sleep in peace,     because, Lord, you keep me safe. because, Lord, you keep me safe.
Psalms-5-1: To the director: With flutes.[a] A song of David. 5 Lord, listen to me 5 Lord, listen to me     and understand what I am trying to say. and understand what I am trying to say.
Psalms-5-2: 2 My God and King,     listen to my prayer. listen to my prayer.
Psalms-5-3: 3 Every morning, Lord, I lay my gifts before you     and look to you for help. and look to you for help. And every morning you hear my prayers.
Psalms-5-4: 4 God, you don’t want evil people near you.     They cannot stay in your presence.[b] They cannot stay in your presence.[b]
Psalms-5-5: 5 Fools[c] cannot come near you.     You hate those who do evil. You hate those who do evil.
Psalms-5-6: 6 You destroy those who tell lies.     Lord, you hate those who make secret plans to hurt others. Lord, you hate those who make secret plans to hurt others.
Psalms-5-7: 7 But by your great mercy, I can enter your house.     I can worship in your holy Temple with fear and respect for you. I can worship in your holy Temple with fear and respect for you.
Psalms-5-8: 8 Lord, show me your right way of living,     and make it easy for me to follow. and make it easy for me to follow. People are looking for my weaknesses,     so show me how you want me to live. so show me how you want me to live.
Psalms-5-9: 9 My enemies never tell the truth.     They only want to destroy people. They only want to destroy people. Their words come from mouths that are like open graves.     They use their lying tongues to deceive others.[d] They use their lying tongues to deceive others.[d]
Psalms-5-10: 10 Punish them, God!     Let them be caught in their own traps. Let them be caught in their own traps. They have turned against you,     so punish them for their many crimes. so punish them for their many crimes.
Psalms-5-11: 11 But let those who trust in you be happy forever.     Protect and strengthen those who love your name. Protect and strengthen those who love your name.
Psalms-5-12: 12 Lord, when you bless good people,     you surround them with your love, like a large shield that protects them. you surround them with your love, like a large shield that protects them.
Psalms-6-1: To the director: With stringed instruments, on the sheminith. A song of David. 6 Lord, don’t punish me. 6 Lord, don’t punish me.     Don’t correct me when you are so angry. Don’t correct me when you are so angry.
Psalms-6-2: 2 Lord, be kind to me.     I am sick and weak. I am sick and weak. Heal me, Lord!     My bones are shaking. My bones are shaking.
Psalms-6-3: 3     I am trembling all over. 3     I am trembling all over. Lord, how long until you heal me?[a]
Psalms-6-4: 4 Lord, come back and make me strong again.     Save me because you are so loyal and kind. Save me because you are so loyal and kind.
Psalms-6-5: 5 If I am dead, I cannot sing about you.     Those in the grave don’t praise you. Those in the grave don’t praise you.
Psalms-6-6: 6 Lord, I am so weak.     I cried to you all night. I cried to you all night. My pillow is soaked;     my bed is dripping wet from my tears. my bed is dripping wet from my tears.
Psalms-6-7: 7 My enemies have caused me such sorrow     that my eyes are worn out from crying. that my eyes are worn out from crying.
Psalms-6-8: 8 Go away, you wicked people,     because the Lord has heard my cries. because the Lord has heard my cries.
Psalms-6-9: 9 The Lord has heard my request for mercy. The Lord has accepted my prayer.
Psalms-6-10: 10 All my enemies will be filled with fear and shame.     They will be sorry when disgrace suddenly comes upon them. They will be sorry when disgrace suddenly comes upon them.
Psalms-7-1: A song[a] of David that he sang to the Lord about Cush from the tribe of Benjamin. 7 Lord my God, I come to you for protection. 7 Lord my God, I come to you for protection.     Save me from those who are chasing me. Save me from those who are chasing me.
Psalms-7-2: 2 If you don’t help me, I will be torn apart like an animal caught by a lion.     I will be carried away with no one to save me. I will be carried away with no one to save me.
Psalms-7-3: 3 Lord my God, I have done nothing wrong.
Psalms-7-4: 4 I have done nothing to hurt a friend[b]     or to help his enemies. or to help his enemies.
Psalms-7-5: 5 If that is not the truth, then punish me.     Let an enemy chase me, catch me, and kill me. Let an enemy chase me, catch me, and kill me.     Let him grind me into the dirt and put me in my grave. Selah Let him grind me into the dirt and put me in my grave. Selah
Psalms-7-6: 6 Lord, get up[c] and show your anger!     My enemy is angry, so stand and fight against him. My enemy is angry, so stand and fight against him.     Get me the justice that you demand. Get me the justice that you demand.
Psalms-7-7: 7 Gather the nations around you,     and take your place as judge. and take your place as judge.
Psalms-7-8: 8 Lord, judge the people.     Lord, judge me. Lord, judge me.     Prove that I am right and that I am innocent. Prove that I am right and that I am innocent.
Psalms-7-9: 9 Stop those who do evil.     Support those who do good. Support those who do good. God, you are fair.     You know what people are thinking. You know what people are thinking.
Psalms-7-10: 10 God helps people who want to do right,     so he will protect me. so he will protect me.
Psalms-7-11: 11 God is a good judge.     He always condemns evil. He always condemns evil.
Psalms-7-12-Ps-7-13: 12-13 If the wicked will not change,     then God is ready to punish them. then God is ready to punish them. He has prepared his deadly weapons.     His sword is sharp. His sword is sharp. His bow is strung, drawn back,     and ready to shoot its flaming arrow. and ready to shoot its flaming arrow.
Psalms-7-14: 14 The minds of the wicked are full of evil;     they are pregnant with wicked plans, they are pregnant with wicked plans,     which give birth to lies. which give birth to lies.
Psalms-7-15: 15 They dig a pit to trap others,     but they are the ones who will fall into it. but they are the ones who will fall into it.
Psalms-7-16: 16 The trouble they cause will come back on them.     They plan harm for others, They plan harm for others,     but they are the ones who will be hurt. but they are the ones who will be hurt.
Psalms-7-17: 17 I praise the Lord because he is good.     I praise the name of the Lord Most High. I praise the name of the Lord Most High.
Psalms-8-1: To the director: With the gittith. A song of David. 8 Lord our Lord, your name is the most wonderful in all the earth! 8 Lord our Lord, your name is the most wonderful in all the earth!     It brings you praise everywhere in heaven. It brings you praise everywhere in heaven.
Psalms-8-2: 2 From the mouths of children and babies come songs of praise to you.     They sing of your power to silence your enemies who were seeking revenge. They sing of your power to silence your enemies who were seeking revenge.
Psalms-8-3: 3 I look at the heavens you made with your hands.     I see the moon and the stars you created. I see the moon and the stars you created.
Psalms-8-4: 4 And I wonder, “Why are people so important to you?     Why do you even think about them? Why do you even think about them? Why do you care so much about humans[a]?     Why do you even notice them?” Why do you even notice them?”
Psalms-8-5: 5 But you made them almost like gods     and crowned them with glory and honor. and crowned them with glory and honor.
Psalms-8-6: 6 You put them in charge of everything you made.     You put everything under their control. You put everything under their control.
Psalms-8-7: 7 People rule over the sheep and cattle and all the wild animals.
Psalms-8-8: 8 They rule over the birds in the sky     and the fish that swim in the sea. and the fish that swim in the sea.
Psalms-8-9: 9 Lord our Lord, your name is the most wonderful name in all the earth!
Psalms-9-1: [a] To the director: Use the Alamoth of Ben.[b] A song of David. 9 I will praise you, Lord, with all my heart. 9 I will praise you, Lord, with all my heart.     I will tell about the wonderful things you have done. I will tell about the wonderful things you have done.
Psalms-9-2: 2 You make me happy, so I will rejoice in you.     God Most High, I praise your name. God Most High, I praise your name.
Psalms-9-3: 3 My enemies turned to run from you,     but they fell and were destroyed. but they fell and were destroyed.
Psalms-9-4: 4 You listened to me from your throne like a good judge,     and you decided that I was right. and you decided that I was right.
Psalms-9-5: 5 You told the nations how wrong they were.     You destroyed those evil people. You destroyed those evil people.     You erased their names from our memory forever and ever. You erased their names from our memory forever and ever.
Psalms-9-6: 6 The enemy is finished!     You destroyed their cities. You destroyed their cities.     There is nothing left to remind us of them. There is nothing left to remind us of them.
Psalms-9-7: 7 The Lord set up his throne to bring justice,     and he will rule forever. and he will rule forever.
Psalms-9-8: 8 He judges everyone on earth fairly.     He judges all nations honestly. He judges all nations honestly.
Psalms-9-9: 9 Many people are suffering—     crushed by the weight of their troubles. crushed by the weight of their troubles. But the Lord is a refuge for them,     a safe place they can run to. a safe place they can run to.
Psalms-9-10: 10 Lord, those who know your name     come to you for protection. come to you for protection. And when they come,     you do not leave them without help. you do not leave them without help.
Psalms-9-11: 11 Sing praises to the Lord, who sits as King in Zion.[c]     Tell the nations about the great things he has done. Tell the nations about the great things he has done.
Psalms-9-12: 12 He punishes murderers     and remembers those who are in need. and remembers those who are in need. When suffering people cry for help,     he does not ignore them. he does not ignore them.
Psalms-9-13: 13 I said this prayer: “Lord, be kind to me.     See how my enemies are hurting me. See how my enemies are hurting me.     Save me from the ‘gates of death.’ Save me from the ‘gates of death.’
Psalms-9-14: 14 Then, at the gates of Jerusalem,[d] I can sing praises to you.     I will be so happy because you saved me.” I will be so happy because you saved me.”
Psalms-9-15: 15 Those other nations have fallen into the pit they dug to catch others.     They have been caught in their own trap. They have been caught in their own trap.
Psalms-9-16: 16 The Lord showed that he judges fairly.     The wicked were caught by what they did to hurt others. Higgayon[e] Selah The wicked were caught by what they did to hurt others. Higgayon[e] Selah
Psalms-9-17: 17 The wicked will go to the place of death,     as will all the nations that forget God. as will all the nations that forget God.
Psalms-9-18: 18 It may seem that those who are poor and needy have been forgotten,     but God will not forget them. but God will not forget them.     He will not leave them without hope. He will not leave them without hope.
Psalms-9-19: 19 Lord, get up[f] and judge the nations.     Don’t let anyone think they can win against you. Don’t let anyone think they can win against you.
Psalms-9-20: 20 Teach them a lesson, Lord.     Let them know they are only human. Selah Let them know they are only human. Selah
Psalms-10-1: 10 Lord, why do you stay so far away? 10 Lord, why do you stay so far away?     Why do you hide from people in times of trouble? Why do you hide from people in times of trouble?
Psalms-10-2: 2 The wicked are proud and make evil plans to hurt the poor,     who are caught in their traps and made to suffer. who are caught in their traps and made to suffer.
Psalms-10-3: 3 Those greedy people brag about the things they want to get.     They curse the Lord and show that they hate him. They curse the Lord and show that they hate him.
Psalms-10-4: 4 The wicked are too proud to ask God for help.     He does not fit into their plans. He does not fit into their plans.
Psalms-10-5: 5 They succeed in everything they do.     They don’t understand how you can judge them. They don’t understand how you can judge them.     They make fun of all their enemies. They make fun of all their enemies.
Psalms-10-6: 6 They say to themselves, “Nothing bad will ever happen to us.     We will have our fun and never be punished.” We will have our fun and never be punished.”
Psalms-10-7: 7 They are always cursing, lying,     and planning evil things to do. and planning evil things to do.
Psalms-10-8: 8 They hide just outside the villages,     waiting to kill innocent people, waiting to kill innocent people,     always looking for any helpless person they can hurt. always looking for any helpless person they can hurt.
Psalms-10-9: 9 They are like lions hiding in the bushes     to catch weak and helpless animals. to catch weak and helpless animals. They lay their traps for the poor,     who are caught in their nets. who are caught in their nets.
Psalms-10-10: 10 Again and again they hurt people     who are already weak and suffering. who are already weak and suffering.
Psalms-10-11: 11 They say to themselves, “God has forgotten about us.     He is not watching. He is not watching.     He will never see what we are doing.” He will never see what we are doing.”
Psalms-10-12: 12 Lord, get up and do something.     Punish those who are wicked, God. Punish those who are wicked, God.     Don’t forget those who are poor and helpless. Don’t forget those who are poor and helpless.
Psalms-10-13: 13 The wicked turn against God     because they think he will not punish them. because they think he will not punish them.
Psalms-10-14: 14 But, Lord, you do see the pain and suffering they cause.     You see it, so punish them. You see it, so punish them. Those who were left helpless put their trust in you.     After all, you are the one who cares for orphans. After all, you are the one who cares for orphans.
Psalms-10-15: 15 Break the arms of those who are wicked and evil.     Punish them for the evil they have done, Punish them for the evil they have done,     and stop them from doing any more. and stop them from doing any more.
Psalms-10-16: 16 Lord, you are King forever and ever,     so I know you will remove the wicked nations from your land. so I know you will remove the wicked nations from your land.
Psalms-10-17: 17 Lord, you have heard what the poor want.     Listen to their prayers, and do what they ask. Listen to their prayers, and do what they ask.
Psalms-10-18: 18 Protect the orphans and those who have been hurt.     Don’t let powerful people drive us from our land! Don’t let powerful people drive us from our land!
Psalms-11-1: To the director: A song of David. 11 I trust in the Lord, so why did you tell me to run and hide? 11 I trust in the Lord, so why did you tell me to run and hide?     Why did you say, “Fly like a bird to your mountain?” Why did you say, “Fly like a bird to your mountain?”
Psalms-11-2: 2 Like hunters, the wicked hide in the dark.     They get their bows ready and aim their arrows. They get their bows ready and aim their arrows.     They shoot at good, honest people. They shoot at good, honest people.
Psalms-11-3: 3 What would good people do     if the wicked destroyed all that is good?[a] if the wicked destroyed all that is good?[a]
Psalms-11-4: 4 The Lord is in his holy temple.     The Lord sits on his throne in heaven. The Lord sits on his throne in heaven. He sees everything that happens.     He watches people closely. He watches people closely.
Psalms-11-5: 5 The Lord examines those who are good and those who are wicked;     he hates those who enjoy hurting others. he hates those who enjoy hurting others.
Psalms-11-6: 6 He will make hot coals and burning sulfur fall like rain on the wicked.     They will get nothing but a hot, burning wind. They will get nothing but a hot, burning wind.
Psalms-11-7: 7 The Lord always does what is right, and he loves seeing people do right.     Those who live good lives will be with him.[b] Those who live good lives will be with him.[b]
Psalms-12-1: To the director: With the sheminith. A song of David. 12 Save me, Lord! 12 Save me, Lord!     We can no longer trust anyone! We can no longer trust anyone!     All the good, loyal people are gone. All the good, loyal people are gone.
Psalms-12-2: 2 People lie to their neighbors.     They say whatever they think people want to hear. They say whatever they think people want to hear.
Psalms-12-3: 3 The Lord should cut off their lying lips     and cut out their bragging tongues. and cut out their bragging tongues.
Psalms-12-4: 4 Those people think they can win any argument. They say, “We are so good with words,     no one will be our master.” no one will be our master.”
Psalms-12-5: 5 They took advantage of the poor     and stole what little they had. and stole what little they had. But the Lord knows what they did, and he says,     “I will rescue those who are poor and helpless, “I will rescue those who are poor and helpless,     and I will punish those who hurt them.”[a] and I will punish those who hurt them.”[a]
Psalms-12-6: 6 The Lord’s words are true and pure,     like silver purified by fire, like silver purified by fire,     like silver melted seven times to make it perfectly pure. like silver melted seven times to make it perfectly pure.
Psalms-12-7: 7 Lord, take care of the helpless.     Protect them forever from the wicked people in this world. Protect them forever from the wicked people in this world.
Psalms-12-8: 8 The wicked are all around us,     and everyone thinks evil is something to be praised! and everyone thinks evil is something to be praised!
Psalms-13-1: To the director: A song of David. 13 How long will you forget me, Lord? 13 How long will you forget me, Lord?     Will you forget me forever? Will you forget me forever? How long will you refuse to accept me?[a]
Psalms-13-2: 2 How long must I wonder if you have forgotten me?     How long must I feel this sadness in my heart? How long must I feel this sadness in my heart? How long will my enemy win against me?
Psalms-13-3: 3 Lord my God, look at me and give me an answer.     Make me feel strong again, or I will die. Make me feel strong again, or I will die.
Psalms-13-4: 4 If that happens, my enemy will say, “I beat him!”     He will be so happy that he won. He will be so happy that he won.
Psalms-13-5: 5 But I trust in your faithful love, Lord.     I will be happy when you save me. I will be happy when you save me.
Psalms-13-6: 6 Then I will sing to the Lord     because he was so good to me. because he was so good to me.
Psalms-14-1: To the director: A song of David. 14 Only fools think there is no God. 14 Only fools think there is no God.     People like that are evil and do terrible things. People like that are evil and do terrible things.     They never do what is right. They never do what is right.
Psalms-14-2: 2 The Lord looks down from heaven     to see if there is anyone who is wise, to see if there is anyone who is wise,     anyone who looks to him for help. anyone who looks to him for help.
Psalms-14-3: 3 But everyone has gone the wrong way.     Everyone has turned bad. Everyone has turned bad. No one does anything good.     No, not one person! No, not one person!
Psalms-14-4: 4 Those who are evil treat my people like bread to be eaten.     And they never ask for the Lord’s help. And they never ask for the Lord’s help.     Don’t they know what they are doing? Don’t they know what they are doing?
Psalms-14-5: 5 They will have plenty to fear,     because God is with those who do what is right. because God is with those who do what is right.
Psalms-14-6: 6 You wicked people want to spoil the hopes of the poor,     but the Lord will protect them. but the Lord will protect them.
Psalms-14-7: 7 I wish the one who lives on Mount Zion     would bring victory to Israel! would bring victory to Israel! When the Lord makes his people successful again,     the people of Jacob will be happy; the people of Jacob will be happy;     the people of Israel will be glad. the people of Israel will be glad.
Psalms-15-1: A song of David. 15 Lord, who can live in your Holy Tent[a]? 15 Lord, who can live in your Holy Tent[a]?     Who can live on your holy mountain? Who can live on your holy mountain?
Psalms-15-2: 2 Only those who live pure lives, do what is right,     and speak the truth from their hearts. and speak the truth from their hearts.
Psalms-15-3: 3 Such people don’t say bad things about others.     They don’t do things to hurt their neighbors. They don’t do things to hurt their neighbors.     They don’t tell shameful things about those close to them. They don’t tell shameful things about those close to them.
Psalms-15-4: 4 They hate those who fail to please God     and honor those who respect the Lord. and honor those who respect the Lord. If they make a promise to their neighbor,     they do what they promised.[b] they do what they promised.[b]
Psalms-15-5: 5 If they loan money to someone,     they do not charge them interest. they do not charge them interest. And they refuse to testify against an innocent person,     even if someone offers them money to do it. even if someone offers them money to do it. Whoever lives like this will always stand strong.
Psalms-16-1: A miktam of David. 16 Protect me, God, because I depend on you. 16 Protect me, God, because I depend on you.
Psalms-16-2: 2 Some of you[a] have said to the Lord,     “You are my Lord. “You are my Lord.     Every good thing I have comes from you.” Every good thing I have comes from you.”
Psalms-16-3: 3 But you have also said about the gods[b] of this land,     “They are my powerful gods. “They are my powerful gods.     They are the ones who make me happy.” They are the ones who make me happy.”
Psalms-16-4: 4 But those who worship other gods will have many troubles.     I will not share in the gifts of blood they offer to their idols. I will not share in the gifts of blood they offer to their idols.     I will not even say their names. I will not even say their names.
Psalms-16-5: 5 Lord, you give me all that I need.     You support me. You support me.     You give me my share. You give me my share.
Psalms-16-6: 6 My share[c] is wonderful.     My inheritance[d] is very beautiful. My inheritance[d] is very beautiful.
Psalms-16-7: 7 I praise the Lord because he taught me well.     Even at night he put his instructions deep inside my mind.[e] Even at night he put his instructions deep inside my mind.[e]
Psalms-16-8: 8 I always remember that the Lord is with me.[f]     He is here, close by my side, He is here, close by my side,     so nothing can defeat me. so nothing can defeat me.
Psalms-16-9: 9 So my heart and soul will be very happy.     Even my body will live in safety, Even my body will live in safety,
Psalms-16-10: 10 because you will not leave me in the place of death.     You will not let your faithful one rot in the grave. You will not let your faithful one rot in the grave.
Psalms-16-11: 11 You will teach me the right way to live.     Just being with you will bring complete happiness. Just being with you will bring complete happiness.     Being at your right side will make me happy forever. Being at your right side will make me happy forever.
Psalms-17-1: A prayer of David.[a] 17 Lord, hear my prayer for justice. 17 Lord, hear my prayer for justice.     I am calling loudly to you. I am calling loudly to you. I am being honest in what I say,     so please listen to my prayer. so please listen to my prayer.
Psalms-17-2: 2 You will make the right decision,     because you can see the truth. because you can see the truth.
Psalms-17-3: 3 You were with me all night     and looked deep into my heart. and looked deep into my heart. You questioned me and found that     I did not say or do anything wrong. I did not say or do anything wrong.
Psalms-17-4: 4 Unlike most people, I have obeyed your commands,     so I have never been like those who are cruel and evil. so I have never been like those who are cruel and evil.
Psalms-17-5: 5 I have followed your way.     My feet never left your path. My feet never left your path.
Psalms-17-6: 6 Every time I call to you, God, you answer me.     So listen to me now, and hear what I say. So listen to me now, and hear what I say.
Psalms-17-7: 7 Show your amazing kindness     and rescue those who depend on you. and rescue those who depend on you. Use your great power     and protect them from their enemies. and protect them from their enemies.
Psalms-17-8: 8 Protect me like the pupil[b] of your eye.     Hide me in the shadow of your wings. Hide me in the shadow of your wings.
Psalms-17-9: 9 Save me from the wicked people who are trying to destroy me. Protect me from those who come to hurt me.
Psalms-17-10: 10 They think only of themselves     and brag about what they will do. and brag about what they will do.
Psalms-17-11: 11 They have been following me,     and now they are all around me. and now they are all around me. They watch me, waiting to throw me to the ground.
Psalms-17-12: 12 Like hungry lions, they want to kill and eat.     Like young lions, they hide, ready to attack. Like young lions, they hide, ready to attack.
Psalms-17-13: 13 Lord, get up[c] and face the enemy.     Make them surrender. Make them surrender.     Use your sword and save me from these wicked people. Use your sword and save me from these wicked people.
Psalms-17-14: 14 Use your power, Lord,     and remove them from this life. and remove them from this life. But as for the people you treasure,     fill them with food. fill them with food.     Give them plenty for their children and their grandchildren. Give them plenty for their children and their grandchildren.
Psalms-17-15: 15 I have done only what is right, so I will see your face.     And seeing you,[d] I will be fully satisfied. And seeing you,[d] I will be fully satisfied.
Psalms-18-1: [a] To the director: A song of David, the Lord’s servant. He sang this song to the Lord when the Lord saved him from Saul and all his other enemies. 18 I love you, Lord! 18 I love you, Lord!     You are my strength. You are my strength.
Psalms-18-2: 2 The Lord is my Rock, my fortress, my place of safety.     He is my God, the Rock I run to for protection. He is my God, the Rock I run to for protection. He is my shield; by his power I am saved.[b]     He is my hiding place high in the hills. He is my hiding place high in the hills.
Psalms-18-3: 3 I called to the Lord for help,     and he saved me from my enemies! and he saved me from my enemies!     He is worthy of my praise! He is worthy of my praise!
Psalms-18-4: 4 Death had its ropes wrapped around me.     A deadly flood was carrying me away. A deadly flood was carrying me away.
Psalms-18-5: 5 The ropes of the grave wrapped around me.     Death set its trap right there in front of me. Death set its trap right there in front of me.
Psalms-18-6: 6 In my trouble I called to the Lord.     Yes, I cried out to my God for help. Yes, I cried out to my God for help. There in his temple he heard my voice.     He heard my cry for help. He heard my cry for help.
Psalms-18-7: 7 The earth shook and shivered.     The foundations of the mountains trembled. The foundations of the mountains trembled.     They shook because he was angry. They shook because he was angry.
Psalms-18-8: 8 Smoke came from his nose.     Burning flames came from his mouth. Burning flames came from his mouth.     Red-hot coals fell from him. Red-hot coals fell from him.
Psalms-18-9: 9 He tore open the sky and came down!     He stood on a thick, dark cloud. He stood on a thick, dark cloud.
Psalms-18-10: 10 He flew across the sky, riding on a Cherub angel     racing on the wings of the wind. racing on the wings of the wind.
Psalms-18-11: 11 He wrapped himself in darkness that covered him like a tent.     He was hidden by dark clouds heavy with water. He was hidden by dark clouds heavy with water.
Psalms-18-12: 12 Out of the brightness before him,     hail broke through the clouds with flashes of lightning. hail broke through the clouds with flashes of lightning.
Psalms-18-13: 13 The Lord thundered from the sky;     God Most High let his voice be heard.[c] God Most High let his voice be heard.[c]
Psalms-18-14: 14 He scattered his enemies with his arrows—     the lightning bolts that threw them into confusion. the lightning bolts that threw them into confusion.
Psalms-18-15: 15 Lord, you shouted your command,     and a powerful wind began to blow.[d] and a powerful wind began to blow.[d] Then the bottom of the sea could be seen,     and the earth’s foundations were uncovered. and the earth’s foundations were uncovered.
Psalms-18-16: 16 He reached down from above and grabbed me.     He pulled me from the deep water. He pulled me from the deep water.
Psalms-18-17: 17 He saved me from my powerful enemies, who hated me.     They were too strong for me, so he saved me. They were too strong for me, so he saved me.
Psalms-18-18: 18 They attacked me in my time of trouble,     but the Lord was there to support me. but the Lord was there to support me.
Psalms-18-19: 19 He was pleased with me, so he rescued me.     He took me to a safe place. He took me to a safe place.
Psalms-18-20: 20 The Lord rewarded me for doing what is right.     He was good to me because I am innocent. He was good to me because I am innocent.
Psalms-18-21: 21 The Lord did this because I have obeyed him.     I have not turned against my God. I have not turned against my God.
Psalms-18-22: 22 I always remembered his laws.     I never rejected his rules. I never rejected his rules.
Psalms-18-23: 23 He knows I did nothing that was wrong.     I have kept myself from sinning. I have kept myself from sinning.
Psalms-18-24: 24 So the Lord rewarded me for doing what is right.     He could see that I am innocent. He could see that I am innocent.
Psalms-18-25: 25 Lord, you are faithful to those who are faithful.     You are good to those who are good. You are good to those who are good.
Psalms-18-26: 26 You never do wrong to those who have done no wrong.     But you outsmart the wicked, no matter how clever they are. But you outsmart the wicked, no matter how clever they are.
Psalms-18-27: 27 You help those who are humble,     but you humiliate the proud. but you humiliate the proud.
Psalms-18-28: 28 Lord, you provide the flame for my lamp.     You, God, turn the darkness around me into light. You, God, turn the darkness around me into light.
Psalms-18-29: 29 With your help I can defeat an army.     If my God is with me, I can climb over enemy walls. If my God is with me, I can climb over enemy walls.
Psalms-18-30: 30 God’s way is perfect.     The Lord’s promise always proves to be true. The Lord’s promise always proves to be true.     He protects those who trust in him. He protects those who trust in him.
Psalms-18-31: 31 There is no God except the Lord.     There is no Rock except our God. There is no Rock except our God.
Psalms-18-32: 32 God is the one who gives me strength.     He clears the path I need to take. He clears the path I need to take.
Psalms-18-33: 33 He makes my feet as steady as those of a deer.     Even on steep mountains he keeps me from falling. Even on steep mountains he keeps me from falling.
Psalms-18-34: 34 He trains me for war     so that my arms can bend the most powerful bow. so that my arms can bend the most powerful bow.
Psalms-18-35: 35 Lord, you have given me your shield to protect me.     You support me with your right hand. You support me with your right hand.     It is your help that has made me great. It is your help that has made me great.
Psalms-18-36: 36 You cleared a path for my feet     so that I could walk without stumbling. so that I could walk without stumbling.
Psalms-18-37: 37 I chased my enemies and caught them.     I did not stop until they were destroyed. I did not stop until they were destroyed.
Psalms-18-38: 38 I struck them down, and they could not get up again.     They fell under my feet. They fell under my feet.
Psalms-18-39: 39 God, you made me strong in battle.     You made my enemies fall before me. You made my enemies fall before me.
Psalms-18-40: 40 You made my enemies turn and run away.     I destroyed those who hated me. I destroyed those who hated me.
Psalms-18-41: 41 They cried out for help,     but there was no one to save them. but there was no one to save them. They cried out to the Lord,     but he did not answer them. but he did not answer them.
Psalms-18-42: 42 I beat them to pieces like dust blown by the wind.     I smashed them like mud in the streets. I smashed them like mud in the streets.
Psalms-18-43: 43 You saved me from those who fought against me.     You made me the ruler over nations. You made me the ruler over nations.     People I never knew now serve me. People I never knew now serve me.
Psalms-18-44: 44 As soon as they heard about me, they were ready to obey.     Those foreigners fall helpless before me! Those foreigners fall helpless before me!
Psalms-18-45: 45 They lose all their courage     and come out of their hiding places shaking with fear. and come out of their hiding places shaking with fear.
Psalms-18-46: 46 The Lord lives!     I praise my Rock, the God who saves me. I praise my Rock, the God who saves me.     How great he is! How great he is!
Psalms-18-47: 47 He is the God who punishes my enemies for me,     the one who puts people under my control. the one who puts people under my control.
Psalms-18-48: 48 He saves me from my enemies! You, Lord, help me defeat those who attack me.     You save me from cruel people. You save me from cruel people.
Psalms-18-49: 49 Lord, that is why I praise you among the nations.     That is why I sing songs of praise to your name. That is why I sing songs of praise to your name.
Psalms-18-50: 50 The Lord helps his king win battle after battle.     He shows his faithful love to his chosen one,[e] He shows his faithful love to his chosen one,[e]     to David and his descendants forever. to David and his descendants forever.
Psalms-19-1: To the director: A song of David. 19 The heavens tell about the glory of God. 19 The heavens tell about the glory of God.     The skies announce what his hands have made. The skies announce what his hands have made.
Psalms-19-2: 2 Each new day tells more of the story,     and each night reveals more and more about God’s power.[a] and each night reveals more and more about God’s power.[a]
Psalms-19-3: 3 You cannot hear them say anything.     They don’t make any sound we can hear. They don’t make any sound we can hear.
Psalms-19-4: 4 But their message goes throughout the world.     Their teaching reaches the ends of the earth. Their teaching reaches the ends of the earth. The sun’s tent is set up in the heavens.
Psalms-19-5: 5     It comes out like a happy bridegroom from his bedroom. 5     It comes out like a happy bridegroom from his bedroom. It begins its path across the sky     like an athlete eager to run a race. like an athlete eager to run a race.
Psalms-19-6: 6 It starts at one end of the sky     and runs all the way to the other end. and runs all the way to the other end.     Nothing can hide from its heat. Nothing can hide from its heat.
Psalms-19-7: 7 The Lord’s teachings are perfect.     They give strength to his people. They give strength to his people. The Lord’s rules can be trusted.     They help even the foolish become wise. They help even the foolish become wise.
Psalms-19-8: 8 The Lord’s laws are right.     They make people happy. They make people happy. The Lord’s commands are good.     They show people the right way to live. They show people the right way to live.
Psalms-19-9: 9 Learning respect for the Lord is good.     It will last forever. It will last forever. The Lord’s judgments are right.     They are completely fair. They are completely fair.
Psalms-19-10: 10 His teachings are worth more than pure gold.     They are sweeter than the best honey dripping from the honeycomb. They are sweeter than the best honey dripping from the honeycomb.
Psalms-19-11: 11 His teachings warn his servants,     and good things come to those who obey them. and good things come to those who obey them.
Psalms-19-12: 12 People cannot see their own mistakes,     so don’t let me commit secret sins. so don’t let me commit secret sins.
Psalms-19-13: 13 Don’t let me do what I know is wrong.     Don’t let sin control me. Don’t let sin control me. If you help me, I can be pure     and free from sin. and free from sin.
Psalms-19-14: 14 May my words and thoughts please you.     Lord, you are my Rock—the one who rescues me. Lord, you are my Rock—the one who rescues me.
Psalms-20-1: To the director: A song of David. 20 May the Lord answer you in times of trouble. 20 May the Lord answer you in times of trouble.     May the God of Jacob protect you. May the God of Jacob protect you.
Psalms-20-2: 2 May he send you help from his Holy Place.     May he support you from Zion. May he support you from Zion.
Psalms-20-3: 3 May he remember all the gifts you have offered.     May he accept all your sacrifices. Selah May he accept all your sacrifices. Selah
Psalms-20-4: 4 May he give you what you really want.     May he make all your plans successful. May he make all your plans successful.
Psalms-20-5: 5 We will celebrate when he helps you.     We will praise the name of God. We will praise the name of God. May the Lord give you everything you ask for.
Psalms-20-6: 6 Now I know the Lord helps his chosen king.     From his holy heaven he answered. From his holy heaven he answered.     With his great power he saved him. With his great power he saved him.
Psalms-20-7: 7 Some give the credit for victory to their chariots and soldiers,     but we honor the Lord our God. but we honor the Lord our God.
Psalms-20-8: 8 They fall in battle, totally defeated,     but we survive and stand strong! but we survive and stand strong!
Psalms-20-9: 9 Lord, save the king!     Answer us when we call to you for help. Answer us when we call to you for help.
Psalms-21-1: To the director: A song of David. 21 Lord, your strength makes the king happy. 21 Lord, your strength makes the king happy.     He is so happy when you give him victory. He is so happy when you give him victory.
Psalms-21-2: 2 And you gave him what he wanted.     You gave him what he asked for. Selah You gave him what he asked for. Selah
Psalms-21-3: 3 You gave the king such wonderful blessings.     You put a golden crown on his head. You put a golden crown on his head.
Psalms-21-4: 4 He asked for life, and you gave it.     You gave him life that goes on forever. You gave him life that goes on forever.
Psalms-21-5: 5 You led him to victory that brought him great glory.     You gave him honor and fame. You gave him honor and fame.
Psalms-21-6: 6 You have given him blessings that will last forever.     You have given him the joy of being near you. You have given him the joy of being near you.
Psalms-21-7: 7 The king trusts in the Lord,     and the faithful love of God Most High will keep him from falling. and the faithful love of God Most High will keep him from falling.
Psalms-21-8: 8 Lord, you will show all your enemies that you are strong.     Your power will defeat those who hate you. Your power will defeat those who hate you.
Psalms-21-9: 9 When you appear,     you will burn them up like a blazing furnace. you will burn them up like a blazing furnace. In your anger, Lord, you will completely destroy them;     they will be swallowed by flames of fire.[a] they will be swallowed by flames of fire.[a]
Psalms-21-10: 10 Their families will be destroyed.     They will be removed from the earth. They will be removed from the earth.
Psalms-21-11: 11 That is because they made evil plans against you.     They wanted to do things they could not do. They wanted to do things they could not do.
Psalms-21-12: 12 You will make them turn and run away     when you aim your arrows at their faces. when you aim your arrows at their faces.
Psalms-21-13: 13 Lord, we lift you up with our songs of praise.     We sing and play songs about your power! We sing and play songs about your power!
Psalms-22-1: To the director: To the tune “The Deer of Dawn.”[a] A song of David. 22 My God, my God, why have you left me? 22 My God, my God, why have you left me?     You seem too far away to save me, You seem too far away to save me,     too far to hear my cries for help! too far to hear my cries for help!
Psalms-22-2: 2 My God, I kept calling by day,     and I was not silent at night. and I was not silent at night. But you did not answer me.
Psalms-22-3: 3 God, you are the Holy One.     You sit as King upon the praises of Israel. You sit as King upon the praises of Israel.
Psalms-22-4: 4 Our ancestors trusted you.     Yes, they trusted you, and you saved them. Yes, they trusted you, and you saved them.
Psalms-22-5: 5 They called to you for help and escaped their enemies.     They trusted you and were not disappointed! They trusted you and were not disappointed!
Psalms-22-6: 6 But I feel like a worm, less than human!     People insult me and look down on me. People insult me and look down on me.
Psalms-22-7: 7 Everyone who sees me makes fun of me.     They shake their heads and stick out their tongues at me. They shake their heads and stick out their tongues at me.
Psalms-22-8: 8 They say, “Call to the Lord for help.     Maybe he will save you. Maybe he will save you.     If he likes you so much, surely he will rescue you!” If he likes you so much, surely he will rescue you!”
Psalms-22-9: 9 God, the truth is, you are the one who brought me into this world.     You made me feel safe while I was still at my mother’s breasts. You made me feel safe while I was still at my mother’s breasts.
Psalms-22-10: 10 You have been my God since the day I was born.     I was thrown into your arms as I came from my mother’s womb. I was thrown into your arms as I came from my mother’s womb.
Psalms-22-11: 11 So don’t leave me!     Trouble is near, and there is no one to help me. Trouble is near, and there is no one to help me.
Psalms-22-12: 12 My enemies surround me like angry bulls.     They are like the powerful bulls of Bashan, and they are all around me. They are like the powerful bulls of Bashan, and they are all around me.
Psalms-22-13: 13 Their mouths are opened wide,     like a lion roaring and tearing at its prey. like a lion roaring and tearing at its prey.
Psalms-22-14: 14 My strength is gone,     like water poured out on the ground. like water poured out on the ground. My bones have separated.     My courage is gone.[b] My courage is gone.[b]
Psalms-22-15: 15 My mouth[c] is as dry as a piece of baked pottery.     My tongue is sticking to the roof of my mouth. My tongue is sticking to the roof of my mouth.     You have left me dying in the dust. You have left me dying in the dust.
Psalms-22-16: 16 The “dogs” are all around me—     a pack[d] of evil people has trapped me. a pack[d] of evil people has trapped me.     They have pierced my hands and feet.[e] They have pierced my hands and feet.[e]
Psalms-22-17: 17 I can see each one of my bones.     My enemies are looking at me; My enemies are looking at me;     they just keep staring. they just keep staring.
Psalms-22-18: 18 They divide my clothes among themselves,     and they throw lots for what I am wearing. and they throw lots for what I am wearing.
Psalms-22-19: 19 Lord, don’t leave me!     You are my strength—hurry and help me! You are my strength—hurry and help me!
Psalms-22-20: 20 Save me from the sword.     Save my precious life from these dogs. Save my precious life from these dogs.
Psalms-22-21: 21 Rescue me from the lion’s mouth.     Protect me from the horns of the bulls.[f] Protect me from the horns of the bulls.[f]
Psalms-22-22: 22 I will tell my people about you.     I will praise you in the great assembly. I will praise you in the great assembly.
Psalms-22-23: 23 Praise the Lord, all you who worship him!     Honor him, you descendants of Jacob! Honor him, you descendants of Jacob!     Fear and respect him, all you people of Israel! Fear and respect him, all you people of Israel!
Psalms-22-24: 24 He does not ignore those who need help.     He does not hate them. He does not hate them. He does not turn away from them.     He listens when they cry for help. He listens when they cry for help.
Psalms-22-25: 25 Lord, because of you I offer praise in the great assembly.     In front of all these worshipers I will do all that I promised. In front of all these worshipers I will do all that I promised.
Psalms-22-26: 26 Poor people, come eat and be satisfied.[g]     You who have come looking for the Lord, praise him! You who have come looking for the Lord, praise him!     May your hearts be happy[h] forever. May your hearts be happy[h] forever.
Psalms-22-27: 27 May those in faraway countries remember the Lord and come back to him.     May those in distant lands worship him, May those in distant lands worship him,
Psalms-22-28: 28 because the Lord is the King.     He rules all nations. He rules all nations.
Psalms-22-29: 29 The people have eaten all they wanted     and bowed down to worship him. and bowed down to worship him. Yes, everyone will bow down to him—     all who are on the way to the grave, unable to hold on to life. all who are on the way to the grave, unable to hold on to life.
Psalms-22-30: 30 Our descendants will serve him.     Those who are not yet born will be told about him. Those who are not yet born will be told about him.
Psalms-22-31: 31 Each generation will tell their children     about the good things the Lord has done. about the good things the Lord has done.
Psalms-23-1: A song of David. 23 The Lord is my shepherd. 23 The Lord is my shepherd.     I will always have everything I need.[a] I will always have everything I need.[a]
Psalms-23-2: 2 He gives me green pastures to lie in.     He leads me by calm pools of water. He leads me by calm pools of water.
Psalms-23-3: 3 He restores my strength.     He leads me on right paths[b] to show that he is good. He leads me on right paths[b] to show that he is good.
Psalms-23-4: 4 Even if I walk through a valley as dark as the grave,[c]     I will not be afraid of any danger, because you are with me. I will not be afraid of any danger, because you are with me.     Your rod and staff[d] comfort me. Your rod and staff[d] comfort me.
Psalms-23-5: 5 You prepared a meal for me in front of my enemies.     You welcomed me as an honored guest.[e] You welcomed me as an honored guest.[e]     My cup is full and spilling over. My cup is full and spilling over.
Psalms-23-6: 6 Your goodness and mercy will be with me all my life,     and I will live in the Lord’s house[f] a long, long time.[g] and I will live in the Lord’s house[f] a long, long time.[g]
Psalms-24-1: A song of David. 24 The earth and everything on it belong to the Lord. 24 The earth and everything on it belong to the Lord.     The world and all its people belong to him. The world and all its people belong to him.
Psalms-24-2: 2 He built the earth on the water.     He built it over the rivers. He built it over the rivers.
Psalms-24-3: 3 Who can go up on the Lord’s mountain[a]?     Who can stand in his holy Temple? Who can stand in his holy Temple?
Psalms-24-4: 4 Only those who have not done evil,     who have pure hearts, who have pure hearts, who have not used my name[b] to hide their lies,     and who have not made false promises. and who have not made false promises.
Psalms-24-5: 5 Good people ask the Lord to bless others.     They ask God, their Savior, to do good things. They ask God, their Savior, to do good things.
Psalms-24-6: 6 They try to follow God.     They go to the God of Jacob for help. Selah They go to the God of Jacob for help. Selah
Psalms-24-7: 7 Gates, proudly lift your heads!     Open, ancient doors, Open, ancient doors,     and the glorious King will come in. and the glorious King will come in.
Psalms-24-8: 8 Who is the glorious King?     He is the Lord, the powerful soldier. He is the Lord, the powerful soldier.     He is the Lord, the war hero. He is the Lord, the war hero.
Psalms-24-9: 9 Gates, proudly lift your heads!     Open, ancient doors, Open, ancient doors,     and the glorious King will come in. and the glorious King will come in.
Psalms-24-10: 10 Who is the glorious King?     The Lord All-Powerful is the glorious King. Selah The Lord All-Powerful is the glorious King. Selah
Psalms-25-1: [a] A song of David. 25 Lord, I put my life in your hands.[b] 25 Lord, I put my life in your hands.[b]
Psalms-25-2: 2     I trust in you, my God, 2     I trust in you, my God, and I will not be disappointed.     My enemies will not laugh at me. My enemies will not laugh at me.
Psalms-25-3: 3 No one who trusts in you will be disappointed.     But disappointment will come to those who try to deceive others. But disappointment will come to those who try to deceive others.     They will get nothing. They will get nothing.
Psalms-25-4: 4 Lord, help me learn your ways.     Show me how you want me to live. Show me how you want me to live.
Psalms-25-5: 5 Guide me and teach me your truths.     You are my God, my Savior. You are my God, my Savior.     You are the one I have been waiting for. You are the one I have been waiting for.
Psalms-25-6: 6 Remember to be kind to me, Lord.     Show me the tender love that you have always had. Show me the tender love that you have always had.
Psalms-25-7: 7 Don’t remember the sinful things I did when I was young.     Because you are good, Lord, remember me with your faithful love. Because you are good, Lord, remember me with your faithful love.
Psalms-25-8: 8 The Lord is good and does what is right.     He shows sinners the right way to live. He shows sinners the right way to live.
Psalms-25-9: 9 He teaches his ways to humble people.     He leads them with fairness. He leads them with fairness.
Psalms-25-10: 10 The Lord is kind and true to those     who obey what he said in his agreement. who obey what he said in his agreement.
Psalms-25-11: 11 Lord, I have done many wrong things.     But I ask you to forgive them all to show your goodness. But I ask you to forgive them all to show your goodness.
Psalms-25-12: 12 When people choose to follow the Lord,     he shows them the best way to live. he shows them the best way to live.
Psalms-25-13: 13 They will enjoy good things,     and their children will get the land God promised. and their children will get the land God promised.
Psalms-25-14: 14 The Lord tells his secrets to his followers.     He teaches them about his agreement. He teaches them about his agreement.
Psalms-25-15: 15 I always look to the Lord for help.     Only he can free me from my troubles.[c] Only he can free me from my troubles.[c]
Psalms-25-16: 16 I am hurt and lonely.     Turn to me, and show me mercy. Turn to me, and show me mercy.
Psalms-25-17: 17 Free me from my troubles.     Help me solve my problems. Help me solve my problems.
Psalms-25-18: 18 Look at my trials and troubles.     Forgive me for all the sins I have done. Forgive me for all the sins I have done.
Psalms-25-19: 19 Look at all the enemies I have.     They hate me and want to hurt me. They hate me and want to hurt me.
Psalms-25-20: 20 Protect me! Save me from them!     I come to you for protection, so don’t let me be disappointed. I come to you for protection, so don’t let me be disappointed.
Psalms-25-21: 21 You are good and do what is right.     I trust you to protect me. I trust you to protect me.
Psalms-25-22: 22 God, save the people of Israel     from all their enemies. from all their enemies.
Psalms-26-1: A song of David. 26 Lord, you be the judge and prove that I have lived a pure life. 26 Lord, you be the judge and prove that I have lived a pure life.     I have depended on you, Lord, to keep me from falling. I have depended on you, Lord, to keep me from falling.
Psalms-26-2: 2 Look closely at me, Lord, and test me.     Judge my deepest thoughts and emotions. Judge my deepest thoughts and emotions.
Psalms-26-3: 3 I always remember your faithful love.     I depend on your faithfulness. I depend on your faithfulness.
Psalms-26-4: 4 I don’t run around with troublemakers.     I have nothing to do with hypocrites. I have nothing to do with hypocrites.
Psalms-26-5: 5 I hate being around evil people.     I refuse to join those gangs of crooks. I refuse to join those gangs of crooks.
Psalms-26-6: 6 Lord, I wash my hands to make myself pure,     so that I can come to your altar. so that I can come to your altar.
Psalms-26-7: 7 I sing a song to give you thanks,     and I tell about all the wonderful things you have done. and I tell about all the wonderful things you have done.
Psalms-26-8: 8 Lord, I love the house[a] where you live,     the place where your glory is. the place where your glory is.
Psalms-26-9: 9 Lord, don’t treat me like one of those sinners.     Don’t kill me with those murderers. Don’t kill me with those murderers.
Psalms-26-10: 10 They are guilty of cheating people.     They take bribes to do wrong. They take bribes to do wrong.
Psalms-26-11: 11 But I am innocent,     so be kind to me and save me. so be kind to me and save me.
Psalms-26-12: 12 I am safe from all danger     as I stand here praising you, Lord, in the assembly of your people. as I stand here praising you, Lord, in the assembly of your people.
Psalms-27-1: A song of David. 27 Lord, you are my Light and my Savior, 27 Lord, you are my Light and my Savior,     so why should I be afraid of anyone? so why should I be afraid of anyone? The Lord is where my life is safe,     so I will be afraid of no one! so I will be afraid of no one!
Psalms-27-2: 2 Evil people might attack me.     They might try to destroy my body. They might try to destroy my body. Yes, my enemies might attack me and try to destroy me,     but they will stumble and fall. but they will stumble and fall.
Psalms-27-3: 3 Even if an army surrounds me, I will not be afraid.     Even if people attack me in war, I will trust in the Lord. Even if people attack me in war, I will trust in the Lord.
Psalms-27-4: 4 I ask only one thing from the Lord.     This is what I want most: This is what I want most: Let me live in the Lord’s house all my life,     enjoying the Lord’s beauty enjoying the Lord’s beauty     and spending time in his palace.[a] and spending time in his palace.[a]
Psalms-27-5: 5 He will protect me when I am in danger.     He will hide me in his tent.[b] He will hide me in his tent.[b]     He will take me up to his place of safety. He will take me up to his place of safety.
Psalms-27-6: 6 If he will help me defeat the enemies around me,     I will offer sacrifices in his tent with shouts of joy. I will offer sacrifices in his tent with shouts of joy.     I will sing and play songs to honor the Lord. I will sing and play songs to honor the Lord.
Psalms-27-7: 7 Lord, hear my voice.     Be kind and answer me. Be kind and answer me.
Psalms-27-8: 8 My heart told me to come to you, Lord,     so I am coming to ask for your help. so I am coming to ask for your help.
Psalms-27-9: 9 Don’t turn away from me.     Don’t be angry with your servant. Don’t be angry with your servant.     You are the only one who can help me. You are the only one who can help me. My God, don’t leave me all alone.     You are my Savior. You are my Savior.
Psalms-27-10: 10 Even if my mother and father leave me,     the Lord will take me in. the Lord will take me in.
Psalms-27-11: 11 I have enemies, Lord, so teach me your ways.     Show me the right way to live. Show me the right way to live.
Psalms-27-12: 12 My enemies have attacked me.     They have told lies about me and have tried to hurt me. They have told lies about me and have tried to hurt me.
Psalms-27-13: 13 But I really believe     that I will see the Lord’s goodness before I die.[c] that I will see the Lord’s goodness before I die.[c]
Psalms-27-14: 14 Wait for the Lord’s help.     Be strong and brave, Be strong and brave,     and wait for the Lord’s help. and wait for the Lord’s help.
Psalms-28-1: A song of David. 28 Lord, you are my Rock. 28 Lord, you are my Rock.     I am calling to you for help. I am calling to you for help.     Don’t close your ears to my prayers. Don’t close your ears to my prayers. If you don’t answer me,     I will be counted among the dead. I will be counted among the dead.
Psalms-28-2: 2 I lift my hands and pray toward your Most Holy Place.     Hear me when I call to you. Hear me when I call to you.     Show mercy to me. Show mercy to me.
Psalms-28-3: 3 Don’t treat me like the evil people     who do wicked things. who do wicked things. They greet their neighbors like friends,     but secretly plan to hurt them. but secretly plan to hurt them.
Psalms-28-4: 4 They do bad things to others,     so make bad things happen to them. so make bad things happen to them.     Give them the punishment they deserve. Give them the punishment they deserve.
Psalms-28-5: 5 They don’t notice what the Lord does.     They ignore all the good things he has made. They ignore all the good things he has made. So instead of building them up,     he will destroy them. he will destroy them.
Psalms-28-6: 6 Praise the Lord!     He has heard my prayer for mercy. He has heard my prayer for mercy.
Psalms-28-7: 7 The Lord is my strength and shield.     I trusted him with all my heart. I trusted him with all my heart. He helped me, so I am happy.     I sing songs of praise to him. I sing songs of praise to him.
Psalms-28-8: 8 The Lord protects his chosen one.[a]     He saves him and gives him strength. He saves him and gives him strength.
Psalms-28-9: 9 Save your people.     Bless those who belong to you. Bless those who belong to you.     Lead them and honor them[b] forever. Lead them and honor them[b] forever.
Psalms-29-1: A song of David. 29 Praise the Lord, you heavenly angels[a]! 29 Praise the Lord, you heavenly angels[a]!     Praise the Lord’s glory and power. Praise the Lord’s glory and power.
Psalms-29-2: 2 Praise the Lord and honor his name!     Worship the Lord in all his holy beauty. Worship the Lord in all his holy beauty.
Psalms-29-3: 3 The Lord’s voice can be heard over the sea.     The voice of our glorious Lord God is like thunder over the great ocean. The voice of our glorious Lord God is like thunder over the great ocean.
Psalms-29-4: 4 The Lord’s voice is powerful.     It shows the Lord’s glory. It shows the Lord’s glory.
Psalms-29-5: 5 The Lord’s voice shatters great cedar trees.     The Lord breaks the great cedars of Lebanon. The Lord breaks the great cedars of Lebanon.
Psalms-29-6: 6 He makes Lebanon shake like a young calf dancing.     Sirion[b] trembles like a young bull jumping up and down. Sirion[b] trembles like a young bull jumping up and down.
Psalms-29-7: 7 The Lord’s voice cuts the air with flashes of lightning.
Psalms-29-8: 8 The Lord’s voice shakes the desert.     The desert of Kadesh[c] trembles at the Lord’s voice. The desert of Kadesh[c] trembles at the Lord’s voice.
Psalms-29-9: 9 The Lord’s voice frightens the deer.[d]     He destroys the forests. He destroys the forests. In his temple everyone shouts, “Glory to God!”
Psalms-29-10: 10 The Lord ruled as king at the time of the flood,     and the Lord will rule as king forever. and the Lord will rule as king forever.
Psalms-29-11: 11 May the Lord make his people strong.     May the Lord bless his people with peace. May the Lord bless his people with peace.
Psalms-30-1: A song of David for the dedication of the Temple.[a] 30 Lord, you lifted me out of my troubles. 30 Lord, you lifted me out of my troubles.     You did not give my enemies a reason to laugh, You did not give my enemies a reason to laugh,     so I will praise you. so I will praise you.
Psalms-30-2: 2 Lord my God, I prayed to you,     and you healed me. and you healed me.
Psalms-30-3: 3 Lord, you lifted me out of the grave.     I was falling into the place of death, but you saved my life. I was falling into the place of death, but you saved my life.
Psalms-30-4: 4 Praise the Lord, you who are loyal to him!     Praise his holy name[b]! Praise his holy name[b]!
Psalms-30-5: 5 His anger lasts for a little while,     but then his kindness brings life. but then his kindness brings life. The night may be filled with tears,     but in the morning we can sing for joy! but in the morning we can sing for joy!
Psalms-30-6: 6 When I was safe and secure,     I thought nothing could hurt me. I thought nothing could hurt me.
Psalms-30-7: 7 Yes, Lord, while you were kind to me,     I felt that nothing could defeat me.[c] I felt that nothing could defeat me.[c] But when you turned away from me,     I was filled with fear. I was filled with fear.
Psalms-30-8: 8 So, Lord, I turned and prayed to you.     I asked you, Lord, to show me mercy. I asked you, Lord, to show me mercy.
Psalms-30-9: 9 I said, “What good is it if I die     and go down to the grave? and go down to the grave? The dead just lie in the dirt.     They cannot praise you. They cannot praise you.     They cannot tell anyone how faithful you are. They cannot tell anyone how faithful you are.
Psalms-30-10: 10 Lord, hear my prayer, and be kind to me.     Lord, help me!” Lord, help me!”
Psalms-30-11: 11 You have changed my sorrow into dancing.     You have taken away my sackcloth You have taken away my sackcloth     and clothed me with joy. and clothed me with joy.
Psalms-30-12: 12 You wanted me to praise you and not be silent.     Lord my God, I will praise you forever! Lord my God, I will praise you forever!
Psalms-31-1: To the director: A song of David. 31 Lord, I come to you for protection. 31 Lord, I come to you for protection.     Don’t let me be disappointed. Don’t let me be disappointed.     You always do what is right, so save me. You always do what is right, so save me.
Psalms-31-2: 2     Listen to me. 2     Listen to me.     Come quickly and save me. Come quickly and save me. Be my Rock, my place of safety.     Be my fortress and protect me! Be my fortress and protect me!
Psalms-31-3: 3 Yes, you are my Rock and my protection.     For the good of your name, lead me and guide me. For the good of your name, lead me and guide me.
Psalms-31-4: 4 Save me from the traps my enemy has set.     You are my place of safety. You are my place of safety.
Psalms-31-5: 5 Lord, you are the God we can trust.     I put my life[a] in your hands. I put my life[a] in your hands.     Save me! Save me!
Psalms-31-6: 6 I hate those who worship false gods.     I trust only in the Lord. I trust only in the Lord.
Psalms-31-7: 7 Your kindness makes me so happy.     You have seen my suffering. You have seen my suffering.     You know about the troubles I have. You know about the troubles I have.
Psalms-31-8: 8 You will not let my enemies take me.     You will free me from their traps. You will free me from their traps.
Psalms-31-9: 9 Lord, I have many troubles, so be kind to me.     I have cried until my eyes hurt. I have cried until my eyes hurt.     My throat and stomach are aching. My throat and stomach are aching.
Psalms-31-10: 10 Because of my sin, my life is ending in grief;     my years are passing away in sighs of pain. my years are passing away in sighs of pain. My life is ending in weakness.     My strength is draining away. My strength is draining away.
Psalms-31-11: 11 My enemies despise me,     and even my neighbors have turned away. and even my neighbors have turned away. When my friends see me in the street,     they turn the other way. they turn the other way.     They are afraid to be around me. They are afraid to be around me.
Psalms-31-12: 12 People want to forget me like someone already dead,     thrown away like a broken dish. thrown away like a broken dish.
Psalms-31-13: 13 I hear them whispering about me.     They have turned against me and plan to kill me. They have turned against me and plan to kill me.
Psalms-31-14: 14 Lord, I trust in you.     You are my God. You are my God.
Psalms-31-15: 15 My life is in your hands.     Save me from those who are persecuting me. Save me from those who are persecuting me.
Psalms-31-16: 16 Please welcome and accept your servant.[b]     Be kind to me and save me. Be kind to me and save me.
Psalms-31-17: 17 Lord, I am praying to you.     Don’t let me be disappointed. Don’t let me be disappointed. The wicked are the ones who should be disappointed.     Let them go to the grave in silence. Let them go to the grave in silence.
Psalms-31-18: 18 Those evil people brag     and tell lies about those who do right. and tell lies about those who do right. They are so proud now,     but their lying lips will be silent. but their lying lips will be silent.
Psalms-31-19: 19 Lord, you have hidden away many wonderful things for your followers.     You have done so many good things for those who trust in you. You have done so many good things for those who trust in you.     You have blessed them so that all the world can see. You have blessed them so that all the world can see.
Psalms-31-20: 20 Others make plans to hurt them.     They say such bad things about them. They say such bad things about them.     But you hide your people in your shelter and protect them. But you hide your people in your shelter and protect them.
Psalms-31-21: 21 Praise the Lord, because he showed me how wonderful his faithful love is     when the city was surrounded by enemies. when the city was surrounded by enemies.
Psalms-31-22: 22 I was afraid and said, “I am in a place where he cannot see me.”     But I prayed to you, and you heard my loud cries for help. But I prayed to you, and you heard my loud cries for help.
Psalms-31-23: 23 Love the Lord, all of you who are his loyal followers.     The Lord protects those who are loyal to him. The Lord protects those who are loyal to him. But he punishes those who brag about their own power.     He gives them all the punishment they deserve. He gives them all the punishment they deserve.
Psalms-31-24: 24 Be strong and brave,     all of you who are waiting for the Lord’s help. all of you who are waiting for the Lord’s help.
Psalms-32-1: A maskil of David. 32 It is a great blessing 32 It is a great blessing     when people are forgiven for the wrongs they have done, when people are forgiven for the wrongs they have done,     when their sins are erased.[a] when their sins are erased.[a]
Psalms-32-2: 2 It is a great blessing     when the Lord says they are not guilty, when the Lord says they are not guilty,     when they don’t try to hide their sins. when they don’t try to hide their sins.
Psalms-32-3: 3 Lord, I prayed to you again and again,     but I did not talk about my sins. but I did not talk about my sins.     So I only became weaker and more miserable. So I only became weaker and more miserable.
Psalms-32-4: 4 Every day you made life harder for me.     I became like a dry land in the hot summertime. Selah I became like a dry land in the hot summertime. Selah
Psalms-32-5: 5 But then I decided to confess my sins to the Lord.     I stopped hiding my guilt and told you about my sins. I stopped hiding my guilt and told you about my sins.     And you forgave them all! Selah And you forgave them all! Selah
Psalms-32-6: 6 That is why your loyal followers pray to you while there is still time.     Then when trouble rises like a flood, it will not reach them. Then when trouble rises like a flood, it will not reach them.
Psalms-32-7: 7 You are a hiding place for me.     You protect me from my troubles. You protect me from my troubles. You surround me and protect me,     so I sing about the way you saved me. Selah so I sing about the way you saved me. Selah
Psalms-32-8: 8 The Lord says, “I will teach you     and guide you in the way you should live. and guide you in the way you should live.     I will watch over you and be your guide. I will watch over you and be your guide.
Psalms-32-9: 9 Don’t be like a stupid horse or mule that will not come to you     unless you put a bit in its mouth and pull it with reins.” unless you put a bit in its mouth and pull it with reins.”
Psalms-32-10: 10 Many pains will come to the wicked,     but the Lord’s faithful love will surround those who trust in him. but the Lord’s faithful love will surround those who trust in him.
Psalms-32-11: 11 Good people, rejoice and be very happy in the Lord.     All you who want to do right, rejoice! All you who want to do right, rejoice!
Psalms-33-1: 33 Rejoice in the Lord, good people! 33 Rejoice in the Lord, good people!     It is only right for good people to praise him. It is only right for good people to praise him.
Psalms-33-2: 2 Play the lyre and praise the Lord.     Play the ten-stringed harp for him. Play the ten-stringed harp for him.
Psalms-33-3: 3 Sing a new song[a] to him.     Play it well and sing it loud! Play it well and sing it loud!
Psalms-33-4: 4 The Lord’s word is true,     and he is faithful in everything he does. and he is faithful in everything he does.
Psalms-33-5: 5 He loves goodness and justice.     The Lord’s faithful love fills the earth. The Lord’s faithful love fills the earth.
Psalms-33-6: 6 The Lord spoke the command, and the world was made.     The breath from his mouth created everything in the heavens. The breath from his mouth created everything in the heavens.
Psalms-33-7: 7 He gathered together the water of the sea.     He put the ocean in its place. He put the ocean in its place.
Psalms-33-8: 8 Everyone on earth should fear and respect the Lord.     All the people in the world should fear him, All the people in the world should fear him,
Psalms-33-9: 9 because when he speaks, things happen.     And if he says, “Stop!”—then it stops.[b] And if he says, “Stop!”—then it stops.[b]
Psalms-33-10: 10 The Lord can ruin every decision the nations make.     He can spoil all their plans. He can spoil all their plans.
Psalms-33-11: 11 But the Lord’s decisions are good forever.     His plans are good for generation after generation. His plans are good for generation after generation.
Psalms-33-12: 12 Great blessings belong to those who have the Lord as their God!     He chose them to be his own special people. He chose them to be his own special people.
Psalms-33-13: 13 The Lord looked down from heaven     and saw all the people. and saw all the people.
Psalms-33-14: 14 From his high throne he looked down     at all the people living on earth. at all the people living on earth.
Psalms-33-15: 15 He created every person’s mind,     and he knows what each one is doing. and he knows what each one is doing.
Psalms-33-16: 16 A king is not saved by the power of his army.     A soldier does not survive by his own great strength. A soldier does not survive by his own great strength.
Psalms-33-17: 17 Horses don’t really bring victory in war.     Their strength cannot help you escape. Their strength cannot help you escape.
Psalms-33-18: 18 The Lord watches over his followers,     those who wait for him to show his faithful love. those who wait for him to show his faithful love.
Psalms-33-19: 19 He saves them from death.     He gives them strength when they are hungry. He gives them strength when they are hungry.
Psalms-33-20: 20 So we will wait for the Lord.     He helps us and protects us. He helps us and protects us.
Psalms-33-21: 21 He makes us happy.     We trust his holy name. We trust his holy name.
Psalms-33-22: 22 Lord, we worship you,     so show your great love for us. so show your great love for us.
Psalms-34-1: [a] A song of David when he pretended to be crazy so that Abimelech would send him away, which he did. 34 I will praise the Lord at all times. 34 I will praise the Lord at all times.     I will never stop singing his praises. I will never stop singing his praises.
Psalms-34-2: 2 Humble people, listen and be happy,     while I brag about the Lord. while I brag about the Lord.
Psalms-34-3: 3 Praise the Lord with me.     Let us honor his name. Let us honor his name.
Psalms-34-4: 4 I went to the Lord for help, and he listened.     He saved me from all that I fear. He saved me from all that I fear.
Psalms-34-5: 5 If you look to him for help,     he will put a smile on your face. he will put a smile on your face.     You will have no need to be ashamed. You will have no need to be ashamed.
Psalms-34-6: 6 As a poor, helpless man I prayed to the Lord,     and he heard me. and he heard me.     He saved me from all my troubles. He saved me from all my troubles.
Psalms-34-7: 7 The Lord’s angel builds a camp around his followers,     and he protects them. and he protects them.
Psalms-34-8: 8 Give the Lord a chance to show you[b] how good he is.     Great blessings belong to those who depend on him! Great blessings belong to those who depend on him!
Psalms-34-9: 9 The Lord’s holy people should fear and respect him.     Those who respect him will always have what they need. Those who respect him will always have what they need.
Psalms-34-10: 10 Even strong lions get weak and hungry,     but those who go to the Lord for help will have every good thing. but those who go to the Lord for help will have every good thing.
Psalms-34-11: 11 Children, come and listen to me;     I will teach you to respect the Lord. I will teach you to respect the Lord.
Psalms-34-12: 12 Do you want to enjoy life?     Do you want to have many happy days? Do you want to have many happy days?
Psalms-34-13: 13 Then avoid saying anything hurtful,     and never let a lie come out of your mouth. and never let a lie come out of your mouth.
Psalms-34-14: 14 Stop doing anything evil, and do good.     Look for peace, and do all you can to help people live peacefully. Look for peace, and do all you can to help people live peacefully.
Psalms-34-15: 15 The Lord watches over those who do what is right,     and he hears their prayers. and he hears their prayers.
Psalms-34-16: 16 But the Lord is against those who do evil,     so they are forgotten soon after they die. so they are forgotten soon after they die.
Psalms-34-17: 17 Pray to the Lord, and he will hear you.     He will save you from all your troubles. He will save you from all your troubles.
