Psalms-34-18: 18 The Lord is close to those who have suffered disappointment.     He saves those who are discouraged. He saves those who are discouraged.
Psalms-34-19: 19 Good people might have many problems,     but the Lord will take them all away. but the Lord will take them all away.
Psalms-34-20: 20 He will protect them completely.     Not one of their bones will be broken. Not one of their bones will be broken.
Psalms-34-21: 21 But troubles will kill the wicked.     The enemies of those who live right will all be punished. The enemies of those who live right will all be punished.
Psalms-34-22: 22 The Lord saves his servants.     All who go to him for protection will escape punishment. All who go to him for protection will escape punishment.
Psalms-35-1: A song of David. 35 Lord, oppose those who oppose me. 35 Lord, oppose those who oppose me.     Fight those who fight me. Fight those who fight me.
Psalms-35-2: 2 Pick up your shields, large and small.     Get up and help me! Get up and help me!
Psalms-35-3: 3 Take a spear and javelin     and fight those who are chasing me. and fight those who are chasing me. Tell me, “I will rescue you.”
Psalms-35-4: 4 Some people are trying to kill me.     Disappoint them and make them ashamed. Disappoint them and make them ashamed.     Make them turn and run away. Make them turn and run away. They are planning to hurt me.     Defeat and embarrass them. Defeat and embarrass them.
Psalms-35-5: 5 Make them like chaff blown by the wind.[a]     Let them be chased by the Lord’s angel. Let them be chased by the Lord’s angel.
Psalms-35-6: 6 Make their road dark and slippery.     Let the Lord’s angel chase them. Let the Lord’s angel chase them.
Psalms-35-7: 7 I did nothing wrong, but they tried to trap me.     For no reason at all, they dug a pit to catch me. For no reason at all, they dug a pit to catch me.
Psalms-35-8: 8 So let them fall into their own traps.     Let them stumble into their own nets. Let them stumble into their own nets.     Let some unknown danger catch them. Let some unknown danger catch them.
Psalms-35-9: 9 Then I will rejoice in the Lord.     I will be happy when he saves me. I will be happy when he saves me.
Psalms-35-10: 10 With my whole self I will say,     “Lord, there is no one like you. “Lord, there is no one like you. You protect the poor from those who are stronger.     You save the poor and helpless from those who try to rob them.” You save the poor and helpless from those who try to rob them.”
Psalms-35-11: 11 There are witnesses[b] trying to harm me.     They ask me questions that I know nothing about. They ask me questions that I know nothing about.
Psalms-35-12: 12 They pay me back evil for the good I have done.     They make me so very sad. They make me so very sad.
Psalms-35-13: 13 When they were sick, I was sad and wore sackcloth.     I went without eating to show my sorrow. I went without eating to show my sorrow.     (May my prayers for them not be answered!) (May my prayers for them not be answered!)
Psalms-35-14: 14 I mourned for them as I would for a friend or a brother.     I bowed low with sadness, crying as I would for my own mother. I bowed low with sadness, crying as I would for my own mother.
Psalms-35-15: 15 But when I had troubles, they laughed at me.     They were not really friends. They were not really friends. I was surrounded and attacked     by people I didn’t even know. by people I didn’t even know.
Psalms-35-16: 16 They made fun of me, using the worst language.     They ground their teeth to show their anger. They ground their teeth to show their anger.
Psalms-35-17: 17 My Lord, how long will you watch this happen?     Save my life from these people Save my life from these people     who are attacking me like lions and trying to destroy me. who are attacking me like lions and trying to destroy me.
Psalms-35-18: 18 I will praise you in the great assembly.     I will praise you there among the crowds. I will praise you there among the crowds.
Psalms-35-19: 19 Don’t let my lying enemies keep on laughing at me.     They have no reason to hate me. They have no reason to hate me.     Surely they will be punished for their secret plans.[c] Surely they will be punished for their secret plans.[c]
Psalms-35-20: 20 They have no friendly words for others,     but plan ways to hurt those who want to live in peace. but plan ways to hurt those who want to live in peace.
Psalms-35-21: 21 They are telling lies about me.     They say, “Aha! We know what you did!” They say, “Aha! We know what you did!”
Psalms-35-22: 22 Lord, surely you can see what is happening.     So don’t keep quiet. So don’t keep quiet.     Lord, don’t leave me. Lord, don’t leave me.
Psalms-35-23: 23 Wake up! Get up!     My God and my Lord, fight for me, and bring me justice. My God and my Lord, fight for me, and bring me justice.
Psalms-35-24: 24 Lord my God, judge me with your fairness.     Don’t let those people laugh at me. Don’t let those people laugh at me.
Psalms-35-25: 25 Don’t let them think, “Aha! We got what we wanted!”     Don’t let them say, “We destroyed him!” Don’t let them say, “We destroyed him!”
Psalms-35-26: 26 Let my enemies be ashamed and embarrassed—     all those who were happy about my troubles. all those who were happy about my troubles. Proud of themselves, they treated me as worthless.     So let them be covered with shame and disgrace. So let them be covered with shame and disgrace.
Psalms-35-27: 27 To those who want the best for me,     I wish them joy and happiness. I wish them joy and happiness. May they always say, “Praise the Lord,     who wants what is best for his servant.” who wants what is best for his servant.”
Psalms-35-28: 28 So, Lord, I will tell people how good you are.     I will praise you all day long. I will praise you all day long.
Psalms-36-1: To the director: A song of David, the Lord’s servant. 36 Deep in the hearts of the wicked a voice tells them to do wrong. 36 Deep in the hearts of the wicked a voice tells them to do wrong.     They have no respect for God. They have no respect for God.
Psalms-36-2: 2 They lie to themselves.     They don’t see their own faults, They don’t see their own faults,     so they are not sorry for what they do. so they are not sorry for what they do.
Psalms-36-3: 3 Their words are wicked lies.     They have stopped doing anything wise or good. They have stopped doing anything wise or good.
Psalms-36-4: 4 They make wicked plans in bed at night.     They choose a way of life that does no good. They choose a way of life that does no good.     And they never say no to anything evil. And they never say no to anything evil.
Psalms-36-5: 5 Lord, your faithful love reaches to the sky.     Your faithfulness is as high as the clouds. Your faithfulness is as high as the clouds.
Psalms-36-6: 6 Your goodness is higher than the highest mountains.     Your fairness is deeper than the deepest ocean. Your fairness is deeper than the deepest ocean. Lord, you protect people and animals.
Psalms-36-7: 7     Nothing is more precious than your loving kindness. 7     Nothing is more precious than your loving kindness.     All people can find protection close to you. All people can find protection close to you.
Psalms-36-8: 8 They get strength from all the good things in your house.     You let them drink from your wonderful river. You let them drink from your wonderful river.
Psalms-36-9: 9 The fountain of life flows from you.     Your light lets us see light. Your light lets us see light.
Psalms-36-10: 10 Continue to love those who really know you,     and do good to those who are true to you.[a] and do good to those who are true to you.[a]
Psalms-36-11: 11 Don’t let proud people trap me.     Don’t let the wicked force me to run away. Don’t let the wicked force me to run away.
Psalms-36-12: 12 Put this on their grave markers: “Here fell the wicked.     They were crushed. They were crushed.     They will never stand up again.” They will never stand up again.”
Psalms-37-1: [a] A song of David. 37 Don’t get upset about evil people. 37 Don’t get upset about evil people.     Don’t be jealous of those who do wrong. Don’t be jealous of those who do wrong.
Psalms-37-2: 2 They are like grass and other green plants     that dry up quickly and then die. that dry up quickly and then die.
Psalms-37-3: 3 So trust in the Lord and do good.     Live on your land and be dependable.[b] Live on your land and be dependable.[b]
Psalms-37-4: 4 Enjoy serving the Lord,     and he will give you whatever you ask for. and he will give you whatever you ask for.
Psalms-37-5: 5 Depend on the Lord.     Trust in him, and he will help you. Trust in him, and he will help you.
Psalms-37-6: 6 He will make it as clear as day that you are right.     Everyone will see that you are being fair. Everyone will see that you are being fair.
Psalms-37-7: 7 Trust in the Lord and wait quietly for his help.     Don’t be angry when people make evil plans and succeed. Don’t be angry when people make evil plans and succeed.
Psalms-37-8: 8 Don’t become so angry and upset that you, too, want to do evil.
Psalms-37-9: 9 The wicked will be destroyed,     but those who call to the Lord for help will get the land he promised. but those who call to the Lord for help will get the land he promised.
Psalms-37-10: 10 In a short time there will be no more evil people.     You can look for them all you want, but they will be gone. You can look for them all you want, but they will be gone.
Psalms-37-11: 11 Humble people will get the land God promised,     and they will enjoy peace. and they will enjoy peace.
Psalms-37-12: 12 The wicked plan bad things for those who are good.     They show their teeth in anger at them. They show their teeth in anger at them.
Psalms-37-13: 13 But our Lord will laugh at them.     He will make sure they get what they deserve. He will make sure they get what they deserve.
Psalms-37-14: 14 The wicked draw their swords to kill the poor and the helpless.     They aim their arrows to murder all who live right. They aim their arrows to murder all who live right.
Psalms-37-15: 15 But their bows will break,     and their swords will pierce their own hearts. and their swords will pierce their own hearts.
Psalms-37-16: 16 A few good people are better     than a large crowd of those who are evil. than a large crowd of those who are evil.
Psalms-37-17: 17 The wicked will be destroyed,     but the Lord cares for those who are good. but the Lord cares for those who are good.
Psalms-37-18: 18 The Lord protects pure people all their life.     Their reward will continue forever. Their reward will continue forever.
Psalms-37-19: 19 When trouble comes,     good people will not be destroyed. good people will not be destroyed. When times of hunger come,     good people will have plenty to eat. good people will have plenty to eat.
Psalms-37-20: 20 But evil people are the Lord’s enemies,     and they will be destroyed. and they will be destroyed. Their valleys will dry up and burn.     They will be destroyed completely. They will be destroyed completely.
Psalms-37-21: 21 The wicked borrow money and never pay it back.     But good people are kind and generous. But good people are kind and generous.
Psalms-37-22: 22 Everyone the Lord blesses will get the land he promised.     Everyone he curses will be destroyed. Everyone he curses will be destroyed.
Psalms-37-23: 23 The Lord shows us how we should live,     and he is pleased when he sees people living that way. and he is pleased when he sees people living that way.
Psalms-37-24: 24 If they stumble, they will not fall,     because the Lord reaches out to steady them. because the Lord reaches out to steady them.
Psalms-37-25: 25 I was young, and now I am old,     but I have never seen good people left with no one to help them; but I have never seen good people left with no one to help them;     I have never seen their children begging for food. I have never seen their children begging for food.
Psalms-37-26: 26 They are kind and generous,     and their children are a blessing. and their children are a blessing.
Psalms-37-27: 27 Stop doing anything evil and do good,     and you will always have a place to live. and you will always have a place to live.
Psalms-37-28: 28 The Lord loves what is right,     and he will never leave his followers without help. and he will never leave his followers without help. He will always protect them,     but he will destroy the families of the wicked. but he will destroy the families of the wicked.
Psalms-37-29: 29 Good people will get the land God promised     and will live on it forever. and will live on it forever.
Psalms-37-30: 30 Those who do what is right give good advice.     Their decisions are always fair. Their decisions are always fair.
Psalms-37-31: 31 They have learned God’s teachings,     and they will never stop living right.[c] and they will never stop living right.[c]
Psalms-37-32: 32 The wicked are always looking for ways to kill good people.
Psalms-37-33: 33 But the Lord will not let the wicked defeat them.     He will not let good people be judged guilty. He will not let good people be judged guilty.
Psalms-37-34: 34 Do what the Lord says, and wait for his help.     He will reward you and give you the land he promised. He will reward you and give you the land he promised.     You will see the wicked being forced to leave. You will see the wicked being forced to leave.
Psalms-37-35: 35 I once saw a wicked man who was powerful.     He was like a strong, healthy tree. He was like a strong, healthy tree.
Psalms-37-36: 36 But then he was gone.     I looked for him, but I could not find him. I looked for him, but I could not find him.
Psalms-37-37: 37 Be pure and honest.     Peace loving people will have many descendants. Peace loving people will have many descendants.
Psalms-37-38: 38 But those who break the law will be destroyed completely.     And their descendants will be forced to leave the land.[d] And their descendants will be forced to leave the land.[d]
Psalms-37-39: 39 The Lord saves those who are good.     When they have troubles, he is their strength. When they have troubles, he is their strength.
Psalms-37-40: 40 The Lord helps good people and rescues them.     They depend on him, so he rescues them from the wicked. They depend on him, so he rescues them from the wicked.
Psalms-38-1: A song of David for the day of remembrance.[a] 38 Lord, don’t criticize me when you are angry. 38 Lord, don’t criticize me when you are angry.     Don’t discipline me in anger. Don’t discipline me in anger.
Psalms-38-2: 2 You have hurt me.     You punished me and hurt me deeply. You punished me and hurt me deeply.
Psalms-38-3: 3 You punished me severely, so my whole body is sore.     I sinned, and now all my bones hurt. I sinned, and now all my bones hurt.
Psalms-38-4: 4 My guilt is like a heavy burden.     I am sinking beneath its weight. I am sinking beneath its weight.
Psalms-38-5: 5 I did a foolish thing,     and now I have infected sores that stink. and now I have infected sores that stink.
Psalms-38-6: 6 I am bent and bowed down.     I am depressed all day long. I am depressed all day long.
Psalms-38-7: 7 I am burning with fever,     and my whole body hurts. and my whole body hurts.
Psalms-38-8: 8 I hurt so much I cannot feel anything.     My pounding heart makes me scream! My pounding heart makes me scream!
Psalms-38-9: 9 My Lord, you heard my groaning.     You can hear my sighs. You can hear my sighs.
Psalms-38-10: 10 My heart is pounding.     My strength is gone, and I am going blind.[b] My strength is gone, and I am going blind.[b]
Psalms-38-11: 11 Because of my sickness,     my friends and neighbors will not visit me; my friends and neighbors will not visit me;     my family will not come near me. my family will not come near me.
Psalms-38-12: 12 My enemies say bad things about me.     They are spreading lies and rumors. They are spreading lies and rumors.     They talk about me all the time. They talk about me all the time.
Psalms-38-13: 13 But I am like a deaf man and cannot hear.     I am like someone who cannot speak. I am like someone who cannot speak.
Psalms-38-14: 14 I am like those who cannot hear what people are saying about them.     I cannot answer to prove my enemies wrong. I cannot answer to prove my enemies wrong.
Psalms-38-15: 15 Lord, you must defend me.     Lord my God, you must speak for me. Lord my God, you must speak for me.
Psalms-38-16: 16 That’s why I prayed, “Don’t let my enemies smile at my pain.     Full of pride, they will laugh if I stumble and fall.” Full of pride, they will laugh if I stumble and fall.”
Psalms-38-17: 17 I know I am guilty of doing wrong.     I cannot forget my pain. I cannot forget my pain.
Psalms-38-18: 18 Lord, I told you about the evil I have done.     I am sorry for my sin. I am sorry for my sin.
Psalms-38-19: 19 But my enemies are alive and healthy,     and they have told many lies. and they have told many lies.
Psalms-38-20: 20 I did nothing but good,     and they paid me back with evil. and they paid me back with evil. I try to do what is right,     but that only makes them turn against me. but that only makes them turn against me.
Psalms-38-21: 21 Lord, don’t leave me.     My God, stay close to me. My God, stay close to me.
Psalms-38-22: 22 Come quickly and help me.     My Lord, you are the one who saves me. My Lord, you are the one who saves me.
Psalms-39-1: To the director, Jeduthun.[a] A song of David. 39 I said, “I will be careful about what I say. 39 I said, “I will be careful about what I say.     I will not let my tongue cause me to sin. I will not let my tongue cause me to sin. I will keep my mouth closed[b]     when I am around wicked people.” when I am around wicked people.”
Psalms-39-2: 2 So I didn’t say anything.     I didn’t even say anything good, I didn’t even say anything good,     but I became even more upset. but I became even more upset.
Psalms-39-3: 3 I was very angry,     and the more I thought about it, the angrier I became. and the more I thought about it, the angrier I became.     So I said something. So I said something.
Psalms-39-4: 4 Lord, tell me, what will happen to me now?     Tell me, how long will I live? Tell me, how long will I live?     Let me know how short my life really is. Let me know how short my life really is.
Psalms-39-5: 5 You gave me only a short life.     Compared to you, my whole life is nothing. Compared to you, my whole life is nothing. The life of every human is like a cloud that quickly disappears. Selah
Psalms-39-6: 6 Our life is like an image in a mirror.[c]     We rush through life collecting things, We rush through life collecting things,     but we don’t know who will get them after we die. but we don’t know who will get them after we die.
Psalms-39-7: 7 So, Lord, what hope do I have?     You are my hope! You are my hope!
Psalms-39-8: 8 Save me from the bad things I did.     Don’t let me be treated like a fool. Don’t let me be treated like a fool.
Psalms-39-9: 9 I will not open my mouth.     I will not say anything. I will not say anything.     You did what should have been done. You did what should have been done.
Psalms-39-10: 10 But please stop punishing me.     You will destroy me if you do not stop. You will destroy me if you do not stop.
Psalms-39-11: 11 You punish people for doing wrong to teach them the right way to live.     As a moth destroys cloth, you destroy what people love. As a moth destroys cloth, you destroy what people love.     Yes, our lives are like a small cloud that quickly disappears. Selah Yes, our lives are like a small cloud that quickly disappears. Selah
Psalms-39-12: 12 Lord, hear my prayer!     Listen to the words I cry to you. Listen to the words I cry to you.     Look at my tears. Look at my tears. I am only a traveler passing through this life with you.     Like all my ancestors, I will live here only a short time.[d] Like all my ancestors, I will live here only a short time.[d]
Psalms-39-13: 13 Leave me alone[e] and let me be happy     before I am dead and gone. before I am dead and gone.
Psalms-40-1: To the director: A song of David. 40 I called[a] to the Lord, and he heard me. 40 I called[a] to the Lord, and he heard me.     He heard my cries. He heard my cries.
Psalms-40-2: 2 He lifted me out of the grave.[b]     He lifted me from that muddy place.[c] He lifted me from that muddy place.[c] He picked me up, put me on solid ground,     and kept my feet from slipping. and kept my feet from slipping.
Psalms-40-3: 3 He put a new song[d] in my mouth,     a song of praise to our God. a song of praise to our God. Many will see what he did and worship him.     They will put their trust in the Lord. They will put their trust in the Lord.
Psalms-40-4: 4 Great blessings belong to those who trust in the Lord,     for those who do not turn to demons and false gods[e] for help. for those who do not turn to demons and false gods[e] for help.
Psalms-40-5: 5 Lord my God, you have done many amazing things!     You have made great plans for us—too many to list. You have made great plans for us—too many to list. I could talk on and on about them,     because there are too many to count. because there are too many to count.
Psalms-40-6: 6 Lord, you made me understand this:[f]     You don’t really want sacrifices and grain offerings. You don’t really want sacrifices and grain offerings.     You don’t want burnt offerings and sin offerings. You don’t want burnt offerings and sin offerings.
Psalms-40-7: 7 So I said, “Here I am,     ready to do what was written about me in the book. ready to do what was written about me in the book.
Psalms-40-8: 8 My God, I am happy to do whatever you want.     I never stop thinking about your teachings.” I never stop thinking about your teachings.”
Psalms-40-9: 9 I told the good news of victory[g] to the people in the great assembly.     And, Lord, you know that I will never stop telling that good news. And, Lord, you know that I will never stop telling that good news.
Psalms-40-10: 10 I told about the good things you did.     I did not hide these things in my heart. I did not hide these things in my heart. I spoke of how you can be trusted to save us.     I did not hide your love and loyalty from those in the great assembly. I did not hide your love and loyalty from those in the great assembly.
Psalms-40-11: 11 Lord, do not hide your mercy from me.     Let your love and loyalty always protect me. Let your love and loyalty always protect me.
Psalms-40-12: 12 Troubles have surrounded me.     They are too many to count! They are too many to count! My sins have caught me,     and I cannot escape them. and I cannot escape them. They are more than the hairs on my head.     I have lost my courage. I have lost my courage.
Psalms-40-13: 13 Please, Lord, rescue me!     Lord, hurry and help me! Lord, hurry and help me!
Psalms-40-14: 14 People are trying to kill me.     Please disappoint them. Please disappoint them.     Humiliate them completely! Humiliate them completely! They wanted to hurt me.     Make them run away in shame! Make them run away in shame!
Psalms-40-15: 15 May those who make fun of me     be too embarrassed to speak! be too embarrassed to speak!
Psalms-40-16: 16 But may those who come to you be happy and rejoice.     May those who love being saved by you always be able to say, “Praise the Lord!”[h] May those who love being saved by you always be able to say, “Praise the Lord!”[h]
Psalms-40-17: 17 My Lord, I am only a poor, helpless man,     but please pay attention to me. but please pay attention to me. You are my helper, the one who can save me.     My God, don’t be too late. My God, don’t be too late.
Psalms-41-1: To the director: A song of David. 41 Those who help the poor succeed will get many blessings.[a] 41 Those who help the poor succeed will get many blessings.[a]     When trouble comes, the Lord will save them. When trouble comes, the Lord will save them.
Psalms-41-2: 2 The Lord will protect them and save their lives.     He will bless them in this land. He will bless them in this land.     He will not let their enemies harm them. He will not let their enemies harm them.
Psalms-41-3: 3 When they are sick in bed,     the Lord will give them strength and make them well! the Lord will give them strength and make them well!
Psalms-41-4: 4 I say, “Lord, be kind to me.     I sinned against you, but forgive me and make me well.” I sinned against you, but forgive me and make me well.”
Psalms-41-5: 5 My enemies say bad things about me.     They ask, “When will he die and be forgotten?” They ask, “When will he die and be forgotten?”
Psalms-41-6: 6 If they come to see me,     they don’t say what they are really thinking. they don’t say what they are really thinking. They come to gather a little gossip     and then go to spread their rumors. and then go to spread their rumors.
Psalms-41-7: 7 Those who hate me whisper about me.     They think the worst about me. They think the worst about me.
Psalms-41-8: 8 They say, “He did something wrong.     That is why he is sick. That is why he is sick.     He will never get well.” He will never get well.”
Psalms-41-9: 9 My best friend, the one I trusted,     the one who ate with me—even he has turned against me. the one who ate with me—even he has turned against me.
Psalms-41-10: 10 Lord, please be kind to me.     Let me get up, and I will pay them back. Let me get up, and I will pay them back.
Psalms-41-11: 11 Don’t let my enemy defeat me.     Then I will know that you care for me. Then I will know that you care for me.
Psalms-41-12: 12 I was innocent and you supported me.     You let me stand and serve you forever. You let me stand and serve you forever.
Psalms-41-13: 13 Praise the Lord, the God of Israel.     He always was, and he always will be. He always was, and he always will be. Amen and Amen!
Psalms-42-1: Book 2 (Psalms 42-72) To the director: A maskil from the Korah family. 42 Like a deer drinking from a stream, 42 Like a deer drinking from a stream,     I reach out to you, my God.[a] I reach out to you, my God.[a]
Psalms-42-2: 2 My soul thirsts for the living God.     When can I go to meet with him? When can I go to meet with him?
Psalms-42-3: 3 Instead of food, I have only tears day and night,     as my enemies laugh at me and say, “Where is your God?” as my enemies laugh at me and say, “Where is your God?”
Psalms-42-4: 4 My heart breaks as I remember the pleasant times in the past,     when I walked with the crowds as I led them up to God’s Temple. when I walked with the crowds as I led them up to God’s Temple. I remember the happy songs of praise     as they celebrated the festival. as they celebrated the festival.
Psalms-42-5-Ps-42-6: 5-6 Why am I so sad?     Why am I so upset? Why am I so upset? I tell myself, “Wait for God’s help!     You will again be able to praise him, You will again be able to praise him,     your God, the one who will save you.” your God, the one who will save you.” In my sadness I say, “I will remember you from here on this small hill,[b]     where Mount Hermon and the Jordan River meet.” where Mount Hermon and the Jordan River meet.”
Psalms-42-7: 7 I hear the roar of the water coming from deep within the earth.     It shouts to the water below as it tumbles down the waterfall. It shouts to the water below as it tumbles down the waterfall. God, your waves come one after another,     crashing all around and over me.[c] crashing all around and over me.[c]
Psalms-42-8: 8 By day the Lord shows his faithful love,     and at night I have a song for him—a prayer for the God of my life.[d] and at night I have a song for him—a prayer for the God of my life.[d]
Psalms-42-9: 9 I say to God, my Rock,     “Why have you forgotten me? “Why have you forgotten me?     Why must I suffer this sadness that my enemies have brought me?” Why must I suffer this sadness that my enemies have brought me?”
Psalms-42-10: 10 Their constant insults are killing me.     They never stop asking, “Where is your God?” They never stop asking, “Where is your God?”
Psalms-42-11: 11 Why am I so sad?     Why am I so upset? Why am I so upset? I tell myself, “Wait for God’s help!     You will again be able to praise him, You will again be able to praise him,     your God, the one who will save you.” your God, the one who will save you.”
Psalms-43-1: 43 Defend me, God. 43 Defend me, God.     Argue my case against those people who don’t know you. Argue my case against those people who don’t know you.     Protect me from those evil liars. Protect me from those evil liars.
Psalms-43-2: 2 God, you are my place of safety.     Why have you turned me away? Why have you turned me away? Why must I suffer this sadness     that my enemies have brought me? that my enemies have brought me?
Psalms-43-3: 3 Send your light and your truth to guide me,     to lead me to your holy mountain, to your home. to lead me to your holy mountain, to your home.
Psalms-43-4: 4 I want to go to God’s altar,     to the God who makes me so very happy. to the God who makes me so very happy. God, my God, I want to play my harp     and sing praises to you! and sing praises to you!
Psalms-43-5: 5 Why am I so sad?     Why am I so upset? Why am I so upset? I tell myself, “Wait for God’s help!     You will again have a chance to praise him, You will again have a chance to praise him,     your God, the one who will save you.” your God, the one who will save you.”
Psalms-44-1: To the director: A maskil from the Korah family. 44 God, we have heard about you. 44 God, we have heard about you.     Our fathers told us what you did in their lifetime. Our fathers told us what you did in their lifetime.     They told us what you did long ago. They told us what you did long ago.
Psalms-44-2: 2 With your great power you took this land from other people,     and you gave it to us. and you gave it to us. You crushed those foreigners     and forced them to leave this land. and forced them to leave this land.
Psalms-44-3: 3 It was not our fathers’ swords that took the land.     It was not their strong arms that brought them victory. It was not their strong arms that brought them victory. It was your power.     It was because you accepted them and smiled down on them. It was because you accepted them and smiled down on them.
Psalms-44-4: 4 God, you are my king.     Give the command and lead Jacob’s people to victory. Give the command and lead Jacob’s people to victory.
Psalms-44-5: 5 We need your help to push our enemies back.     Only in your name can we trample those who attacked us. Only in your name can we trample those who attacked us.
Psalms-44-6: 6 I don’t put my trust in my bow.     My sword cannot save me. My sword cannot save me.
Psalms-44-7: 7 You are the one who saved us from our enemies.     You are the one who put our enemies to shame. You are the one who put our enemies to shame.
Psalms-44-8: 8 We have praised you all day long,     and we will praise your name forever. Selah and we will praise your name forever. Selah
Psalms-44-9: 9 But you left us and put us to shame.     You did not go with us into battle. You did not go with us into battle.
Psalms-44-10: 10 You let our enemies push us back.     You let them take our wealth. You let them take our wealth.
Psalms-44-11: 11 You gave us away like sheep to be killed and eaten.     You scattered us among the nations. You scattered us among the nations.
Psalms-44-12: 12 You sold your people for nothing.     You did not even argue over the price. You did not even argue over the price.
Psalms-44-13: 13 You made us a joke to our neighbors.     They laugh and make fun of us. They laugh and make fun of us.
Psalms-44-14: 14 You made us one of the stories that people love to tell.     People all over the world laugh at us and shake their heads. People all over the world laugh at us and shake their heads.
Psalms-44-15: 15 All I can think about is my shame.     Just look at my face, and you will see it. Just look at my face, and you will see it.
Psalms-44-16: 16 All I can hear are the jokes and insults of my enemies,     as I watch them take their revenge. as I watch them take their revenge.
Psalms-44-17: 17 We have not forgotten you.     But you do all those things to us. But you do all those things to us.     We did not break the agreement you gave us. We did not break the agreement you gave us.
Psalms-44-18: 18 We did not turn away from you.     We did not stop following you. We did not stop following you.
Psalms-44-19: 19 But you crushed us in this home of jackals.     You left us in this place as dark as death. You left us in this place as dark as death.
Psalms-44-20: 20 Did we forget the name of our God?     Did we pray to foreign gods? Did we pray to foreign gods?
Psalms-44-21: 21 If we did, then God knows it,     because he knows our deepest secrets. because he knows our deepest secrets.
Psalms-44-22: 22 All day long we died for you.     We are like sheep being led away to be killed. We are like sheep being led away to be killed.
Psalms-44-23: 23 Lord, wake up!     Why are you sleeping? Why are you sleeping?     Get up! Don’t ignore us forever! Get up! Don’t ignore us forever!
Psalms-44-24: 24 Why are you hiding from us?     Have you forgotten our pain and troubles? Have you forgotten our pain and troubles?
Psalms-44-25: 25 We have been pushed down into the dirt.     We are lying face down in the dust.[a] We are lying face down in the dust.[a]
Psalms-44-26: 26 Get up and help us!     Rescue us because of your faithful love. Rescue us because of your faithful love.
Psalms-45-1: To the director: To the tune “Shoshanim.”[a] A maskil from the Korah family. A love song. 45 Beautiful thoughts fill my mind 45 Beautiful thoughts fill my mind     as I speak these lines for the king. as I speak these lines for the king. These words come from my tongue     as from the pen of a skilled writer. as from the pen of a skilled writer.
Psalms-45-2: 2 You are more handsome than anyone,     and you say such pleasant things. and you say such pleasant things.     So God will always bless you. So God will always bless you.
Psalms-45-3: 3 Put on your sword, mighty warrior,     so impressive in your splendid uniform. so impressive in your splendid uniform.
Psalms-45-4: 4 Go out in your greatness to win the victory for what is true and right.     Let us see the amazing things you can do with your powerful right arm.[b] Let us see the amazing things you can do with your powerful right arm.[b]
Psalms-45-5: 5 Your sharp arrows will go deep into the hearts of your enemies,     who will fall to the ground in front of you. who will fall to the ground in front of you.
Psalms-45-6: 6 God,[c] your kingdom will last forever.     You use your authority for justice. You use your authority for justice.
Psalms-45-7: 7 You love what is right and hate what is wrong.     So God, your God, chose you to be king, So God, your God, chose you to be king,     giving you more joy and honor than anyone like you.[d] giving you more joy and honor than anyone like you.[d]
Psalms-45-8: 8 From your clothes comes the wonderful smell of myrrh, aloes, and cassia.     In palaces decorated with ivory, you enjoy the music of stringed instruments. In palaces decorated with ivory, you enjoy the music of stringed instruments.
Psalms-45-9: 9 Here are ladies of honor, daughters of kings.     Your bride[e] stands at your right side, wearing a gown decorated with the finest gold. Your bride[e] stands at your right side, wearing a gown decorated with the finest gold.
Psalms-45-10: 10 My lady,[f] listen to me.     Listen carefully and understand me. Listen carefully and understand me. Forget your people and your father’s family,
Psalms-45-11: 11     so that the king will be pleased with your beauty. 11     so that the king will be pleased with your beauty. He will be your new husband,[g]     so you must honor him. so you must honor him.
Psalms-45-12: 12 People from Tyre will bring you gifts.     Their richest people will try to win your friendship. Their richest people will try to win your friendship.
Psalms-45-13: 13 The princess is so beautiful in her gown,     like a pearl set in gold. like a pearl set in gold.
Psalms-45-14: 14 Clothed in beauty, she is led to the king,     followed by her bridesmaids. followed by her bridesmaids.
Psalms-45-15: 15 Filled with joy and excitement,     they enter into the king’s palace. they enter into the king’s palace.
Psalms-45-16: 16 Your sons will be kings like their ancestors.     You will make them rulers throughout the land. You will make them rulers throughout the land.
Psalms-45-17: 17 You will be famous for generations.     People will praise you forever and ever. People will praise you forever and ever.
Psalms-46-1: To the director: A song from the Korah family. Use the alamoth.[a] A song. 46 God is our protection and source of strength. 46 God is our protection and source of strength.     He is always ready to help us in times of trouble. He is always ready to help us in times of trouble.
Psalms-46-2: 2 So we are not afraid when the earth quakes     and the mountains fall into the sea. and the mountains fall into the sea.
Psalms-46-3: 3 We are not afraid when the seas become rough and dark     and the mountains tremble. Selah and the mountains tremble. Selah
Psalms-46-4: 4 There is a river whose streams bring happiness to God’s city,     to the holy city of God Most High. to the holy city of God Most High.
Psalms-46-5: 5 God is in that city, so it will never be destroyed.     He is there to help even before sunrise. He is there to help even before sunrise.
Psalms-46-6: 6 Nations will shake with fear and kingdoms will fall     when God shouts and makes the earth move. when God shouts and makes the earth move.
Psalms-46-7: 7 The Lord All-Powerful is with us.     The God of Jacob is our place of safety. Selah The God of Jacob is our place of safety. Selah
Psalms-46-8: 8 Look at the powerful things the Lord has done.     See the awesome things he has done on earth. See the awesome things he has done on earth.
Psalms-46-9: 9 He stops wars all over the world.     He breaks the soldiers’ bows, shatters their spears, and burns their shields.[b] He breaks the soldiers’ bows, shatters their spears, and burns their shields.[b]
Psalms-46-10: 10 God says, “Stop fighting and know that I am God!     I am the one who defeats the nations; I am the one who defeats the nations;     I am the one who controls the world.” I am the one who controls the world.”
Psalms-46-11: 11 The Lord All-Powerful is with us.     The God of Jacob is our place of safety. Selah The God of Jacob is our place of safety. Selah
Psalms-47-1: To the director: A song from the Korah family. 47 Everyone, clap your hands. 47 Everyone, clap your hands.     Shout with joy to God! Shout with joy to God!
Psalms-47-2: 2 The Lord Most High is awesome.     He is the great King over all the earth. He is the great King over all the earth.
Psalms-47-3: 3 He helped us defeat other nations.     He put those people under our control. He put those people under our control.
Psalms-47-4: 4 He chose our land for us.     He chose that wonderful land for Jacob, the one he loved. Selah He chose that wonderful land for Jacob, the one he loved. Selah
Psalms-47-5: 5 The Lord God goes up to his throne     at the sound of the trumpet and horn. at the sound of the trumpet and horn.
Psalms-47-6: 6 Sing praises to God, sing praises!     Sing praises to our King, sing praises! Sing praises to our King, sing praises!
Psalms-47-7: 7 God is the King of the whole world.     Sing songs of praise![a] Sing songs of praise![a]
Psalms-47-8: 8 God sits on his holy throne;     he rules all the nations. he rules all the nations.
Psalms-47-9: 9 The leaders of the nations have come together     with the people of the God of Abraham. with the people of the God of Abraham. All the rulers of the world belong to God.     He is over them all! He is over them all!
Psalms-48-1: A song of praise from the Korah family. 48 The Lord is great! 48 The Lord is great!     He is praised throughout the city of our God, his holy mountain. He is praised throughout the city of our God, his holy mountain.
Psalms-48-2: 2 His city is such a pleasant place.     It brings joy to people from around the world. It brings joy to people from around the world. Mount Zion is the true mountain of God.[a]     It is the city of the great King. It is the city of the great King.
Psalms-48-3: 3 In the palaces of that city,     God is known as the fortress. God is known as the fortress.
Psalms-48-4: 4 Once some kings met together     and planned an attack against this city. and planned an attack against this city. They marched toward the city,
Psalms-48-5: 5     but when they saw it, they were amazed. 5     but when they saw it, they were amazed.     They all panicked and ran away. They all panicked and ran away.
Psalms-48-6: 6 Fear grabbed them;     they trembled like a woman giving birth. they trembled like a woman giving birth.
Psalms-48-7: 7 God, with a strong east wind,     you wrecked their big ships. you wrecked their big ships.
Psalms-48-8: 8 Yes, we heard the stories about your power.     But we also saw it in the city of our God, the city of the Lord All-Powerful. But we also saw it in the city of our God, the city of the Lord All-Powerful. God makes that city strong forever. Selah
Psalms-48-9: 9 God, in your Temple we remember your loving kindness.
Psalms-48-10: 10 Your name is known everywhere, God,     and people throughout the earth praise you. and people throughout the earth praise you.     You have shown that you do what is right. You have shown that you do what is right.
Psalms-48-11: 11 Mount Zion is happy,     and the towns of Judah rejoice, because your decisions are fair. and the towns of Judah rejoice, because your decisions are fair.
Psalms-48-12: 12 Walk around Jerusalem,     and count its towers. and count its towers.
Psalms-48-13: 13 Look at the tall walls,     and see the palaces. and see the palaces.     Then you can tell the next generation about them. Then you can tell the next generation about them.
Psalms-48-14: 14 This God is our God forever and ever.     He will lead us from now to the end of time! He will lead us from now to the end of time!
Psalms-49-1: To the director: A song from the Korah family. 49 Listen to this, all you nations. 49 Listen to this, all you nations.     Pay attention, all you people on earth. Pay attention, all you people on earth.
Psalms-49-2: 2     Everyone, rich and poor, listen to me. 2     Everyone, rich and poor, listen to me.
Psalms-49-3: 3 I have some very wise words for you.     My thoughts will give you understanding. My thoughts will give you understanding.
Psalms-49-4: 4 I listened to these sayings.     And now, with my harp, I will sing and make the hidden meaning clear. And now, with my harp, I will sing and make the hidden meaning clear.
Psalms-49-5: 5 Why should I be afraid when trouble comes?     There is no need to fear when evil enemies surround me. There is no need to fear when evil enemies surround me.
Psalms-49-6: 6 They think their wealth will protect them.     They brag about how rich they are. They brag about how rich they are.
Psalms-49-7: 7 But no one has enough to buy back a life,     and you cannot bribe[a] God. and you cannot bribe[a] God.
Psalms-49-8: 8 You will never get enough money     to pay for your own life. to pay for your own life.
Psalms-49-9: 9 You will never have enough     to buy the right to live forever to buy the right to live forever     and keep your body out of the grave. and keep your body out of the grave.
Psalms-49-10: 10 Look, the wise die the same as fools and stupid people.[b]     They die and leave their wealth to others. They die and leave their wealth to others.
Psalms-49-11: 11 The grave will be their new home forever.     And how much land they owned will not make any difference. And how much land they owned will not make any difference.
Psalms-49-12: 12 People might be wealthy, but they cannot stay here forever.     They will die like the animals. They will die like the animals.
Psalms-49-13: 13 That is what happens to all who trust in themselves     and to anyone who accepts their way of life. Selah and to anyone who accepts their way of life. Selah
Psalms-49-14: 14 They are just like sheep, but the grave will be their pen.     Death will be their shepherd. Death will be their shepherd. When morning comes, the good people will enjoy victory,     as the bodies of the proud slowly rot in the grave, as the bodies of the proud slowly rot in the grave,     far away from their fancy houses. far away from their fancy houses.
Psalms-49-15: 15 But God will pay the price to save me from the grave.     He will take me to be with him. Selah He will take me to be with him. Selah
Psalms-49-16: 16 Don’t be afraid of people just because they are rich.     Don’t be afraid of people just because they have big, fancy houses. Don’t be afraid of people just because they have big, fancy houses.
Psalms-49-17: 17 They will not take anything with them when they die.     They will not take their wealth with them. They will not take their wealth with them.
Psalms-49-18: 18 A wealthy man might tell himself how well he has done in life.     And other people might praise him. And other people might praise him.
Psalms-49-19: 19 But the time will come for him to die and go to his ancestors.     And he will never again see the light of day. And he will never again see the light of day.
Psalms-49-20: 20 Wealthy people don’t seem to understand     that they will die like the animals. that they will die like the animals.
Psalms-50-1: One of Asaph’s songs. 50 The Lord God Most Powerful has spoken. 50 The Lord God Most Powerful has spoken.     He calls to everyone on earth, from where the sun rises to where it sets. He calls to everyone on earth, from where the sun rises to where it sets.
Psalms-50-2: 2 God appeared from Zion, the city of perfect beauty.[a]
Psalms-50-3: 3 Our God is coming and will not keep quiet.     Fire burns in front of him. Fire burns in front of him.     There is a great storm around him. There is a great storm around him.
Psalms-50-4: 4 He tells the sky and the earth to be witnesses     as he judges his people. as he judges his people.
Psalms-50-5: 5 He says, “My followers, gather around me.     Come, my worshipers, who made an agreement with me.” Come, my worshipers, who made an agreement with me.”
Psalms-50-6: 6 God is the judge,     and the skies tell how fair he is. Selah and the skies tell how fair he is. Selah
Psalms-50-7: 7 God says, “My people, listen to me!     People of Israel, I will show my evidence against you. People of Israel, I will show my evidence against you.     I am God, your God. I am God, your God.
Psalms-50-8: 8 The problem I have with you is not your sacrifices     or the burnt offerings you bring to me everyday. or the burnt offerings you bring to me everyday.
Psalms-50-9: 9 Why would I want more bulls from your barns     or goats from your pens? or goats from your pens?
Psalms-50-10: 10 I already own all the animals in the forest.     I own all the animals on a thousand hills. I own all the animals on a thousand hills.
Psalms-50-11: 11 I know every bird in the mountains.     Everything that moves in the fields is mine. Everything that moves in the fields is mine.
Psalms-50-12: 12 If I were hungry, I would not ask you for food.     I already own the world and everything in it. I already own the world and everything in it.
Psalms-50-13: 13 I don’t eat the meat of bulls or drink the blood of goats.”
Psalms-50-14: 14 You made promises to God Most High, so give him what you promised.     Bring your sacrifices and thank offerings. Bring your sacrifices and thank offerings.
Psalms-50-15: 15 God says, “Call me when trouble comes.     I will help you, and you will honor me.” I will help you, and you will honor me.”
Psalms-50-16: 16 But God says to the wicked,     “Stop quoting my laws! “Stop quoting my laws!     Stop talking about my agreement! Stop talking about my agreement!
Psalms-50-17: 17 You hate for me to tell you what to do.     You ignore what I say. You ignore what I say.
Psalms-50-18: 18 You see a thief and run to join him.     You jump into bed with those who commit adultery. You jump into bed with those who commit adultery.
Psalms-50-19: 19 You say evil things and tell lies.
Psalms-50-20: 20 You sit around talking about people,     finding fault with your own brothers. finding fault with your own brothers.
Psalms-50-21: 21 When you did these things, I said nothing.     So you thought that I[b] was just like you. So you thought that I[b] was just like you. But I will not be quiet any longer.     I will correct you and make clear what I have against you. I will correct you and make clear what I have against you.
Psalms-50-22: 22 You people who have forgotten God,     understand what I am telling you, understand what I am telling you, or I will tear you apart,     and no one will be able to save you! and no one will be able to save you!
Psalms-50-23: 23 Whoever gives a thank offering shows me honor.     And whoever decides to live right will see my power to save.” And whoever decides to live right will see my power to save.”
Psalms-51-1: To the director: A song of David written when Nathan the prophet came to him after David’s sin with Bathsheba. 51 God, be merciful to me 51 God, be merciful to me     because of your faithful love. because of your faithful love. Because of your great compassion,     erase all the wrongs I have done. erase all the wrongs I have done.
Psalms-51-2: 2 Scrub away my guilt.     Wash me clean from my sin. Wash me clean from my sin.
Psalms-51-3: 3 I know I have done wrong.     I remember that sin all the time. I remember that sin all the time.
Psalms-51-4: 4 I did what you said is wrong.     You are the one I have sinned against. You are the one I have sinned against. I say this so that people will know     that I am wrong and you are right. that I am wrong and you are right.     What you decided is fair. What you decided is fair.
Psalms-51-5: 5 I was born to do wrong,     a sinner before I left my mother’s womb. a sinner before I left my mother’s womb.
Psalms-51-6: 6 You want me to be completely loyal,     so put true wisdom deep inside of me. so put true wisdom deep inside of me.
Psalms-51-7: 7 Remove my sin and make me pure.[a]     Wash me until I am whiter than snow! Wash me until I am whiter than snow!
Psalms-51-8: 8 Let me hear sounds of joy and happiness again.     Let the bones you crushed be happy again. Let the bones you crushed be happy again.
Psalms-51-9: 9 Don’t look at my sins.     Erase them all. Erase them all.
Psalms-51-10: 10 God, create a pure heart in me,     and make my spirit strong again. and make my spirit strong again.
Psalms-51-11: 11 Don’t push me away     or take your Holy Spirit from me. or take your Holy Spirit from me.
Psalms-51-12: 12 Your help made me so happy.     Give me that joy again. Give me that joy again.     Make my spirit strong and ready to obey you. Make my spirit strong and ready to obey you.
Psalms-51-13: 13 I will teach the guilty how you want them to live,     and the sinners will come back to you. and the sinners will come back to you.
Psalms-51-14: 14 God, spare me from the punishment of death.[b]     My God, you are the one who saves me! My God, you are the one who saves me! Let me sing about all the good things you do for me!
Psalms-51-15: 15     My Lord, I will open my mouth and sing your praises! 15     My Lord, I will open my mouth and sing your praises!
Psalms-51-16: 16 You don’t really want sacrifices,     or I would give them to you. or I would give them to you.
Psalms-51-17: 17 The sacrifice that God wants is a humble spirit.     God, you will not turn away someone who comes with a humble heart and is willing to obey you.[c] God, you will not turn away someone who comes with a humble heart and is willing to obey you.[c]
Psalms-51-18: 18 God, please be good to Zion.     Rebuild the walls of Jerusalem. Rebuild the walls of Jerusalem.
Psalms-51-19: 19 Then you can enjoy the kind of sacrifices you want.[d]     You will receive whole burnt offerings, You will receive whole burnt offerings,     and people will again offer bulls on your altar. and people will again offer bulls on your altar.
Psalms-52-1: To the director: A maskil of David written when Doeg the Edomite went to Saul and told him, “David is in Ahimelech’s house.” 52 Great warrior, why are you bragging about the evil you did? 52 Great warrior, why are you bragging about the evil you did?     You are a disgrace to God. You are a disgrace to God.
Psalms-52-2: 2 You are nothing but a hired killer,[a]     making plans to hurt people and making up lies! making plans to hurt people and making up lies!
Psalms-52-3: 3 You love evil more than goodness.     You love lies more than truth. Selah You love lies more than truth. Selah
Psalms-52-4: 4 You and your lying tongue love to hurt people.
Psalms-52-5: 5 So God will ruin you forever!     He will grab you and pull you from your home,[b] like someone pulling up a plant by the roots![c] Selah He will grab you and pull you from your home,[b] like someone pulling up a plant by the roots![c] Selah
Psalms-52-6: 6 Good people will see this     and learn to fear and respect God. and learn to fear and respect God. They will laugh at you and say,
Psalms-52-7: 7     “Look what happened to the warrior who did not depend on God. 7     “Look what happened to the warrior who did not depend on God.     That fool thought his wealth and lies would protect him.” That fool thought his wealth and lies would protect him.”
Psalms-52-8: 8 But I am like a green olive tree growing in God’s Temple.     I will trust God’s faithful love forever and ever. I will trust God’s faithful love forever and ever.
Psalms-52-9: 9 God, I praise you forever for what you have done.     I will speak your name[d] before your followers because it is so good! I will speak your name[d] before your followers because it is so good!
Psalms-53-1: To the director: Use the mahalath.[a] A maskil of David. 53 Only fools think there is no God. 53 Only fools think there is no God.     People like that are evil and do terrible things. People like that are evil and do terrible things.     They never do what is right. They never do what is right.
Psalms-53-2: 2 God looks down from heaven to see     if there is anyone who is wise, if there is anyone who is wise,     anyone who looks to him for help. anyone who looks to him for help.
Psalms-53-3: 3 But everyone has turned away from him.     Everyone has become evil. Everyone has become evil. No one does anything good.     No, not one person! No, not one person!
Psalms-53-4: 4 Those who are evil treat my people like bread to be eaten.     And they never ask for God’s help. And they never ask for God’s help.     Don’t they understand what they are doing? Don’t they understand what they are doing?
Psalms-53-5: 5 They will be filled with fear—     a fear like they have never felt before! a fear like they have never felt before! People of Israel, you will defeat those who attacked you,     because God has rejected them. because God has rejected them. And he will scatter their bones.
Psalms-53-6: 6 I wish the one who lives on Mount Zion     would bring victory to Israel! would bring victory to Israel! When God makes Israel successful again,     the people of Jacob will be very happy; the people of Jacob will be very happy;     the people of Israel will be glad. the people of Israel will be glad.
Psalms-54-1: To the director: With instruments. A maskil of David written when the Ziphites went to Saul and told him, “We think David is hiding among our people.” 54 God, use your power and save me. 54 God, use your power and save me.     Use your great power to set me free.[a] Use your great power to set me free.[a]
Psalms-54-2: 2 God, listen to my prayer.     Listen to what I say. Listen to what I say.
Psalms-54-3: 3 Strangers who don’t even think about God have turned against me.     Those powerful men are trying to kill me. Selah Those powerful men are trying to kill me. Selah
Psalms-54-4: 4 Look, my God will help me.     My Lord will support me. My Lord will support me.
Psalms-54-5: 5 He will punish the people who turned against me.     God, be faithful to me and destroy them. God, be faithful to me and destroy them.
Psalms-54-6: 6 Lord, I will give freewill offerings to you.     I will praise your good name. I will praise your good name.
Psalms-54-7: 7 You saved me from all my troubles.     I saw my enemies defeated. I saw my enemies defeated.
Psalms-55-1: To the director: With instruments. A maskil of David. 55 God, hear my prayer. 55 God, hear my prayer.     Don’t ignore my cry for help. Don’t ignore my cry for help.
Psalms-55-2: 2 Please listen and answer me.     Let me speak to you and tell you what upsets me. Let me speak to you and tell you what upsets me.
Psalms-55-3: 3 My enemies shout at me and threaten me.     In their anger they attack me. In their anger they attack me.     They bring troubles crashing down on me. They bring troubles crashing down on me.
Psalms-55-4: 4 My heart is pounding inside me.     I am afraid to die. I am afraid to die.
Psalms-55-5: 5 I am trembling with fear.     I am terrified! I am terrified!
Psalms-55-6: 6 Oh, I wish I had wings like a dove.     I would fly away and find a place to rest. I would fly away and find a place to rest.
Psalms-55-7: 7     I would go far into the desert and stay there. Selah 7     I would go far into the desert and stay there. Selah
Psalms-55-8: 8 I would run away.     I would escape from this storm of trouble. I would escape from this storm of trouble.
Psalms-55-9: 9 My Lord, confuse their words and stop their plans.     I see so much cruelty and fighting in this city. I see so much cruelty and fighting in this city.
Psalms-55-10: 10 Day and night, in every neighborhood,     the city is filled with evil and trouble. the city is filled with evil and trouble.
Psalms-55-11: 11 There is so much crime in the streets.     People who hurt and cheat others are everywhere. People who hurt and cheat others are everywhere.
Psalms-55-12: 12 If it were an enemy insulting me,     I could bear it. I could bear it. If it were my enemies attacking me,     I could hide. I could hide.
Psalms-55-13: 13 But it is you, the one so close to me,     my companion, my good friend, who does this. my companion, my good friend, who does this.
Psalms-55-14: 14 We used to share our secrets with one another,     as we walked through the crowds together in God’s Temple. as we walked through the crowds together in God’s Temple.
Psalms-55-15: 15 I wish death would take my enemies by surprise!     I wish the earth would open up and swallow them alive,[a] I wish the earth would open up and swallow them alive,[a]     because they plan such terrible things together. because they plan such terrible things together.
Psalms-55-16: 16 I will call to God for help,     and the Lord will save me. and the Lord will save me.
Psalms-55-17: 17 I speak to God morning, noon, and night.     I tell him what upsets me, and he listens to me! I tell him what upsets me, and he listens to me!
Psalms-55-18: 18 I have fought in many battles,     but he has always rescued me and brought me back safely. but he has always rescued me and brought me back safely.
Psalms-55-19: 19 God, who has always ruled as king,     will hear me and punish my enemies. Selah will hear me and punish my enemies. Selah But they will never change.     They don’t fear and respect God. They don’t fear and respect God.
Psalms-55-20: 20 This one who was once my friend now attacks his friends.     He is breaking every promise he made. He is breaking every promise he made.
Psalms-55-21: 21 His words about peace are as smooth as butter,     but he has only war on his mind. but he has only war on his mind. His words are as slick as oil,     but they cut like a knife. but they cut like a knife.
Psalms-55-22: 22 Give your worries to the Lord,     and he will care for you. and he will care for you.     He will never let those who are good be defeated. He will never let those who are good be defeated.
Psalms-55-23: 23 But, God, you will send those liars and murderers to the grave.     They will die before their life is half finished! They will die before their life is half finished! As for me, I will put my trust in you.
Psalms-56-1: To the director: To the tune “The Dove in the Distant Oak.” A miktam of David written when the Philistines captured him in Gath. 56 God, people have attacked me, so be merciful to me. 56 God, people have attacked me, so be merciful to me.     They have been chasing me all day, closing in to attack me. They have been chasing me all day, closing in to attack me.
Psalms-56-2: 2 My enemies come at me constantly.     There are too many fighters to count.[a] There are too many fighters to count.[a]
Psalms-56-3: 3 When I am afraid,     I put my trust in you. I put my trust in you.
Psalms-56-4: 4 I trust God, so I am not afraid of what people can do to me!     I praise God for his promise to me. I praise God for his promise to me.
Psalms-56-5: 5 My enemies are always twisting my words.     They are always making plans against me. They are always making plans against me.
Psalms-56-6: 6 They hide together and watch every move I make,     hoping for some way to kill me. hoping for some way to kill me.
Psalms-56-7: 7 God, send them away because of the bad things they did.     Show your anger and defeat those people. Show your anger and defeat those people.
Psalms-56-8: 8 You know I am very upset.     You know how much I have cried. You know how much I have cried.     Surely you have kept an account of all my tears. Surely you have kept an account of all my tears.
Psalms-56-9: 9 I know that when l call for help, my enemies will turn and run.     I know that because God is with me! I know that because God is with me!
Psalms-56-10: 10 I praise God for his promise.     I praise the Lord for his promise to me. I praise the Lord for his promise to me.
Psalms-56-11: 11 I trust God, so I am not afraid     of what people can do to me! of what people can do to me!
Psalms-56-12: 12 God, I will keep the special promises I made to you.     I will give you my thank offering. I will give you my thank offering.
Psalms-56-13: 13 You saved me from death.     You kept me from being defeated. You kept me from being defeated. So I will serve you in the light     that only the living can see. that only the living can see.
Psalms-57-1: To the director: To the tune “Don’t Destroy.” A miktam of David written when he escaped from Saul and went into the cave. 57 God, be merciful to me. 57 God, be merciful to me.     Be kind because my soul trusts in you. Be kind because my soul trusts in you. I have come to you for protection,     while the trouble passes. while the trouble passes.
Psalms-57-2: 2 I pray to God Most High for help,     and he takes care of me completely! and he takes care of me completely!
Psalms-57-3: 3 From heaven he helps me and saves me.     He will punish the one who attacks me. Selah He will punish the one who attacks me. Selah God will remain loyal to me     and send his love to protect me. and send his love to protect me.
Psalms-57-4: 4 My life is in danger.     My enemies are all around me. My enemies are all around me. They are like man-eating lions,     with teeth like spears or arrows with teeth like spears or arrows     and tongues like sharp swords. and tongues like sharp swords.
Psalms-57-5: 5 God, rise above the heavens!     Let all the world see your glory. Let all the world see your glory.
Psalms-57-6: 6 My enemies set a trap for my feet     to bring me down. to bring me down. They dug a deep pit to catch me,     but they fell into it. Selah but they fell into it. Selah
Psalms-57-7: 7 God, I am ready, heart and soul,     to sing songs of praise. to sing songs of praise.
Psalms-57-8: 8 Wake up, my soul!     Harps and lyres, wake up, Harps and lyres, wake up,     and let’s wake the dawn! and let’s wake the dawn!
Psalms-57-9: 9 My Lord, I will praise you before all people.     I will sing praises about you to every nation. I will sing praises about you to every nation.
Psalms-57-10: 10 Your faithful love is higher     than the highest clouds in the sky! than the highest clouds in the sky!
Psalms-57-11: 11 Rise above the heavens, God.     Let all the world see your glory. Let all the world see your glory.
Psalms-58-1: To the director: To the tune “Don’t Destroy.” A miktam of David. 58 You judges are not being fair in your decisions. 58 You judges are not being fair in your decisions.     You are not judging people fairly. You are not judging people fairly.
Psalms-58-2: 2 No, you only think of evil things to do.     You do violent crimes in this country. You do violent crimes in this country.
Psalms-58-3: 3 Those wicked people started doing wrong as soon as they were born.     They have been liars from birth. They have been liars from birth.
Psalms-58-4: 4 Their anger is as deadly as the poison of a snake.[a]     They shut their ears like a deaf cobra They shut their ears like a deaf cobra
Psalms-58-5: 5 that does not listen to the music of the snake charmers,     no matter how well they play. no matter how well they play.
Psalms-58-6: 6 God, they are like lions.     So, Lord, break their teeth. So, Lord, break their teeth.
Psalms-58-7: 7 May they disappear like water down a drain.     May they be crushed like weeds on a path.[b] May they be crushed like weeds on a path.[b]
Psalms-58-8: 8 May they be like snails melting away as they move.     May they be like a baby born dead, who never saw the light of day. May they be like a baby born dead, who never saw the light of day.
Psalms-58-9: 9 May they be destroyed suddenly,     like the thorns that are burned to quickly heat a pot. like the thorns that are burned to quickly heat a pot.
Psalms-58-10: 10 Good people will be happy     when they see the wicked getting the punishment they deserve. when they see the wicked getting the punishment they deserve. They will feel like soldiers     walking through the blood of their enemies![c] walking through the blood of their enemies![c]
Psalms-58-11: 11 Then people will say, “Good people really are rewarded.     Yes, there is a God judging the world!”[d] Yes, there is a God judging the world!”[d]
Psalms-59-1: To the director: To the tune “Don’t Destroy.” A miktam of David written when Saul sent people to watch David’s house to try to kill him. 59 God, save me from my enemies. 59 God, save me from my enemies.     Protect me from those who stand against me. Protect me from those who stand against me.
Psalms-59-2: 2 Save me from those who do wrong.     Save me from those murderers. Save me from those murderers.
Psalms-59-3: 3 Look, powerful men are waiting for me.     Lord, they are waiting to kill me, Lord, they are waiting to kill me,     even though I did not sin or commit a crime. even though I did not sin or commit a crime.
Psalms-59-4: 4 I have done nothing wrong, but they are rushing to attack me.     Come and see for yourself! Come and see for yourself!
Psalms-59-5: 5 You are the Lord God All-Powerful, the God of Israel!     Get up and punish them. Get up and punish them.     Don’t show any mercy to those traitors. Selah Don’t show any mercy to those traitors. Selah
Psalms-59-6: 6 Those evil men are like dogs     that come into town in the evening, that come into town in the evening,     growling and roaming the streets. growling and roaming the streets.
Psalms-59-7: 7 Listen to their threats and insults.     They say such cruel things, They say such cruel things,     and they don’t care who hears them. and they don’t care who hears them.
Psalms-59-8: 8 Lord, laugh at them.     Make fun of them all. Make fun of them all.
Psalms-59-9: 9 God, my strength, I look to you for help.[a]     You are my place of safety, high in the mountains. You are my place of safety, high in the mountains.
Psalms-59-10: 10 God loves me, and he will help me win.     He will help me defeat my enemies. He will help me defeat my enemies.
Psalms-59-11: 11 Don’t just kill them, or my people might forget.     My Lord and Protector, scatter and defeat them with your strength. My Lord and Protector, scatter and defeat them with your strength.
Psalms-59-12: 12 Those evil people curse and tell lies.     Punish them for what they said. Punish them for what they said.     Let their pride trap them. Let their pride trap them.
Psalms-59-13: 13 Destroy them in your anger.     Destroy them completely! Destroy them completely! Then people all over the world will know     that God rules over the people of Jacob. Selah that God rules over the people of Jacob. Selah
Psalms-59-14: 14 Those evil men are like dogs     that come into town in the evening, growling and roaming the streets. that come into town in the evening, growling and roaming the streets.
Psalms-59-15: 15 They roam around looking for food,     but even if they eat their fill, they still growl and complain. but even if they eat their fill, they still growl and complain.
Psalms-59-16: 16 But I will sing about your strength.     I will rejoice in your love every morning. I will rejoice in your love every morning. You have been my place of safety,     the place I can run to when troubles come. the place I can run to when troubles come.
Psalms-59-17: 17 I will sing praises to you, my source of strength.     You, God, are my place of safety. You, God, are my place of safety.     You are the God who loves me! You are the God who loves me!
Psalms-60-1: To the director: To the tune “Lily of the Agreement.” A miktam of David for teaching. Written when David fought Aram Naharaim and Aram Zobah, and Joab came back and defeated 12,000 Edomite soldiers at Salt Valley. 60 God, you were angry with us. 60 God, you were angry with us.     You rejected us and destroyed our defenses. You rejected us and destroyed our defenses.     Please make us strong again. Please make us strong again.
Psalms-60-2: 2 You shook the earth and split it open.     It is falling apart like a broken wall. It is falling apart like a broken wall.     Please put it back together. Please put it back together.
Psalms-60-3: 3 You have given your people many troubles.     We are dizzy and fall down like drunks. We are dizzy and fall down like drunks.
Psalms-60-4: 4 But you have provided a flag to show your faithful followers     where to gather to escape the enemy’s attack. Selah where to gather to escape the enemy’s attack. Selah
Psalms-60-5: 5 Use your great power and give us victory!     Answer our prayer and save the people you love. Answer our prayer and save the people you love.
Psalms-60-6: 6 God has spoken in his Temple[a]:     “I will win the war and rejoice in victory! “I will win the war and rejoice in victory! I will divide this land among my people.     I will give them Shechem. I will give them Shechem.     I will give them Succoth Valley. I will give them Succoth Valley.
Psalms-60-7: 7 Gilead and Manasseh will be mine.     Ephraim will be my helmet. Ephraim will be my helmet.     Judah will be my royal scepter. Judah will be my royal scepter.
Psalms-60-8: 8 Moab will be the bowl for washing my feet.     Edom will be the slave who carries my sandals. Edom will be the slave who carries my sandals.     I will defeat the Philistines and shout in victory!” I will defeat the Philistines and shout in victory!”
Psalms-60-9-Ps-60-10: 9-10 But, God, it seems that you have left us!     You do not go out with our army. You do not go out with our army. So who will lead me into the strong, protected city?     Who will lead me into battle against Edom? Who will lead me into battle against Edom?
Psalms-60-11: 11 Help us defeat the enemy!     No one on earth can rescue us. No one on earth can rescue us.
Psalms-60-12: 12 Only God can make us strong.     Only God can defeat our enemies! Only God can defeat our enemies!
Psalms-61-1: To the director: With stringed instruments. A song of David. 61 God, hear my cry for help. 61 God, hear my cry for help.     Listen to my prayer. Listen to my prayer.
Psalms-61-2: 2 From a faraway land I call to you for help.     I feel so weak and helpless! I feel so weak and helpless! Carry me to a high rock     where no one can reach me. where no one can reach me.
Psalms-61-3: 3 You are my place of safety,     a strong tower that protects me from my enemies. a strong tower that protects me from my enemies.
Psalms-61-4: 4 I want to live in your tent[a] forever.     I want to hide where you can protect me. Selah I want to hide where you can protect me. Selah
Psalms-61-5: 5 God, you heard what I promised to give you,     but everything your worshipers have comes from you. but everything your worshipers have comes from you.
Psalms-61-6: 6 Give the king a long life.     Let him live forever! Let him live forever!
Psalms-61-7: 7 Let him rule in your presence forever.     Protect him with your faithful love. Protect him with your faithful love.
Psalms-61-8: 8 Then I will praise your name forever.     Every day I will do what I promised. Every day I will do what I promised.
Psalms-62-1: To the director, Jeduthun.[a] A song of David. 62 I must calm down and turn to God; 62 I must calm down and turn to God;     only he can rescue me. only he can rescue me.
Psalms-62-2: 2 He is my Rock, the only one who can save me.     He is my high place of safety, where no army can defeat me. He is my high place of safety, where no army can defeat me.
Psalms-62-3: 3 How long will you people attack me?     Do you all want to kill me? Do you all want to kill me? I am like a leaning wall,     like a fence ready to fall. like a fence ready to fall.
Psalms-62-4: 4 You want only to destroy me,     to bring me down from my important position. to bring me down from my important position. It makes you happy to tell lies about me.     In public, you say nice things, In public, you say nice things,     but in private, you curse me. Selah but in private, you curse me. Selah
Psalms-62-5: 5 I must calm down and turn to God;     he is my only hope. he is my only hope.
Psalms-62-6: 6 He is my Rock, the only one who can save me.     He is my high place of safety, where no army can defeat me. He is my high place of safety, where no army can defeat me.
Psalms-62-7: 7 My victory and honor come from God.     He is the mighty Rock, where I am safe. He is the mighty Rock, where I am safe.
Psalms-62-8: 8 People, always put your trust in God!     Tell him all your problems. Tell him all your problems.     God is our place of safety. Selah God is our place of safety. Selah
Psalms-62-9: 9 People cannot really help.     You cannot depend on them. You cannot depend on them. Compared to God, they are nothing—     no more than a gentle puff of air! no more than a gentle puff of air!
Psalms-62-10: 10 Don’t trust in your power to take things by force.     Don’t think you will gain anything by stealing. Don’t think you will gain anything by stealing. And if you become wealthy,     don’t put your trust in riches. don’t put your trust in riches.
Psalms-62-11: 11 God says there is one thing you can really depend on, and I believe it:     “Strength comes from God!” “Strength comes from God!”
Psalms-62-12: 12 My Lord, your love is real.     You reward all people for what they do. You reward all people for what they do.
Psalms-63-1: A song of David written when he was in the desert of Judah. 63 God, you are my God. 63 God, you are my God.     I am searching so hard to find you. I am searching so hard to find you. Body and soul, I thirst for you     in this dry and weary land without water. in this dry and weary land without water.
Psalms-63-2: 2 Yes, I have seen you in your Temple.[a]     I have seen your strength and glory. I have seen your strength and glory.
Psalms-63-3: 3 Your faithful love is better than life,     so my lips praise you. so my lips praise you.
Psalms-63-4: 4 By my life, I will praise you.     In your name, I lift my hands in prayer. In your name, I lift my hands in prayer.
Psalms-63-5: 5 When I sit down to satisfy my hunger,     my joyful lips hunger to praise you! my joyful lips hunger to praise you!
Psalms-63-6: 6 I remember you while lying on my bed.     I think about you in the middle of the night. I think about you in the middle of the night.
Psalms-63-7: 7 That is because you are the one who helps me.     It makes me happy to be under your protection! It makes me happy to be under your protection!
Psalms-63-8: 8 I stay close to you,     and you hold me with your powerful arm. and you hold me with your powerful arm.
Psalms-63-9: 9 Those who are trying to kill me will be destroyed.     They will go down to their graves. They will go down to their graves.
Psalms-63-10: 10 They will be killed with swords.     Wild dogs will eat their dead bodies. Wild dogs will eat their dead bodies.
Psalms-63-11: 11 But the king will be happy with his God,     and those who promised to obey him will praise him when he defeats those liars. and those who promised to obey him will praise him when he defeats those liars.
Psalms-64-1: To the director: A song of David. 64 God, listen to my complaint. 64 God, listen to my complaint.     Save me from the terrible threats of my enemies! Save me from the terrible threats of my enemies!
Psalms-64-2: 2 Protect me from the secret plans of the wicked.     Hide me from that gang of evil people. Hide me from that gang of evil people.
Psalms-64-3: 3 They sharpen their tongues to use like swords.     They aim their poisonous words like arrows. They aim their poisonous words like arrows.
Psalms-64-4: 4 Suddenly, from their hiding places, they let their arrows fly.     They shoot to kill innocent people. They shoot to kill innocent people.
Psalms-64-5: 5 They encourage each other to do wrong.     They talk about setting traps and say, “No one will see them here! They talk about setting traps and say, “No one will see them here!
Psalms-64-6: 6 No one will discover our crime.     We have the perfect plan!” We have the perfect plan!” Yes, people can be very tricky and hard to understand.
Psalms-64-7: 7 But suddenly, God will shoot his arrows,     and those wicked people will be hit. and those wicked people will be hit.
Psalms-64-8: 8 He will use their own words against them,     and they will be destroyed. and they will be destroyed. Then everyone who sees them     will shake their heads in amazement. will shake their heads in amazement.
Psalms-64-9: 9 People will see what God has done.     They will tell other people about him. They will tell other people about him. Then everyone will learn more about God.     They will learn to fear and respect him. They will learn to fear and respect him.
Psalms-64-10: 10 Good people are happy to serve the Lord.     They depend on him to protect them. They depend on him to protect them.     All those who want to do right will praise him! All those who want to do right will praise him!
Psalms-65-1: To the director: A praise song of David. 65 God in Zion, we praise you 65 God in Zion, we praise you     and give you what we promised. and give you what we promised.
Psalms-65-2: 2 Anyone can come to you,     and you will listen to their prayers. and you will listen to their prayers.
Psalms-65-3: 3 When our sins become too heavy for us,     you wipe them away. you wipe them away.
Psalms-65-4: 4 Oh, how wonderful it is to be the people you chose     to come and stay in your Temple. to come and stay in your Temple. And we are so happy to have the wonderful things     that are in your Temple, your holy palace. that are in your Temple, your holy palace.
