Psalms-65-5: 5 God, you answer our prayers and do what is right.     You do amazing things to save us. You do amazing things to save us. People all over the world know they can trust in you,     even those who live across the sea. even those who live across the sea.
Psalms-65-6: 6 You made the mountains.     We see your power all around us. We see your power all around us.
Psalms-65-7: 7 You can calm the roughest seas     or the nations raging around us. or the nations raging around us.
Psalms-65-8: 8 People all around the world are amazed at the wonderful things you do.     You make all people, east and west, sing with joy. You make all people, east and west, sing with joy.
Psalms-65-9: 9 You take care of the land.     You water it and make it fertile. You water it and make it fertile. Your streams are always filled with water.     That’s how you make the crops grow. That’s how you make the crops grow.
Psalms-65-10: 10 You pour rain on the plowed fields;     you soak the fields with water. you soak the fields with water. You make the ground soft with rain,     and you make the young plants grow. and you make the young plants grow.
Psalms-65-11: 11 You start the new year with a good harvest.     You end the year with many crops.[a] You end the year with many crops.[a]
Psalms-65-12: 12 The desert and hills are covered with grass.
Psalms-65-13: 13 The pastures are covered with sheep.     The valleys are filled with grain. The valleys are filled with grain.     Everything is singing and shouting for joy. Everything is singing and shouting for joy.
Psalms-66-1: To the director: A song of praise. 66 Everything on earth, shout with joy to God! 66 Everything on earth, shout with joy to God!
Psalms-66-2: 2 Praise his glorious name!     Honor him with songs of praise! Honor him with songs of praise!
Psalms-66-3: 3 Tell God, “Your works are wonderful!     Your great power makes your enemies bow down in fear before you. Your great power makes your enemies bow down in fear before you.
Psalms-66-4: 4 Let the whole world worship you.     Let everyone sing praises to your name.” Selah Let everyone sing praises to your name.” Selah
Psalms-66-5: 5 Look at what God has done!     These things amaze us. These things amaze us.
Psalms-66-6: 6 He changed the sea to dry land,[a]     and his people went across the water[b] on foot. and his people went across the water[b] on foot.     So let’s celebrate because of what he has done! So let’s celebrate because of what he has done!
Psalms-66-7: 7 He rules the world with his great power.     He watches people everywhere. He watches people everywhere.     No one can rebel against him. Selah No one can rebel against him. Selah
Psalms-66-8: 8 People, praise our God.     Sing loud songs of praise to him. Sing loud songs of praise to him.
Psalms-66-9: 9 He continues to give us life,     and he keeps us from falling. and he keeps us from falling.
Psalms-66-10: 10 God, you have tested us, as people test silver with fire.
Psalms-66-11: 11 You let us be trapped.     You put heavy burdens on us. You put heavy burdens on us.
Psalms-66-12: 12 You let our enemies run over us.     We went through fire and water, We went through fire and water,     but you brought us to a safe place. but you brought us to a safe place.
Psalms-66-13-Ps-66-14: 13-14 So I bring sacrifices to your Temple. When I was in trouble, I asked for help     and made promises to you. and made promises to you. Now I am giving you what I promised.
Psalms-66-15: 15     I bring my best sheep as burnt offerings. 15     I bring my best sheep as burnt offerings. I offer the smoke from them up to you.     I give you sacrifices of bulls and goats. Selah I give you sacrifices of bulls and goats. Selah
Psalms-66-16: 16 All you people who worship God,     come and I will tell you what he has done for me. come and I will tell you what he has done for me.
Psalms-66-17-Ps-66-18: 17-18 I cried out to him for help,     and I praised him. and I praised him. If I had been hiding sin in my heart,     the Lord would not have listened to me. the Lord would not have listened to me.
Psalms-66-19: 19 But God did listen to me;     he heard my prayer. he heard my prayer.
Psalms-66-20: 20 Praise God!     He did not turn away from me—he listened to my prayer. He did not turn away from me—he listened to my prayer.     He continues to show his love to me! He continues to show his love to me!
Psalms-67-1: To the director: With instruments. A song of praise. 67 God, show mercy to us and bless us. 67 God, show mercy to us and bless us.     Please accept us! Selah Please accept us! Selah
Psalms-67-2: 2 Let everyone on earth learn about you.     Let every nation see how you save people. Let every nation see how you save people.
Psalms-67-3: 3 May people praise you, God!     May all people praise you. May all people praise you.
Psalms-67-4: 4 May all nations rejoice and be happy     because you judge people fairly. because you judge people fairly.     You rule over every nation. You rule over every nation.
Psalms-67-5: 5 May the people praise you, God!     May all people praise you. May all people praise you.
Psalms-67-6: 6 God, our God, bless us.     Let our land give us a great harvest. Let our land give us a great harvest.
Psalms-67-7: 7 May God bless us,     and may all people on earth fear and respect him. and may all people on earth fear and respect him.
Psalms-68-1: To the director: A praise song of David. 68 God, get up and scatter your enemies! 68 God, get up and scatter your enemies!     May all your enemies run from you. May all your enemies run from you.
Psalms-68-2: 2 May your enemies be scattered     like smoke blown away by the wind. like smoke blown away by the wind. May your enemies be destroyed     like wax melting in a fire. like wax melting in a fire.
Psalms-68-3: 3 But let good people be happy.     Let them gather before God and enjoy themselves together. Let them gather before God and enjoy themselves together.
Psalms-68-4: 4 Sing to God! Sing praises to his name!     Prepare the way for the one who rides on the clouds. Prepare the way for the one who rides on the clouds. His name is Yah.[a]     Worship before him with joy. Worship before him with joy.
Psalms-68-5: 5 God, who lives in his holy palace, is a father to orphans,     and he takes care of widows. and he takes care of widows.
Psalms-68-6: 6 God provides homes for those who are lonely.     He frees people from prison and makes them happy. He frees people from prison and makes them happy.     But those who turn against him will live in the desert. But those who turn against him will live in the desert.
Psalms-68-7: 7 God, you led your people out of Egypt.     You marched across the desert. Selah You marched across the desert. Selah
Psalms-68-8: 8 The ground shook and rain poured from the sky     when God, the God of Israel, came to Sinai. when God, the God of Israel, came to Sinai.
Psalms-68-9: 9 God, you sent the rain     to make a tired, old land strong again. to make a tired, old land strong again.
Psalms-68-10: 10 Your people[b] came back to live there,     and you provided good things for the poor. and you provided good things for the poor.
Psalms-68-11: 11 My Lord gave the command,     and many people went to tell the good news: and many people went to tell the good news:
Psalms-68-12: 12 “The armies of powerful kings ran away!     At home, the women divide the things brought from the battle. At home, the women divide the things brought from the battle.
Psalms-68-13: 13 Those who stayed home will share in the wealth—     metal doves with wings covered in silver and feathers sparkling with gold.” metal doves with wings covered in silver and feathers sparkling with gold.”
Psalms-68-14: 14 God All-Powerful scattered the kings     like snow falling on Mount Zalmon. like snow falling on Mount Zalmon.
Psalms-68-15: 15 Mount Bashan is a great mountain     with many high peaks. with many high peaks.
Psalms-68-16: 16 But, Bashan, why are you jealous of Mount Zion?     That is where God has chosen to live. That is where God has chosen to live.     The Lord will live there forever. The Lord will live there forever.
Psalms-68-17: 17 With his millions of chariots,     the Lord came from Sinai into the holy place. the Lord came from Sinai into the holy place.
Psalms-68-18: 18 You went up to your high place,     leading a parade of captives. leading a parade of captives. You received gifts from people,[c]     even those who turned against you. even those who turned against you.     The Lord God went up there to live. The Lord God went up there to live.
Psalms-68-19: 19 Praise the Lord!     Every day he helps us with the loads we must carry. Every day he helps us with the loads we must carry.     He is the God who saves us. Selah He is the God who saves us. Selah
Psalms-68-20: 20 He is our God, the God who saves us.     My Lord God saves us from death. My Lord God saves us from death.
Psalms-68-21: 21 God will smash the heads of his enemies.     He will punish those who fight against him.[d] He will punish those who fight against him.[d]
Psalms-68-22: 22 My Lord said, “If they run up to Bashan or down to the depths of the sea,     I will bring them back. I will bring them back.
Psalms-68-23: 23 So you will march through pools of their blood,     and there will be plenty left for your dogs.” and there will be plenty left for your dogs.”
Psalms-68-24: 24 God, everyone can see your victory parade—     the victory march of my God and King into his holy place![e] the victory march of my God and King into his holy place![e]
Psalms-68-25: 25 Singers come marching in front, followed by the musicians;     they are surrounded by young girls playing tambourines. they are surrounded by young girls playing tambourines.
Psalms-68-26: 26 Praise God in the meeting place.[f]     Praise the Lord, people of Israel! Praise the Lord, people of Israel!
Psalms-68-27: 27 There is the smallest tribe, Benjamin, leading them.     And there comes a large group of leaders from Judah. And there comes a large group of leaders from Judah.     Following them are the leaders of Zebulun and Naphtali. Following them are the leaders of Zebulun and Naphtali.
Psalms-68-28: 28 God, show us your power!     Show us the power you used for us in the past. Show us the power you used for us in the past.
Psalms-68-29: 29 Kings will bring their wealth to you,     to your Temple in Jerusalem. to your Temple in Jerusalem.
Psalms-68-30: 30 Punish the people in Egypt.     They are like cattle in the marshes, like bulls among the calves. They are like cattle in the marshes, like bulls among the calves. You humiliated them.     You scattered them in war. You scattered them in war. Now let them come crawling to you,     bringing their pieces of silver. bringing their pieces of silver.
Psalms-68-31: 31 Messengers from Egypt will come bearing gifts.     Ethiopia will offer God their tribute. Ethiopia will offer God their tribute.
Psalms-68-32: 32 Kings on earth, sing to God!     Sing songs of praise to our Lord! Selah Sing songs of praise to our Lord! Selah
Psalms-68-33: 33 Sing to him who rides his chariot through the ancient skies.     Listen to his powerful voice! Listen to his powerful voice!
Psalms-68-34: 34 Tell everyone how powerful he is!     He rules over Israel. He rules over Israel.     His power fills the skies. His power fills the skies.
Psalms-68-35: 35 God, you are awesome in your Temple!     The God of Israel is the one who gives strength and power to his people. The God of Israel is the one who gives strength and power to his people. Praise God!
Psalms-69-1: To the director: To the tune “The Lilies.” A song of David. 69 God, save me from all my troubles! 69 God, save me from all my troubles!     The rising water has reached my neck. The rising water has reached my neck.
Psalms-69-2: 2 I have nothing to stand on.     I am sinking down, down into the mud. I am sinking down, down into the mud. I am in deep water,     and the waves are about to cover me. and the waves are about to cover me.
Psalms-69-3: 3 I am getting weak from calling for help.     My throat is sore. My throat is sore. I have waited and looked for your help     until my eyes are hurting. until my eyes are hurting.
Psalms-69-4: 4 I have more enemies than the hairs on my head.     They hate me for no reason. They hate me for no reason.     They try hard to destroy me. They try hard to destroy me. My enemies tell lies about me.     They say I stole from them They say I stole from them     and they demand that I pay for things I did not steal. and they demand that I pay for things I did not steal.
Psalms-69-5: 5 God, you know my faults.     I cannot hide my sins from you. I cannot hide my sins from you.
Psalms-69-6: 6 My Lord God All-Powerful, don’t let me embarrass your followers.     God of Israel, don’t let me bring disgrace to those who worship you. God of Israel, don’t let me bring disgrace to those who worship you.
Psalms-69-7: 7 My face is covered with shame.     I carry this shame for you. I carry this shame for you.
Psalms-69-8: 8 My own brothers treat me like a stranger.     They act as if I came from a foreign land. They act as if I came from a foreign land.
Psalms-69-9: 9 My strong devotion to your Temple is destroying me.     Those who insult you are also insulting me. Those who insult you are also insulting me.
Psalms-69-10: 10 When I spend time crying and fasting,     they make fun of me. they make fun of me.
Psalms-69-11: 11 When I wear sackcloth to show my sorrow,     they tell jokes about me. they tell jokes about me.
Psalms-69-12: 12 They talk about me in public places.     The beer drinkers make up songs about me. The beer drinkers make up songs about me.
Psalms-69-13: 13 As for me, Lord, this is my prayer to you:     Please accept me! Please accept me! God, I want you to answer me with love.     I know I can trust you to save me. I know I can trust you to save me.
Psalms-69-14: 14 Pull me from the mud,     and don’t let me sink down deeper. and don’t let me sink down deeper. Save me from those who hate me.     Save me from this deep water. Save me from this deep water.
Psalms-69-15: 15 Don’t let the waves drown me.     Don’t let the deep sea swallow me Don’t let the deep sea swallow me     or the grave close its mouth on me. or the grave close its mouth on me.
Psalms-69-16: 16 Answer me, Lord, from the goodness of your faithful love.     Out of your great kindness turn to me and help me! Out of your great kindness turn to me and help me!
Psalms-69-17: 17 Don’t turn away from your servant.     I am in trouble, so hurry and help me! I am in trouble, so hurry and help me!
Psalms-69-18: 18 Come save my soul.     Rescue me from my enemies. Rescue me from my enemies.
Psalms-69-19: 19 You know the shame I have suffered.     You know all my enemies. You know all my enemies.     You saw how they humiliated me. You saw how they humiliated me.
Psalms-69-20: 20 I feel the pain of their insults.     The shame makes me feel like dying! The shame makes me feel like dying! I wanted some sympathy,     but there was none. but there was none. I waited for someone to comfort me,     but no one came. but no one came.
Psalms-69-21: 21 They gave me poison, not food.     They gave me vinegar, not wine. They gave me vinegar, not wine.
Psalms-69-22: 22 Their tables are covered with food.     Let their fellowship meals destroy them. Let their fellowship meals destroy them.
Psalms-69-23: 23 Let them go blind and their backs become weak.
Psalms-69-24: 24 Show them how angry you are.     Let them feel what your anger can do. Let them feel what your anger can do.
Psalms-69-25: 25 Make their homes empty.     Don’t let anyone live there. Don’t let anyone live there.
Psalms-69-26: 26 They try to hurt people you have already punished.     They tell everyone about the suffering you gave them. They tell everyone about the suffering you gave them.
Psalms-69-27: 27 Punish them for the bad things they have done.     Don’t show them how good you can be. Don’t show them how good you can be.
Psalms-69-28: 28 Erase their names from the book of life.     Don’t let their names appear on the list of those who do what is right. Don’t let their names appear on the list of those who do what is right.
Psalms-69-29: 29 I am sad and hurting.     God, lift me up and save me! God, lift me up and save me!
Psalms-69-30: 30 I will praise God’s name in song.     I will honor him by giving him thanks. I will honor him by giving him thanks.
Psalms-69-31: 31 The Lord will be happier with this     than with the offering of an ox or a full-grown bull as a sacrifice. than with the offering of an ox or a full-grown bull as a sacrifice.
Psalms-69-32: 32 Poor people, you came to worship God.     You will be happy to know these things. You will be happy to know these things.
Psalms-69-33: 33 The Lord listens to poor, helpless people.     He does not turn away from those who are in prison. He does not turn away from those who are in prison.
Psalms-69-34: 34 Praise him, heaven and earth!     Sea and everything in it, praise him! Sea and everything in it, praise him!
Psalms-69-35: 35 God will save Zion.     He will rebuild the cities of Judah. He will rebuild the cities of Judah. The people will settle there again and own the land.
Psalms-69-36: 36     The descendants of his servants will get that land. 36     The descendants of his servants will get that land.     Those who love his name will live there. Those who love his name will live there.
Psalms-70-1: To the director: A song of David to help people remember. 70 Please, God, rescue me! 70 Please, God, rescue me!     Lord, hurry and help me! Lord, hurry and help me!
Psalms-70-2: 2 People are trying to kill me.     Please disappoint them. Please disappoint them.     Humiliate them! Humiliate them! They want to hurt me.     Make them run away in shame. Make them run away in shame.
Psalms-70-3: 3 May those who make fun of me     be too embarrassed to speak. be too embarrassed to speak.
Psalms-70-4: 4 But may those who come to you     be happy and rejoice. be happy and rejoice. May those who love being saved by you     always be able to say, “Praise God!”[a] always be able to say, “Praise God!”[a]
Psalms-70-5: 5 I am only a poor, helpless man.     God, please hurry to me. God, please hurry to me. You are my helper, the one who can save me.     Lord, don’t be too late! Lord, don’t be too late!
Psalms-71-1: 71 Lord, I depend on you for protection. 71 Lord, I depend on you for protection.     Don’t let me be disappointed. Don’t let me be disappointed.
Psalms-71-2: 2 You always do what is right, so come and save me.     Listen to me and save me. Listen to me and save me.
Psalms-71-3: 3 Be my Rock, my place of safety.     Be my fortress, and protect me! Be my fortress, and protect me! You are my Rock and my protection.
Psalms-71-4: 4 My God, save me from wicked people.     Save me from cruel, evil people. Save me from cruel, evil people.
Psalms-71-5: 5 Lord God, you are my hope.     I have trusted you since I was a young boy. I have trusted you since I was a young boy.
Psalms-71-6: 6 I depended on you even before I was born.     I relied on you even in my mother’s womb. I relied on you even in my mother’s womb.     I have always prayed to you.[a] I have always prayed to you.[a]
Psalms-71-7: 7 You are my source of strength,     so I have been an example to others. so I have been an example to others.
Psalms-71-8: 8 I am always singing about the wonderful things you do.
Psalms-71-9: 9 Don’t throw me away just because I am old.     Don’t leave me as I lose my strength. Don’t leave me as I lose my strength.
Psalms-71-10: 10 My enemies make plans against me.     They have met together and are making plans to kill me. They have met together and are making plans to kill me.
Psalms-71-11: 11 They say, “Go get him!     God has left him, so there is no one to help him.” God has left him, so there is no one to help him.”
Psalms-71-12: 12 God, don’t leave me!     My God, hurry and help me! My God, hurry and help me!
Psalms-71-13: 13 Defeat my enemies.     Destroy them completely! Destroy them completely! They are trying to hurt me.     Let them suffer shame and disgrace. Let them suffer shame and disgrace.
Psalms-71-14: 14 Then I will always trust in you     and praise you more and more. and praise you more and more.
Psalms-71-15: 15 I will tell people how good you are.     I will tell about all the times you saved me— I will tell about all the times you saved me—     too many times to count. too many times to count.
Psalms-71-16: 16 I will tell about your greatness, my Lord God.     I will talk only about you and your goodness. I will talk only about you and your goodness.
Psalms-71-17: 17 God, you have taught me since I was a young boy.     And to this day I have told people about the wonderful things you do. And to this day I have told people about the wonderful things you do.
Psalms-71-18: 18 Now that I am old and my hair is gray, don’t leave me, God.     I must tell the next generation about your power and greatness. I must tell the next generation about your power and greatness.
Psalms-71-19: 19 God, your goodness reaches far above the skies.     You have done wonderful things. You have done wonderful things.     God, there is no one like you. God, there is no one like you.
Psalms-71-20: 20 You have let me see troubles and hard times,     but you will give me new life; but you will give me new life;     you will lift me up from this pit of death! you will lift me up from this pit of death!
Psalms-71-21: 21 You will help me do even greater things.     You will comfort me again! You will comfort me again!
Psalms-71-22: 22 I will play the harp and praise you.     My God, I will sing about your faithfulness. My God, I will sing about your faithfulness. I will play songs on my lyre     for the Holy One of Israel. for the Holy One of Israel.
Psalms-71-23: 23 I will shout for joy,     singing songs of praise to you for saving me. singing songs of praise to you for saving me.
Psalms-71-24: 24 My tongue will sing about your goodness all the time,     because those who wanted to kill me because those who wanted to kill me     have been defeated and disgraced. have been defeated and disgraced.
Psalms-72-1: To Solomon.[a] 72 God, help the king be like you and make fair decisions. 72 God, help the king be like you and make fair decisions.     Help the king’s son know what justice is. Help the king’s son know what justice is.
Psalms-72-2: 2 Help the king judge your people fairly.     Help him make wise decisions for your poor people. Help him make wise decisions for your poor people.
Psalms-72-3: 3 Let there be peace and justice throughout the land,     known on every mountain and hill. known on every mountain and hill.
Psalms-72-4: 4 May the king be fair to the poor.     May he help the helpless and punish those who hurt them. May he help the helpless and punish those who hurt them.
Psalms-72-5: 5 May people always fear and respect you, God,     as long as the sun shines and the moon is in the sky. as long as the sun shines and the moon is in the sky.
Psalms-72-6: 6 Help the king be like rain falling on the fields,     like showers falling on the land. like showers falling on the land.
Psalms-72-7: 7 Let goodness grow everywhere while he is king.     Let peace continue as long as there is a moon. Let peace continue as long as there is a moon.
Psalms-72-8: 8 Let his kingdom grow from sea to sea,     from the Euphrates River to the faraway places on earth.[b] from the Euphrates River to the faraway places on earth.[b]
Psalms-72-9: 9 May all the people living in the desert bow down to him.     May all his enemies bow before him with their faces in the dirt. May all his enemies bow before him with their faces in the dirt.
Psalms-72-10: 10 May the kings of Tarshish and all the faraway lands by the sea bring gifts to him.     May the kings of Sheba and Seba bring their tribute to him. May the kings of Sheba and Seba bring their tribute to him.
Psalms-72-11: 11 May all kings bow down to our king.     May all nations serve him. May all nations serve him.
Psalms-72-12: 12 Our king helps the poor who cry out to him—     those in need who have no one to help them. those in need who have no one to help them.
Psalms-72-13: 13 He feels sorry for all who are weak and poor.     He protects their lives. He protects their lives.
Psalms-72-14: 14 He saves them from the cruel people who try to hurt them.     Their lives are important to him. Their lives are important to him.
Psalms-72-15: 15 Long live the king!     Let him receive gold from Sheba. Let him receive gold from Sheba. Always pray for the king.     Ask God to bless him every day. Ask God to bless him every day.
Psalms-72-16: 16 May the fields grow plenty of grain     and the hills be covered with crops. and the hills be covered with crops. May the fields be as fertile as Lebanon,     and may people fill the cities as grass covers a field. and may people fill the cities as grass covers a field.
Psalms-72-17: 17 May the king be famous forever.     May people remember his name as long as the sun shines. May people remember his name as long as the sun shines. May all nations be blessed through him,     and may they all bless him. and may they all bless him.
Psalms-72-18: 18 Praise the Lord God, the God of Israel!     Only he can do such amazing things. Only he can do such amazing things.
Psalms-72-19: 19 Praise his glorious name forever!     Let his glory fill the whole world. Let his glory fill the whole world. Amen and Amen!
Psalms-72-20: 20 (This ends the prayers of David son of Jesse.)
Psalms-73-1: Book 3 (Psalms 73-89) Asaph’s song of praise. 73 God is so good to Israel, 73 God is so good to Israel,     to those whose hearts are pure. to those whose hearts are pure.
Psalms-73-2: 2 But I almost slipped and lost my balance.     I almost fell into sin. I almost fell into sin.
Psalms-73-3: 3 I saw that wicked people were successful,     and I became jealous of those proud people. and I became jealous of those proud people.
Psalms-73-4: 4 They are healthy.     They don’t have to struggle to survive.[a] They don’t have to struggle to survive.[a]
Psalms-73-5: 5 They don’t suffer like the rest of us.     They don’t have troubles like other people. They don’t have troubles like other people.
Psalms-73-6: 6 So they are proud and hateful.     This is as easy to see as the jewels and fancy clothes they wear. This is as easy to see as the jewels and fancy clothes they wear.
Psalms-73-7: 7 If they see something they like, they go and take it.     They do whatever they want. They do whatever they want.
Psalms-73-8: 8 They make fun of others and say cruel things about them.     In their pride they make plans to hurt people. In their pride they make plans to hurt people.
Psalms-73-9: 9 They think they are gods!     They think they are the rulers of the earth. They think they are the rulers of the earth.
Psalms-73-10: 10 [b] Even God’s people turn to them     and do what they say. and do what they say.
Psalms-73-11: 11 Those evil people say, “God does not know what we are doing!     God Most High does not know!” God Most High does not know!”
Psalms-73-12: 12 Those proud people are wicked,     but they are rich and getting richer. but they are rich and getting richer.
Psalms-73-13: 13 Clearly, then, I gain nothing by keeping my thoughts pure!     What good is it to keep myself from sin? What good is it to keep myself from sin?
Psalms-73-14: 14 God, I suffer all day long,     and you punish me every morning. and you punish me every morning.
Psalms-73-15: 15 I wanted to tell others these things,     but that would have made me a traitor to your people. but that would have made me a traitor to your people.
Psalms-73-16: 16 I tried hard to understand all this,     but it was too hard for me. but it was too hard for me.
Psalms-73-17: 17 But then, God, I went to your Temple,     and I understood what will happen to the wicked. and I understood what will happen to the wicked.
Psalms-73-18: 18 Clearly, you have put them in danger.     You make it easy for them to fall and be destroyed. You make it easy for them to fall and be destroyed.
Psalms-73-19: 19 Trouble can come suddenly,     and they will be ruined. and they will be ruined. Terrible things can happen to them,     and they will be finished. and they will be finished.
Psalms-73-20: 20 Then they will be like a dream     that we forget when we wake up. that we forget when we wake up. You will make them disappear     like the monsters in our dreams. like the monsters in our dreams.
Psalms-73-21-Ps-73-22: 21-22 I was so stupid.     I thought about such people and became upset. I thought about such people and became upset. God, I was upset and angry with you!     I acted like a senseless animal. I acted like a senseless animal.
Psalms-73-23: 23 But I am always with you.     You hold my hand. You hold my hand.
Psalms-73-24: 24 You lead me and give me good advice,     and later you will lead me to glory.[c] and later you will lead me to glory.[c]
Psalms-73-25: 25 In heaven, God, I have only you.     And if I am with you, what on earth could I want? And if I am with you, what on earth could I want?
Psalms-73-26: 26 Maybe my mind[d] and body will become weak,     but God is my source of strength.[e] but God is my source of strength.[e]     He is mine forever! He is mine forever!
Psalms-73-27: 27 God, people who leave you will be lost.     You will destroy all who are not faithful to you. You will destroy all who are not faithful to you.
Psalms-73-28: 28 As for me, all I need is to be close to God.     I have made the Lord God my place of safety. I have made the Lord God my place of safety.     And, God, I will tell about all that you have done. And, God, I will tell about all that you have done.
Psalms-74-1: A maskil of Asaph. 74 God, why have you turned away from us for so long? 74 God, why have you turned away from us for so long?     Why are you still angry with us, your own flock? Why are you still angry with us, your own flock?
Psalms-74-2: 2 Remember the people you bought so long ago.     You saved us, and we belong to you. You saved us, and we belong to you. And remember Mount Zion, the place where you lived.
Psalms-74-3: 3 God, come walk through these ancient ruins.     Come back to the Holy Place that the enemy destroyed. Come back to the Holy Place that the enemy destroyed.
Psalms-74-4: 4 The enemy shouted their war cries in the Temple.     They put up their flags there to show they had won the war. They put up their flags there to show they had won the war.
Psalms-74-5: 5 Their soldiers attacked the doors,     like workmen chopping down trees. like workmen chopping down trees.
Psalms-74-6: 6 Using axes and hatchets,     they smashed the carved panels inside. they smashed the carved panels inside.
Psalms-74-7: 7 They burned down your Holy Place.     It was built to honor your name, It was built to honor your name,     but they pulled it down to the ground. but they pulled it down to the ground.
Psalms-74-8: 8 The enemy decided to crush us completely.     They burned every holy place[a] in the country. They burned every holy place[a] in the country.
Psalms-74-9: 9 We do not see any of our signs.[b]     There are no more prophets. There are no more prophets.     And no one knows how long this will last. And no one knows how long this will last.
Psalms-74-10: 10 God, how much longer will the enemy make fun of us?     Will you let them insult your name forever? Will you let them insult your name forever?
Psalms-74-11: 11 Why won’t you help us?     Use your power to defeat our enemies! Use your power to defeat our enemies!
Psalms-74-12: 12 God, you have been our King for a long time.     You have saved us many times on this earth. You have saved us many times on this earth.
Psalms-74-13: 13 With your great power you split open the sea     and broke the heads of the sea monster. and broke the heads of the sea monster.
Psalms-74-14: 14 Yes, you smashed the heads of Leviathan[c]     and left his body for animals to eat. and left his body for animals to eat.
Psalms-74-15: 15 You make the springs and rivers flow,     and you make the rivers dry up. and you make the rivers dry up.
Psalms-74-16: 16 You control the day and the night.     You made the sun and the moon. You made the sun and the moon.
Psalms-74-17: 17 You set the limits for everything on earth.     And you created summer and winter. And you created summer and winter.
Psalms-74-18: 18 Lord, remember, the enemy insulted you!     Those foolish people hate your name! Those foolish people hate your name!
Psalms-74-19: 19 Don’t give us like a helpless dove to those wild animals.     Never forget your poor, suffering people. Never forget your poor, suffering people.
Psalms-74-20: 20 Remember the agreement you gave us,     because violence fills every dark place in this land. because violence fills every dark place in this land.
Psalms-74-21: 21 Your people were treated badly.     Don’t let them be hurt anymore. Don’t let them be hurt anymore.     Let your poor, helpless people praise you. Let your poor, helpless people praise you.
Psalms-74-22: 22 God, get up and defend yourself!     Remember, those fools challenged you. Remember, those fools challenged you.
Psalms-74-23: 23 Don’t forget the shouts of your enemies.     They insulted you again and again. They insulted you again and again.
Psalms-75-1: To the director: To the tune “Don’t Destroy.” One of Asaph’s songs of praise. 75 We praise you, God! 75 We praise you, God!     We praise you because you[a] are near to us. We praise you because you[a] are near to us.     We tell about the amazing things you have done. We tell about the amazing things you have done.
Psalms-75-2: 2 God says, “I have chosen a time for judgment,     and I will judge fairly. and I will judge fairly.
Psalms-75-3: 3 The earth and all its people may shake,     but I am the one who keeps it steady. Selah but I am the one who keeps it steady. Selah
Psalms-75-4: 4 “To those who are proud I say, ‘Stop your boasting.’     I warn the wicked, ‘Don’t brag about how strong you are. I warn the wicked, ‘Don’t brag about how strong you are.
Psalms-75-5: 5 Don’t be so sure that you will win.     Don’t boast that victory is yours!’” Don’t boast that victory is yours!’”
Psalms-75-6: 6 There is no power on earth     that can make a person important.[b] that can make a person important.[b]
Psalms-75-7: 7 God is the judge.     He decides who will be important. He decides who will be important.     He lifts one person up and brings another down. He lifts one person up and brings another down.
Psalms-75-8: 8 The Lord has a cup in his hand.     It is filled with the poisoned wine of his anger. It is filled with the poisoned wine of his anger. He will pour out this wine,     and the wicked will drink it to the last drop. and the wicked will drink it to the last drop.
Psalms-75-9: 9 I will always tell people how great God is.     I will sing praise to the God of Jacob. I will sing praise to the God of Jacob.
Psalms-75-10: 10 God says, “I will take away any power the wicked have     and give it to those who are good.” and give it to those who are good.”
Psalms-76-1: To the director: With instruments. One of Asaph’s songs of praise. 76 People in Judah know God. 76 People in Judah know God.     People in Israel respect his name. People in Israel respect his name.
Psalms-76-2: 2 His Temple is in Salem.[a]     His house is on Mount Zion. His house is on Mount Zion.
Psalms-76-3: 3 There he shattered the arrows,     shields, swords, and other weapons of war. Selah shields, swords, and other weapons of war. Selah
Psalms-76-4: 4 God, you are glorious coming back     from the hills where you defeated your enemies. from the hills where you defeated your enemies.
Psalms-76-5: 5 They thought they were strong, but now they lie dead in the fields.     Their bodies are stripped of all they owned. Their bodies are stripped of all they owned.     They could not defend themselves.[b] They could not defend themselves.[b]
Psalms-76-6: 6 The God of Jacob shouted at them,     and their army of chariots and horses fell dead. and their army of chariots and horses fell dead.
Psalms-76-7: 7 God, you are awesome!     No one can stand against you when you are angry. No one can stand against you when you are angry.
Psalms-76-8-Ps-76-9: 8-9 You stood as judge and announced your decision.     You saved the humble people of the land. You saved the humble people of the land. From heaven you gave the decision,     and the whole earth was silent and afraid. and the whole earth was silent and afraid.
Psalms-76-10: 10 Even human anger can bring you honor     when you use it to punish your enemies.[c] when you use it to punish your enemies.[c]
Psalms-76-11: 11 People, you made promises to the Lord your God.     Now give him what you promised. Now give him what you promised. People everywhere fear and respect God,     and they will bring gifts to him. and they will bring gifts to him.
Psalms-76-12: 12 God defeats great leaders;     all the kings on earth fear him. all the kings on earth fear him.
Psalms-77-1: To the director, Jeduthun.[a] One of Asaph’s songs. 77 I cry out to God for help. 77 I cry out to God for help.     I cry out to you, God; listen to me! I cry out to you, God; listen to me!
Psalms-77-2: 2 My Lord, in my time of trouble I came to you.     I reached out for you all night long. I reached out for you all night long.     My soul refused to be comforted. My soul refused to be comforted.
Psalms-77-3: 3 I thought about you, God,     and tried to tell you how I felt, but I could not. and tried to tell you how I felt, but I could not.
Psalms-77-4: 4 You would not let me sleep.     I tried to say something, but I was too upset. I tried to say something, but I was too upset.
Psalms-77-5: 5 I kept thinking about the past,     about things that happened long ago. about things that happened long ago.
Psalms-77-6: 6 During the night, I thought about my songs.     I talked to myself, trying to understand what is happening. I talked to myself, trying to understand what is happening.
Psalms-77-7: 7 I wondered, “Has our Lord rejected us forever?     Will he ever accept us again? Will he ever accept us again?
Psalms-77-8: 8 Is his love gone forever?     Will he never again speak to us? Will he never again speak to us?
Psalms-77-9: 9 Has God forgotten what mercy is?     Has his compassion changed to anger?” Selah Has his compassion changed to anger?” Selah
Psalms-77-10: 10 Then I said to myself, “What bothers me most is the thought     that God Most High has lost his power.” that God Most High has lost his power.”
Psalms-77-11: 11 Lord, I remember what you have done.     I remember the amazing things you did long ago. I remember the amazing things you did long ago.
Psalms-77-12: 12 I think about those things.     I think about them all the time. I think about them all the time.
Psalms-77-13: 13 God, all that you do is holy.     No god is as great as you are. No god is as great as you are.
Psalms-77-14: 14 You are the God who does amazing things.     You showed the nations your great power. You showed the nations your great power.
Psalms-77-15: 15 By your power you saved your people,     the descendants of Jacob and Joseph. Selah the descendants of Jacob and Joseph. Selah
Psalms-77-16: 16 God, the water saw you and became afraid.     The deep water shook with fear. The deep water shook with fear.
Psalms-77-17: 17 The thick clouds dropped their water.     Thunder roared in the sky above. Thunder roared in the sky above.     Your arrows of lightning flashed through the clouds. Your arrows of lightning flashed through the clouds.
Psalms-77-18: 18 There were loud claps of thunder.     Lightning lit up the world. Lightning lit up the world.     The earth shook and trembled. The earth shook and trembled.
Psalms-77-19: 19 You walked through the water and crossed the deep sea,     but you left no footprints. but you left no footprints.
Psalms-77-20: 20 You led your people like sheep,     using Moses and Aaron to guide them. using Moses and Aaron to guide them.
Psalms-78-1: One of Asaph’s maskils. 78 My people, listen to my teachings. 78 My people, listen to my teachings.     Listen to what I say. Listen to what I say.
Psalms-78-2: 2 I will tell you a story.     I will tell you about things from the past that are hard to understand. I will tell you about things from the past that are hard to understand.
Psalms-78-3: 3 We have heard the story, and we know it well.     Our fathers told it to us. Our fathers told it to us.
Psalms-78-4: 4 And we will not forget it.     Our people will be telling this story to the last generation. Our people will be telling this story to the last generation. We will all praise the Lord     and tell about the amazing things he did. and tell about the amazing things he did.
Psalms-78-5: 5 He made an agreement with Jacob.     He gave the law to Israel. He gave the law to Israel. He gave the commands to our ancestors.     He told them to teach the law to their children. He told them to teach the law to their children.
Psalms-78-6: 6 Then the next generation, even the children not yet born, would learn the law.     And they would be able to teach it to their own children. And they would be able to teach it to their own children.
Psalms-78-7: 7 So they would all trust in God,     never forgetting what he had done never forgetting what he had done     and always obeying his commands. and always obeying his commands.
Psalms-78-8: 8 They would not be like their ancestors,     who were stubborn and refused to obey. who were stubborn and refused to obey. Their hearts were not devoted to God,     and they were not faithful to him. and they were not faithful to him.
Psalms-78-9: 9 The men from Ephraim had their weapons,     but they ran from the battle. but they ran from the battle.
Psalms-78-10: 10 They did not keep their agreement with God.     They refused to obey his teachings. They refused to obey his teachings.
Psalms-78-11: 11 They forgot the great things he had done     and the amazing things he had shown them. and the amazing things he had shown them.
Psalms-78-12: 12 While their ancestors watched,     he showed his great power at Zoan in Egypt. he showed his great power at Zoan in Egypt.
Psalms-78-13: 13 He split the Red Sea and led the people across.     The water stood like a solid wall on both sides of them. The water stood like a solid wall on both sides of them.
Psalms-78-14: 14 Each day God led them with the tall cloud,     and each night he led them with the light from the column of fire. and each night he led them with the light from the column of fire.
Psalms-78-15: 15 He split the rocks in the desert     and gave them an ocean of fresh water. and gave them an ocean of fresh water.
Psalms-78-16: 16 He brought a stream of water out of the rock     and made it flow like a river! and made it flow like a river!
Psalms-78-17: 17 But they continued sinning against him.     They rebelled against God Most High in the desert. They rebelled against God Most High in the desert.
Psalms-78-18: 18 Then they decided to test God     by telling him to give them the food they wanted. by telling him to give them the food they wanted.
Psalms-78-19: 19 They complained about him and said,     “Can God give us food in the desert? “Can God give us food in the desert?
Psalms-78-20: 20 Yes, he struck the rock and a flood of water came out.     But can he give us bread and meat?” But can he give us bread and meat?”
Psalms-78-21: 21 The Lord heard what they said     and became angry with Jacob’s people. and became angry with Jacob’s people.     He was angry with Israel, He was angry with Israel,
Psalms-78-22: 22 because they did not trust in him.     They did not believe that God could save them. They did not believe that God could save them.
Psalms-78-23-Ps-78-24: 23-24 But then God opened the clouds above,     and manna rained down on them for food. and manna rained down on them for food. It was as if doors in the sky opened,     and grain poured down from a storehouse in the sky. and grain poured down from a storehouse in the sky.
Psalms-78-25: 25 These people ate the food of angels.     God sent plenty of food to satisfy them. God sent plenty of food to satisfy them.
Psalms-78-26: 26 He sent a strong wind from the east,     and by his power he made the south wind blow. and by his power he made the south wind blow.
Psalms-78-27: 27 He made quail fall like rain until they covered the ground.     There were so many birds that they were like sand on the seashore. There were so many birds that they were like sand on the seashore.
Psalms-78-28: 28 The birds fell in the middle of the camp,     all around their tents. all around their tents.
Psalms-78-29: 29 The people ate until they were full.     God had given them what they wanted. God had given them what they wanted.
Psalms-78-30: 30 But before they were fully satisfied,     while the food was still in their mouths, while the food was still in their mouths,
Psalms-78-31: 31 God became angry and killed even the strongest of them.     He brought down Israel’s best young men. He brought down Israel’s best young men.
Psalms-78-32: 32 But the people continued to sin!     They did not trust in the amazing things God could do. They did not trust in the amazing things God could do.
Psalms-78-33: 33 So he ended their worthless lives;     he brought their years to a close with disaster. he brought their years to a close with disaster.
Psalms-78-34: 34 When he killed some of them, the others would turn back to him.     They would come running back to God. They would come running back to God.
Psalms-78-35: 35 They would remember that God was their Rock.     They would remember that God Most High had saved them. They would remember that God Most High had saved them.
Psalms-78-36: 36 But they tried to fool him with their words;     they told him lies. they told him lies.
Psalms-78-37: 37 Their hearts were not really with him.     They were not faithful to the agreement he gave them. They were not faithful to the agreement he gave them.
Psalms-78-38: 38 But God was merciful.     He forgave their sins and did not destroy them. He forgave their sins and did not destroy them. Many times he held back his anger.     He never let it get out of control. He never let it get out of control.
Psalms-78-39: 39 He remembered that they were only people,     like a wind that blows and then is gone. like a wind that blows and then is gone.
Psalms-78-40: 40 Oh, they caused him so much trouble in the desert!     They made him so sad. They made him so sad.
Psalms-78-41: 41 Again and again they tested his patience.     They really hurt the Holy One of Israel. They really hurt the Holy One of Israel.
Psalms-78-42: 42 They forgot about his power.     They forgot the many times he saved them from the enemy. They forgot the many times he saved them from the enemy.
Psalms-78-43: 43 They forgot the miracles in Egypt,     the miracles in the fields of Zoan. the miracles in the fields of Zoan.
Psalms-78-44: 44 God turned the rivers into blood,     and the Egyptians could not drink the water. and the Egyptians could not drink the water.
Psalms-78-45: 45 He sent swarms of flies that bit them.     He sent the frogs that ruined their lives. He sent the frogs that ruined their lives.
Psalms-78-46: 46 He gave their crops to grasshoppers     and their other plants to locusts. and their other plants to locusts.
Psalms-78-47: 47 He destroyed their vines with hail     and their trees with sleet. and their trees with sleet.
Psalms-78-48: 48 He killed their animals with hail     and their cattle with lightning. and their cattle with lightning.
Psalms-78-49: 49 He showed the Egyptians his anger.     He sent his destroying angels against them. He sent his destroying angels against them.
Psalms-78-50: 50 He found a way to show his anger.     He did not spare their lives. He did not spare their lives.     He let them die with a deadly disease. He let them die with a deadly disease.
Psalms-78-51: 51 He killed all the firstborn sons in Egypt.     He killed every firstborn in Ham’s[a] family. He killed every firstborn in Ham’s[a] family.
Psalms-78-52: 52 Then he led Israel like a shepherd.     He led his people like sheep into the desert. He led his people like sheep into the desert.
Psalms-78-53: 53 He guided them safely.     They had nothing to fear. They had nothing to fear.     He drowned their enemies in the sea. He drowned their enemies in the sea.
Psalms-78-54: 54 He led his people to his holy land,     to the mountain he took with his own power. to the mountain he took with his own power.
Psalms-78-55: 55 He forced the other nations out before them     and gave each family its share of the land. and gave each family its share of the land.     He gave each tribe of Israel a place to live. He gave each tribe of Israel a place to live.
Psalms-78-56: 56 But they tested God Most High and made him very sad.     They didn’t obey his commands. They didn’t obey his commands.
Psalms-78-57: 57 They turned against him and were unfaithful just like their ancestors.     They changed directions like a boomerang. They changed directions like a boomerang.
Psalms-78-58: 58 They built high places and made God angry.     They built statues of false gods and made him jealous. They built statues of false gods and made him jealous.
Psalms-78-59: 59 God heard what they were doing and became very angry.     So he rejected Israel completely! So he rejected Israel completely!
Psalms-78-60: 60 He abandoned his place at Shiloh,[b]     the Holy Tent where he lived among the people. the Holy Tent where he lived among the people.
Psalms-78-61: 61 He let foreigners capture the Box of the Agreement,     the symbol of his power and glory. the symbol of his power and glory.
Psalms-78-62: 62 He showed his anger against his people     and let them be killed in war. and let them be killed in war.
Psalms-78-63: 63 Their young men were burned to death,     and there were no wedding songs for their young women. and there were no wedding songs for their young women.
Psalms-78-64: 64 Their priests were killed,     but the widows had no time to mourn for them. but the widows had no time to mourn for them.
Psalms-78-65: 65 Finally, our Lord got up     like a man waking from his sleep, like a man waking from his sleep,     like a soldier after drinking too much wine. like a soldier after drinking too much wine.
Psalms-78-66: 66 He forced his enemies to turn back defeated.     He brought them shame that will last forever. He brought them shame that will last forever.
Psalms-78-67: 67 Then he rejected Joseph’s family.     He did not accept Ephraim’s family. He did not accept Ephraim’s family.
Psalms-78-68: 68 No, he chose the tribe of Judah,     and he chose Mount Zion, the place he loves. and he chose Mount Zion, the place he loves.
Psalms-78-69: 69 He built his holy Temple high on that mountain.     Like the earth, God built his Temple to last forever. Like the earth, God built his Temple to last forever.
Psalms-78-70: 70 He chose David to be his special servant.     He took him from the sheep pens. He took him from the sheep pens.
Psalms-78-71: 71 He took him away from the job of caring for sheep     and gave him the job of caring for the descendants of Jacob—Israel, his chosen people. and gave him the job of caring for the descendants of Jacob—Israel, his chosen people.
Psalms-78-72: 72 And David led them with a pure heart     and guided them very wisely. and guided them very wisely.
Psalms-79-1: One of Asaph’s songs of praise. 79 God, some people from other nations came to fight your people. 79 God, some people from other nations came to fight your people.     They ruined your holy Temple. They ruined your holy Temple.     They left Jerusalem in ruins. They left Jerusalem in ruins.
Psalms-79-2: 2 They left the bodies of your servants for the wild birds to eat.     They let wild animals eat the bodies of your followers. They let wild animals eat the bodies of your followers.
Psalms-79-3: 3 Blood flowed like water all over Jerusalem.     No one is left to bury the bodies. No one is left to bury the bodies.
Psalms-79-4: 4 The countries around us insult us.     The people around us laugh at us and make fun of us. The people around us laugh at us and make fun of us.
Psalms-79-5: 5 Lord, will you be angry with us forever?     Will your strong feelings[a] continue to burn like a fire? Will your strong feelings[a] continue to burn like a fire?
Psalms-79-6: 6 Turn your anger against the nations that do not know you,     against the people who do not honor you as God. against the people who do not honor you as God.
Psalms-79-7: 7 Those nations killed Jacob’s family     and destroyed their land. and destroyed their land.
Psalms-79-8: 8 Please don’t punish us for the sins of our ancestors.     Hurry, show us your mercy! Hurry, show us your mercy!     We need you so much! We need you so much!
Psalms-79-9: 9 Our God and Savior, help us!     That will bring glory to your name. That will bring glory to your name. Save us and forgive our sins     for the good of your name. for the good of your name.
Psalms-79-10: 10 Don’t give the other nations a reason to say,     “Where is their God? Can’t he help them?” “Where is their God? Can’t he help them?” Let us see you punish those people.     Punish them for killing your servants. Punish them for killing your servants.
Psalms-79-11: 11 Listen to the sad cries of the prisoners!     Use your great power to free those who are sentenced to die. Use your great power to free those who are sentenced to die.
Psalms-79-12: 12 Punish the nations around us!     Pay them back seven times for what they did to us. Pay them back seven times for what they did to us.     Punish them for insulting you. Punish them for insulting you.
Psalms-79-13: 13 We are your people, the sheep of your flock.     We will praise you forever. We will praise you forever.     We will praise you forever and ever! We will praise you forever and ever!
Psalms-80-1: To the director: To the tune “Lilies of the Agreement.” One of Asaph’s songs of praise. 80 Shepherd of Israel, listen to us. 80 Shepherd of Israel, listen to us.     You lead your people[a] like sheep. You lead your people[a] like sheep. You sit on your throne above the Cherub angels.     Let us see you. Let us see you.
Psalms-80-2: 2 Shepherd of Israel, show your greatness to the tribes of Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh.     Come and save your people. Come and save your people.
Psalms-80-3: 3 God, accept us again.     Smile down on us and save us! Smile down on us and save us!
Psalms-80-4: 4 Lord God All-Powerful, when will you listen to our prayers?     How long will you be angry with us? How long will you be angry with us?
Psalms-80-5: 5 Instead of bread and water,     you gave your people tears. you gave your people tears.
Psalms-80-6: 6 You made us the target of everyone’s hatred.     Our enemies make fun of us. Our enemies make fun of us.
Psalms-80-7: 7 God All-Powerful, accept us again.     Smile down on us and save us! Smile down on us and save us!
Psalms-80-8: 8 When you brought us out of Egypt,     we were like your special vine. we were like your special vine. You forced other nations to leave this land,     and you planted that vine here. and you planted that vine here.
Psalms-80-9: 9 You prepared the ground for it,     and it sent its roots down deep and spread throughout the land. and it sent its roots down deep and spread throughout the land.
Psalms-80-10: 10 It covered the mountains,     and its leaves shaded even the giant cedar trees. and its leaves shaded even the giant cedar trees.
Psalms-80-11: 11 Its branches spread to the Mediterranean Sea,     its shoots to the Euphrates River. its shoots to the Euphrates River.
Psalms-80-12: 12 God, why did you pull down the walls that protect your vine?     Now everyone who passes by picks its grapes. Now everyone who passes by picks its grapes.
Psalms-80-13: 13 Wild pigs come and ruin it.     Wild animals eat the leaves. Wild animals eat the leaves.
Psalms-80-14: 14 God All-Powerful, come back.     Look down from heaven at your vine and protect it. Look down from heaven at your vine and protect it.
Psalms-80-15: 15 Look at the vine you planted with your own hands.     Look at the young plant[b] you raised. Look at the young plant[b] you raised.
Psalms-80-16: 16 Our enemies have cut it down and burned it up.     Show them how angry you are and destroy them. Show them how angry you are and destroy them.
Psalms-80-17: 17 Reach out and help your chosen one.[c]     Reach out to the people[d] you raised up. Reach out to the people[d] you raised up.
Psalms-80-18: 18 Then we will never leave you.     Let us live, and we will worship you. Let us live, and we will worship you.
Psalms-80-19: 19 Lord God All-Powerful, accept us again.     Smile down on us and save us! Smile down on us and save us!
Psalms-81-1: To the director: On the gittith. One of Asaph’s songs. 81 Be happy and sing to God, our strength. 81 Be happy and sing to God, our strength.     Shout with joy to the God of Jacob. Shout with joy to the God of Jacob.
Psalms-81-2: 2 Begin the music.     Play the tambourines. Play the tambourines.     Play the pleasant harps and lyres. Play the pleasant harps and lyres.
Psalms-81-3: 3 Blow the ram’s horn at the time of the new moon[a]     and at the time of the full moon,[b] when our festival begins. and at the time of the full moon,[b] when our festival begins.
Psalms-81-4: 4 This is the law for the people of Israel.     The God of Jacob gave the command. The God of Jacob gave the command.
Psalms-81-5: 5 God made this agreement with Joseph’s people,     when he led them out of Egypt. when he led them out of Egypt. In a language we didn’t understand, God said,
Psalms-81-6: 6 “I took the load from your shoulder.     I let you drop the worker’s basket. I let you drop the worker’s basket.
Psalms-81-7: 7 When you were in trouble, you called for help, and I set you free.     I was hidden in the storm clouds, and I answered you. I was hidden in the storm clouds, and I answered you.     I tested you by the water at Meribah.[c]” Selah I tested you by the water at Meribah.[c]” Selah
Psalms-81-8: 8 “My people, I am warning you.     Israel, listen to me! Israel, listen to me!
Psalms-81-9: 9 Don’t worship any of the false gods     that the foreigners worship. that the foreigners worship.
Psalms-81-10: 10 I, the Lord, am your God.     I brought you out of Egypt. I brought you out of Egypt. Israel, open your mouth,     and I will feed you. and I will feed you.
Psalms-81-11: 11 “But my people did not listen to me.     Israel did not obey me. Israel did not obey me.
Psalms-81-12: 12 So I let them go their own stubborn way     and do whatever they wanted. and do whatever they wanted.
Psalms-81-13: 13 If my people would listen to me     and would live the way I want, and would live the way I want,
Psalms-81-14: 14 then I would defeat their enemies.     I would punish those who cause them trouble. I would punish those who cause them trouble.
Psalms-81-15: 15 Those who hate the Lord would shake with fear.     They would be punished forever. They would be punished forever.
Psalms-81-16: 16 I would give the best wheat to my people.     I would give them the purest honey, until they were satisfied.” I would give them the purest honey, until they were satisfied.”
Psalms-82-1: One of Asaph’s songs of praise. 82 God stands in the assembly of the gods.[a] 82 God stands in the assembly of the gods.[a]     He stands as judge among the judges. He stands as judge among the judges.
Psalms-82-2: 2 He says, “How long will you judge unfairly     and show special favors to the wicked?” Selah and show special favors to the wicked?” Selah
Psalms-82-3: 3 “Defend the poor and orphans.     Protect the rights of the poor. Protect the rights of the poor.
Psalms-82-4: 4 Help those who are poor and helpless.     Save them from those who are evil. Save them from those who are evil.
Psalms-82-5: 5 “They[b] don’t know what is happening.     They don’t understand! They don’t understand! They don’t know what they are doing.     Their world is falling down around them!” Their world is falling down around them!”
Psalms-82-6: 6 I, God Most High, say,     “You are gods,[c] my own sons. “You are gods,[c] my own sons.
Psalms-82-7: 7 But you will die as all people must die.     Your life will end like that of any ruler.” Your life will end like that of any ruler.”
Psalms-82-8: 8 Get up, God! You be the judge!     You be the leader over all the nations! You be the leader over all the nations!
Psalms-83-1: One of Asaph’s songs of praise. 83 God, don’t keep quiet! 83 God, don’t keep quiet!     Don’t close your ears! Don’t close your ears!     Please say something, God. Please say something, God.
Psalms-83-2: 2 Your enemies are getting ready to do something.     Those who hate you will soon attack. Those who hate you will soon attack.
Psalms-83-3: 3 They are making secret plans against your people.     Your enemies are discussing plans against the people you love. Your enemies are discussing plans against the people you love.
Psalms-83-4: 4 They say, “Come, let us destroy them completely.     Then no one will ever again remember the name Israel.” Then no one will ever again remember the name Israel.”
Psalms-83-5: 5 God, they have all joined together.     They have united against you. They have united against you.
Psalms-83-6-Ps-83-7: 6-7 Their army includes the Edomites, Ishmaelites, Moabites, and Hagar’s descendants,     the people of Byblos, Ammon, and Amalek, the people of Byblos, Ammon, and Amalek,     the Philistines, and the people of Tyre. the Philistines, and the people of Tyre.
Psalms-83-8: 8 Even the Assyrians have joined them.     They have made Lot’s descendants very powerful. Selah They have made Lot’s descendants very powerful. Selah
Psalms-83-9: 9 God, defeat them just as you defeated Midian.     Do what you did to Sisera and Jabin at the Kishon River. Do what you did to Sisera and Jabin at the Kishon River.
Psalms-83-10: 10 You destroyed the enemy at Endor,     and their bodies rotted on the ground. and their bodies rotted on the ground.
Psalms-83-11: 11 Punish their leaders as you did Oreb and Zeeb.     Do what you did to Zebah and Zalmunna. Do what you did to Zebah and Zalmunna.
Psalms-83-12: 12 They said, “Let’s make this land our own—     these fields of grass that belong to God!” these fields of grass that belong to God!”
Psalms-83-13: 13 Make them like weeds blown by the wind.     Scatter them the way wind scatters straw. Scatter them the way wind scatters straw.
Psalms-83-14: 14 Be like a fire that destroys a forest     or like a flame that sets the hills on fire. or like a flame that sets the hills on fire.
Psalms-83-15: 15 Chase them away with your blasts of wind;     frighten them with your storms. frighten them with your storms.
Psalms-83-16: 16 Lord, cover them with shame     until they come to you for help. until they come to you for help.
Psalms-83-17: 17 May they be forever ashamed and afraid.     Disgrace and defeat them. Disgrace and defeat them.
Psalms-83-18: 18 Then they will know that your name is Yahweh—     that you alone are the Lord. that you alone are the Lord. They will know that you are God Most High,     ruler over all the earth! ruler over all the earth!
Psalms-84-1: To the director: On the gittith. A song of praise from the Korah family. 84 Lord All-Powerful, the place where you live is so beautiful! 84 Lord All-Powerful, the place where you live is so beautiful!
Psalms-84-2: 2 Lord, I cannot wait to enter your Temple.     I am so excited! I am so excited! Every part of me cries out to be with the Living God.
Psalms-84-3: 3 Lord All-Powerful, my King, my God,     even the birds have found a home in your Temple. even the birds have found a home in your Temple. They make their nests near your altar,     and there they have their babies. and there they have their babies.
Psalms-84-4: 4 Great blessings belong to those who live at your Temple!     They continue to praise you. Selah They continue to praise you. Selah
Psalms-84-5: 5 Great blessings belong to those who depend on you for strength!     Their heart’s desire is to make the trip to your Temple. Their heart’s desire is to make the trip to your Temple.
Psalms-84-6: 6 They travel through Baca Valley,     which God has made into a place of springs. which God has made into a place of springs.     Autumn rains form pools of water there. Autumn rains form pools of water there.
Psalms-84-7: 7 The people travel from town to town[a]     on their way to Zion, where they will meet with God. on their way to Zion, where they will meet with God.
Psalms-84-8: 8 Lord God All-Powerful, listen to my prayer.     God of Jacob, listen to me. Selah God of Jacob, listen to me. Selah
Psalms-84-9: 9 God, watch over the king, our protector.[b]     Be kind to him, the one you have chosen. Be kind to him, the one you have chosen.
Psalms-84-10: 10 One day in your Temple is better     than a thousand days anywhere else. than a thousand days anywhere else. Serving as a guard at the gate of my God’s house is better     than living in the homes of the wicked. than living in the homes of the wicked.
Psalms-84-11: 11 The Lord God is our protector and glorious king.[c]     He blesses us with kindness and honor. He blesses us with kindness and honor. The Lord freely gives every good thing     to those who do what is right. to those who do what is right.
Psalms-84-12: 12 Lord All-Powerful,     great blessings belong to those who trust in you! great blessings belong to those who trust in you!
Psalms-85-1: To the director: A song of praise from the Korah family. 85 Lord, you have been so kind to your land. 85 Lord, you have been so kind to your land.     You have brought success again to the people of Jacob. You have brought success again to the people of Jacob.
Psalms-85-2: 2 You have forgiven the bad things your people did.     You have taken away the guilt of their sins! Selah You have taken away the guilt of their sins! Selah
Psalms-85-3: 3 You stopped being angry with them.     Your terrible anger has gone away. Your terrible anger has gone away.
Psalms-85-4: 4 Our God and Savior, accept us again.     Don’t be angry with us anymore. Don’t be angry with us anymore.
Psalms-85-5: 5 Will you be angry with us forever?     Will your anger reach to our children and to their children? Will your anger reach to our children and to their children?
Psalms-85-6: 6 Please, give us new life!     Make your people happy to be yours. Make your people happy to be yours.
Psalms-85-7: 7 Lord, save us     and show us your love. and show us your love.
Psalms-85-8: 8 I heard what the Lord God said.     He said there would be peace for his people and his loyal followers. He said there would be peace for his people and his loyal followers.     So they must not go back to their foolish way of living. So they must not go back to their foolish way of living.
Psalms-85-9: 9 He will soon save his faithful followers.     His glory will again live in our land.[a] His glory will again live in our land.[a]
Psalms-85-10: 10 God’s love will come together with his faithful people.     Goodness and peace will greet them with a kiss. Goodness and peace will greet them with a kiss.
Psalms-85-11: 11 People on earth will be loyal to God,     and God in heaven will be good to them.[b] and God in heaven will be good to them.[b]
Psalms-85-12: 12 The Lord will give us many good things.     The ground will grow many good crops. The ground will grow many good crops.
Psalms-85-13: 13 Goodness will go before the Lord     and prepare the way for him. and prepare the way for him.
Psalms-86-1: A prayer of David. 86 I am a poor, helpless man. 86 I am a poor, helpless man.     Lord, please listen to me and answer my prayer! Lord, please listen to me and answer my prayer!
Psalms-86-2: 2 I am your follower, so please protect me.     I am your servant, and you are my God. I am your servant, and you are my God.     I trust in you, so save me. I trust in you, so save me.
Psalms-86-3: 3 My Lord, be kind to me.     I have been praying to you all day. I have been praying to you all day.
Psalms-86-4: 4 My Lord, I put my life in your hands.     I am your servant, so make me happy. I am your servant, so make me happy.
Psalms-86-5: 5 My Lord, you are good and merciful.     You love all those who call to you for help. You love all those who call to you for help.
Psalms-86-6: 6 Lord, hear my prayer.     Listen to my cry for mercy. Listen to my cry for mercy.
Psalms-86-7: 7 I am praying to you in my time of trouble.     I know you will answer me. I know you will answer me.
Psalms-86-8: 8 My Lord, there is no God like you.     No one can do what you have done. No one can do what you have done.
Psalms-86-9: 9 My Lord, you made everyone.     I wish they all would come worship you and honor your name. I wish they all would come worship you and honor your name.
Psalms-86-10: 10 You are great and do amazing things.     You and you alone are God. You and you alone are God.
Psalms-86-11: 11 Lord, teach me your ways,     and I will live and obey your truths. and I will live and obey your truths. Help me make worshiping your name     the most important thing in my life. the most important thing in my life.
Psalms-86-12: 12 My Lord God, I praise you with all my heart.     I will honor your name forever! I will honor your name forever!
Psalms-86-13: 13 You have such great love for me.     You save me from the place of death. You save me from the place of death.
Psalms-86-14: 14 Proud people are attacking me, God.     A gang of cruel men is trying to kill me. A gang of cruel men is trying to kill me.     They don’t respect you. They don’t respect you.
Psalms-86-15: 15 My Lord, you are a kind and merciful God.     You are patient, loyal, and full of love. You are patient, loyal, and full of love.
Psalms-86-16: 16 Show that you hear me and be kind to me.     I am your servant, so give me strength. I am your servant, so give me strength.     I am your slave, as my mother was, so save me! I am your slave, as my mother was, so save me!
Psalms-86-17: 17 Lord, show me a sign that you care for me.     My enemies will see it and be disappointed, My enemies will see it and be disappointed,     because you helped and comforted me. because you helped and comforted me.
Psalms-87-1: A song of praise from the Korah family. 87 The Lord built his city on the holy hills. 87 The Lord built his city on the holy hills.
Psalms-87-2: 2     He loves the gates of Zion more than any other place in Israel. 2     He loves the gates of Zion more than any other place in Israel.
Psalms-87-3: 3 Wonderful things are said about you, City of God. Selah
Psalms-87-4: 4 God says, “Some of my people live in Egypt[a] and Babylon.     Some of them were born in Philistia, Tyre, and even Ethiopia.” Some of them were born in Philistia, Tyre, and even Ethiopia.”
Psalms-87-5: 5 But about Zion he says,     “I know each and every person born there.” “I know each and every person born there.”     It is the city built by God Most High. It is the city built by God Most High.
Psalms-87-6: 6 The Lord keeps a list of all his people,     and he knows where each of them was born. Selah and he knows where each of them was born. Selah
Psalms-87-7: 7 At the festivals, people will dance and sing,     “All good things come from Zion.” “All good things come from Zion.”
Psalms-88-1: A song from the Korah family. To the director: About a painful sickness. A maskil of Heman the Ezrahite. 88 Lord God, you are my Savior. 88 Lord God, you are my Savior.     I have been praying to you day and night. I have been praying to you day and night.
Psalms-88-2: 2 Please pay attention to my prayers.     Listen to my prayers for mercy. Listen to my prayers for mercy.
Psalms-88-3: 3 My soul has had enough of this pain!     I am ready to die. I am ready to die.
Psalms-88-4: 4 People already treat me like a dead man,     like someone too weak to live. like someone too weak to live.
Psalms-88-5: 5 Look for me among the dead,     like a body in the grave. like a body in the grave. I am one of those you have forgotten,     cut off from you and your care. cut off from you and your care.
Psalms-88-6: 6 You put me in that hole in the ground.     Yes, you put me in that dark place. Yes, you put me in that dark place.
Psalms-88-7: 7 Your anger presses down on me like a heavy weight.     It’s like one wave after another pounding against me. Selah It’s like one wave after another pounding against me. Selah
Psalms-88-8: 8 You made my friends leave me.     They all avoid me like someone no one wants to touch. They all avoid me like someone no one wants to touch. Like a prisoner in my house, I cannot go out.
Psalms-88-9: 9     My eyes hurt from crying. 9     My eyes hurt from crying. Lord, I pray to you constantly!     I lift my arms in prayer to you. I lift my arms in prayer to you.
Psalms-88-10: 10 Do you do miracles for the dead?     Do ghosts rise up and praise you? No! Selah Do ghosts rise up and praise you? No! Selah
Psalms-88-11: 11 The dead in their graves cannot talk about your faithful love.     People in the world of the dead[a] cannot talk about your faithfulness. People in the world of the dead[a] cannot talk about your faithfulness.
Psalms-88-12: 12 The dead who lie in darkness cannot see the amazing things you do.     Those in the world of the forgotten cannot talk about your goodness. Those in the world of the forgotten cannot talk about your goodness.
Psalms-88-13: 13 Lord, I am asking you to help me!     Early each morning I pray to you. Early each morning I pray to you.
Psalms-88-14: 14 Lord, why have you abandoned me?     Why do you refuse to listen to me? Why do you refuse to listen to me?
Psalms-88-15: 15 I have been sick and weak since I was young.     I have suffered your anger, and I am helpless. I have suffered your anger, and I am helpless.
Psalms-88-16: 16 Your anger covers me like a flood.     Your attacks are killing me. Your attacks are killing me.
Psalms-88-17: 17 They surround me on every side.     I feel like a drowning man. I feel like a drowning man.
Psalms-88-18: 18 You caused my friends and loved ones to leave me.     Now darkness is my closest friend. Now darkness is my closest friend.
Psalms-89-1: A maskil from Ethan the Ezrahite. 89 I will sing forever about the Lord’s love. 89 I will sing forever about the Lord’s love.     I will sing about his faithfulness forever and ever! I will sing about his faithfulness forever and ever!
Psalms-89-2: 2 I will say, “Your faithful love will last forever.     Your loyalty is like the sky—there is no end to it!” Your loyalty is like the sky—there is no end to it!”
Psalms-89-3: 3 You said, “I made an agreement with my chosen king.     I made this promise to my servant David: I made this promise to my servant David:
Psalms-89-4: 4 ‘There will always be someone from your family to rule.     I will make your kingdom continue forever and ever.’” Selah I will make your kingdom continue forever and ever.’” Selah
Psalms-89-5: 5 Lord, the heavens praise you for the amazing things you do.     The assembly of holy ones sings about your loyalty. The assembly of holy ones sings about your loyalty.
Psalms-89-6: 6 No one in heaven is equal to the Lord.     None of the “gods” can compare to the Lord. None of the “gods” can compare to the Lord.
Psalms-89-7: 7 When God’s holy ones—the angels around his throne—meet together,     they fear and respect him; they fear and respect him;     he is more awesome than all those around him. he is more awesome than all those around him.
Psalms-89-8: 8 Lord God All-Powerful, there is no one like you.     You are strong, Lord, and always faithful. You are strong, Lord, and always faithful.
Psalms-89-9: 9 You rule the stormy sea.     You can calm its angry waves. You can calm its angry waves.
Psalms-89-10: 10 You defeated Rahab.     You scattered your enemies with your own powerful arm. You scattered your enemies with your own powerful arm.
Psalms-89-11: 11 Everything in heaven and earth belongs to you.     You made the world and everything in it. You made the world and everything in it.
Psalms-89-12: 12 You created everything north and south.     Mount Tabor and Mount Hermon sing praises to your name. Mount Tabor and Mount Hermon sing praises to your name.
Psalms-89-13: 13 You have the power!     Your power is great! Your power is great!     Victory is yours! Victory is yours!
Psalms-89-14: 14 Your kingdom is built on truth and justice.     Love and faithfulness are servants before your throne. Love and faithfulness are servants before your throne.
Psalms-89-15: 15 Lord, your loyal followers are happy.     They live in the light of your kindness. They live in the light of your kindness.
Psalms-89-16: 16 Your name always makes them happy.     They praise your goodness. They praise your goodness.
Psalms-89-17: 17 You are their amazing strength.     Their power comes from you. Their power comes from you.
Psalms-89-18: 18 The king, our protector, belongs to the Lord,     who is the Holy One of Israel. who is the Holy One of Israel.
Psalms-89-19: 19 Lord, you once spoke in a vision to your followers: “I have made a young soldier strong.     From among my people I chose him for an important position. From among my people I chose him for an important position.
Psalms-89-20: 20 I have found my servant David     and anointed him as king with my special oil. and anointed him as king with my special oil.
Psalms-89-21: 21 I will support him with my right hand,     and my arm will make him strong. and my arm will make him strong.
Psalms-89-22: 22 So no enemy will ever control him.     The wicked will never defeat him. The wicked will never defeat him.
Psalms-89-23: 23 I will destroy his enemies before his eyes.     I will defeat those who hate him. I will defeat those who hate him.
Psalms-89-24: 24 I will always love and support him.     I will always make him strong. I will always make him strong.
Psalms-89-25: 25 I will put him in charge of the sea.     He will control the rivers. He will control the rivers.
Psalms-89-26: 26 He will say to me, ‘You are my father.     You are my God, my Rock, my Savior.’ You are my God, my Rock, my Savior.’
Psalms-89-27: 27 And I will make him my firstborn son.     He will be the great king on earth. He will be the great king on earth.
Psalms-89-28: 28 My love will protect him forever.     My agreement with him will never end. My agreement with him will never end.
Psalms-89-29: 29 I will make his family continue forever.     His kingdom will last as long as the skies. His kingdom will last as long as the skies.
Psalms-89-30: 30 If his descendants stop following my law     and stop obeying my commands, and stop obeying my commands,
Psalms-89-31: 31 if they break my laws     and ignore my commands, and ignore my commands,
Psalms-89-32: 32 I will punish them severely     for their sins and wrongs. for their sins and wrongs.
Psalms-89-33: 33 But I will never take my love from him.     I will never stop being loyal to him. I will never stop being loyal to him.
Psalms-89-34: 34 I will not break my agreement with David.     I will never change what I said. I will never change what I said.
Psalms-89-35: 35 By my holiness, I made a promise to him,     and I would not lie to David. and I would not lie to David.
Psalms-89-36: 36 His family will continue forever.     His kingdom will last as long as the sun. His kingdom will last as long as the sun.
