Psalms-89-37: 37 Like the moon, it will continue forever.     The sky is a witness to the agreement that can be trusted.” Selah The sky is a witness to the agreement that can be trusted.” Selah
Psalms-89-38: 38 But now, Lord, you have become angry with your chosen king,[a]     and you have left him all alone. and you have left him all alone.
Psalms-89-39: 39 You ended the agreement you made with your servant.     You threw the king’s crown into the dirt. You threw the king’s crown into the dirt.
Psalms-89-40: 40 You pulled down the walls of his city.     You destroyed all his fortresses. You destroyed all his fortresses.
Psalms-89-41: 41 Everyone passing by steals from him.     His neighbors laugh at him. His neighbors laugh at him.
Psalms-89-42: 42 You made all the king’s enemies happy     and let his enemies win the war. and let his enemies win the war.
Psalms-89-43: 43 You helped them defend themselves.     You did not help your king win the battle. You did not help your king win the battle.
Psalms-89-44: 44 You did not let him win.     You threw his throne to the ground. You threw his throne to the ground.
Psalms-89-45: 45 You cut his life short.     You shamed him. Selah You shamed him. Selah
Psalms-89-46: 46 Lord, how long will this continue?     Will you ignore us forever? Will you ignore us forever?     Will your anger burn like a fire forever? Will your anger burn like a fire forever?
Psalms-89-47: 47 Remember how short my life is.     You created us to live a short life and then die. You created us to live a short life and then die.
Psalms-89-48: 48 Is there anyone alive who will never die?     Will anyone escape the grave? Selah Will anyone escape the grave? Selah
Psalms-89-49: 49 Lord, where is the love you showed in the past?     You promised David that you would be loyal to his family. You promised David that you would be loyal to his family.
Psalms-89-50-Ps-89-51: 50-51 My Lord, please remember how people insulted your servant. Lord, I had to listen to all the insults from your enemies.     They insulted your chosen king wherever he went. They insulted your chosen king wherever he went.
Psalms-89-52: 52 Praise the Lord forever!     Amen and Amen! Amen and Amen!
Psalms-90-1: Book 4 (Psalms 90-106) The prayer of Moses, the man of God. 90 My Lord, you have been our home forever and ever. 90 My Lord, you have been our home forever and ever.
Psalms-90-2: 2 You were God before the mountains were born,     before the earth and the world were made. before the earth and the world were made.     You have always been and will always be God! You have always been and will always be God!
Psalms-90-3: 3 You bring people into this world,     and you change them into dust again. and you change them into dust again.
Psalms-90-4: 4 To you, a thousand years is like yesterday,     like a few hours in the night. like a few hours in the night.
Psalms-90-5: 5 Our life is like a dream that ends when morning comes. We are like grass
Psalms-90-6: 6     that grows and looks so fresh in the morning, 6     that grows and looks so fresh in the morning,     but in the evening it is dry and dying. but in the evening it is dry and dying.
Psalms-90-7: 7 Your anger could destroy us.     Your anger frightens us! Your anger frightens us!
Psalms-90-8: 8 You know about all our sins.     You see every one of our secret sins. You see every one of our secret sins.
Psalms-90-9: 9 Your anger can end our life.     Our lives fade away like a whisper. Our lives fade away like a whisper.
Psalms-90-10: 10 We live about 70 years     or, if we are strong, 80 years. or, if we are strong, 80 years. But most of them are filled with hard work and pain.     Then, suddenly, the years are gone, and we fly away. Then, suddenly, the years are gone, and we fly away.
Psalms-90-11: 11 No one really knows the full power of your anger,     but our fear and respect for you is as great as your anger. but our fear and respect for you is as great as your anger.
Psalms-90-12: 12 Teach us how short our lives are     so that we can become wise. so that we can become wise.
Psalms-90-13: 13 Lord, come back to us.     Be kind to your servants. Be kind to your servants.
Psalms-90-14: 14 Fill us with your love every morning.     Let us be happy and enjoy our lives. Let us be happy and enjoy our lives.
Psalms-90-15: 15 For years you have made life hard for us and have given us many troubles.     Now make us happy for just as long. Now make us happy for just as long.
Psalms-90-16: 16 Let your servants see the wonderful things you can do for them.     And let their children see your glory. And let their children see your glory.
Psalms-90-17: 17 Lord, our God, be kind to us.     Make everything we do successful. Make everything we do successful.     Yes, make it all successful. Yes, make it all successful.
Psalms-91-1: 91 You can go to God Most High to hide. 91 You can go to God Most High to hide.     You can go to God All-Powerful for protection. You can go to God All-Powerful for protection.
Psalms-91-2: 2 I say to the Lord, “You are my place of safety, my fortress.     My God, I trust in you.” My God, I trust in you.”
Psalms-91-3: 3 God will save you from hidden dangers     and from deadly diseases. and from deadly diseases.
Psalms-91-4: 4 You can go to him for protection.     He will cover you like a bird spreading its wings over its babies. He will cover you like a bird spreading its wings over its babies.     You can trust him to surround and protect you like a shield. You can trust him to surround and protect you like a shield.
Psalms-91-5: 5 You will have nothing to fear at night     and no need to be afraid of enemy arrows during the day. and no need to be afraid of enemy arrows during the day.
Psalms-91-6: 6 You will have no fear of diseases that come in the dark     or terrible suffering that comes at noon. or terrible suffering that comes at noon.
Psalms-91-7: 7 A thousand people may fall dead at your side     or ten thousand right beside you, or ten thousand right beside you,     but nothing bad will happen to you! but nothing bad will happen to you!
Psalms-91-8: 8 All you will have to do is watch,     and you will see that the wicked are punished. and you will see that the wicked are punished.
Psalms-91-9: 9 You trust in the Lord for protection.     You have made God Most High your place of safety. You have made God Most High your place of safety.
Psalms-91-10: 10 So nothing bad will happen to you.     No diseases will come near your home. No diseases will come near your home.
Psalms-91-11: 11 He will command his angels to protect you wherever you go.
Psalms-91-12: 12 Their hands will catch you     so that you will not hit your foot on a rock. so that you will not hit your foot on a rock.
Psalms-91-13: 13 You will have power to trample on lions     and poisonous snakes. and poisonous snakes.
Psalms-91-14: 14 The Lord says, “If someone trusts me, I will save them.     I will protect my followers who call to me for help. I will protect my followers who call to me for help.
Psalms-91-15: 15 When my followers call to me, I will answer them.     I will be with them when they are in trouble. I will be with them when they are in trouble.     I will rescue them and honor them. I will rescue them and honor them.
Psalms-91-16: 16 I will give my followers a long life     and show them my power to save.” and show them my power to save.”
Psalms-92-1: A song of praise for the Sabbath. 92 It is good to praise the Lord. 92 It is good to praise the Lord.     God Most High, it is good to praise your name. God Most High, it is good to praise your name.
Psalms-92-2: 2 It is good to sing about your love in the morning     and about your faithfulness at night. and about your faithfulness at night.
Psalms-92-3: 3 It is good to play for you on the ten-stringed instrument and lyre     and to add the soft sounds of the harp to my praise. and to add the soft sounds of the harp to my praise.
Psalms-92-4: 4 Lord, you make us very happy because of what you did.     I gladly sing about it. I gladly sing about it.
Psalms-92-5: 5 Lord, you did such great things.     Your thoughts are too hard for us to understand. Your thoughts are too hard for us to understand.
Psalms-92-6: 6 Stupid people don’t know this.     Fools don’t understand. Fools don’t understand.
Psalms-92-7: 7 The wicked may sprout like grass,     and those who do evil may blossom like flowers, and those who do evil may blossom like flowers,     but they will be destroyed, never to be seen again. but they will be destroyed, never to be seen again.
Psalms-92-8: 8 But, Lord, you will be honored forever.
Psalms-92-9: 9 Lord, all your enemies will be destroyed,     and all who do evil will be scattered. and all who do evil will be scattered.
Psalms-92-10: 10 But you have made me as strong as a wild ox.     You have given me your blessing.[a] You have given me your blessing.[a]
Psalms-92-11: 11 My eyes will see the defeat of those waiting to attack me.     My ears will hear the cries of my evil enemies. My ears will hear the cries of my evil enemies.
Psalms-92-12: 12 Good people are like budding palm trees.     They grow strong like the cedar trees of Lebanon. They grow strong like the cedar trees of Lebanon.
Psalms-92-13: 13 They are planted in the house[b] of the Lord.     They grow strong there in the courtyards of our God. They grow strong there in the courtyards of our God.
Psalms-92-14: 14 Even when they are old,     they will continue producing fruit like young, healthy trees. they will continue producing fruit like young, healthy trees.
Psalms-92-15: 15 They are there to show everyone that the Lord is good.[c]     He is my Rock, and he does no wrong.[d] He is my Rock, and he does no wrong.[d]
Psalms-93-1: 93 The Lord is King. 93 The Lord is King.     The Lord wears majesty and strength like clothes. The Lord wears majesty and strength like clothes. He is ready, so the whole world is safe.     It will not be shaken. It will not be shaken.
Psalms-93-2: 2 Your kingdom has continued forever.     You have lived forever! You have lived forever!
Psalms-93-3: 3 Lord, the ocean roars.     The mighty ocean sounds like thunder The mighty ocean sounds like thunder     as the waves crash on the shore. as the waves crash on the shore.
Psalms-93-4: 4 The crashing waves of the sea are loud and powerful,     but the Lord above is even more powerful. but the Lord above is even more powerful.
Psalms-93-5: 5 Lord, your laws will continue forever.[a]     Your holy Temple will stand for a long time. Your holy Temple will stand for a long time.
Psalms-94-1: 94 The Lord is a God who punishes people. 94 The Lord is a God who punishes people.     God, come punish them. God, come punish them.
Psalms-94-2: 2 You are the judge of the whole earth.     Give proud people the punishment they deserve. Give proud people the punishment they deserve.
Psalms-94-3: 3 Lord, how long will the wicked have their fun?     How much longer? How much longer?
Psalms-94-4: 4 How much longer will those criminals     brag about the evil they did? brag about the evil they did?
Psalms-94-5: 5 Lord, they hurt your people     and make them suffer. and make them suffer.
Psalms-94-6: 6 They kill widows and foreigners living in our country.     They murder orphans. They murder orphans.
Psalms-94-7: 7 And they say the Lord does not see them doing these evil things!     They say the God of Jacob does not know what is happening. They say the God of Jacob does not know what is happening.
Psalms-94-8: 8 You evil people are foolish.     When will you learn your lesson? When will you learn your lesson? You are so stupid!     You must try to understand. You must try to understand.
Psalms-94-9: 9 God made our ears,     so surely he can hear what is happening! so surely he can hear what is happening! He made our eyes,     so surely he can see you! so surely he can see you!
Psalms-94-10: 10 The one who disciplines nations will surely correct you.     He is the one who teaches us everything. He is the one who teaches us everything.
Psalms-94-11: 11 The Lord knows what people are thinking.     He knows that their thoughts are like a puff of wind. He knows that their thoughts are like a puff of wind.
Psalms-94-12: 12 Lord, great blessings belong to those you discipline,     to those you teach from your law. to those you teach from your law.
Psalms-94-13: 13 You help them stay calm when trouble comes.     You will help them until the wicked are put in their graves. You will help them until the wicked are put in their graves.
Psalms-94-14: 14 The Lord will not leave his people.     He will not leave them without help. He will not leave them without help.
Psalms-94-15: 15 Justice will return and bring fairness.     And those who want to do right will be there to see it. And those who want to do right will be there to see it.
Psalms-94-16: 16 No one helped me fight against the wicked.     No one stood with me against those who do evil. No one stood with me against those who do evil.
Psalms-94-17: 17 And if the Lord had not helped me,     I would have been silenced by death. I would have been silenced by death.
Psalms-94-18: 18 I know I was ready to fall,     but, Lord, your faithful love supported me. but, Lord, your faithful love supported me.
Psalms-94-19: 19 I was very worried and upset,     but you comforted me and made me happy! but you comforted me and made me happy!
Psalms-94-20: 20 You don’t help crooked judges.     They use the law to make life hard for the people. They use the law to make life hard for the people.
Psalms-94-21: 21 They attack those who do right.     They say innocent people are guilty and put them to death. They say innocent people are guilty and put them to death.
Psalms-94-22: 22 But the Lord is my place of safety, high on the mountain.     God, my Rock, is my safe place! God, my Rock, is my safe place!
Psalms-94-23: 23 He will punish those evil judges for the bad things they did.     He will destroy them because they sinned. He will destroy them because they sinned.     The Lord our God will destroy them. The Lord our God will destroy them.
Psalms-95-1: 95 Come, let us sing praise to the Lord! 95 Come, let us sing praise to the Lord!     Let us shout praises to the Rock who saves us. Let us shout praises to the Rock who saves us.
Psalms-95-2: 2 Come and worship him with songs of thanks.[a]     Let us sing happy songs of praise to him. Let us sing happy songs of praise to him.
Psalms-95-3: 3 For the Lord is a great God,     the great King ruling over all the other “gods.” the great King ruling over all the other “gods.”
Psalms-95-4: 4 The deepest caves and the highest mountains belong to him.
Psalms-95-5: 5 The ocean is his—he created it.     He made the dry land with his own hands. He made the dry land with his own hands.
Psalms-95-6: 6 Come, let us bow down and worship him!     Let us kneel before the Lord who made us. Let us kneel before the Lord who made us.
Psalms-95-7: 7 He is our God,     and we are the people he cares for, and we are the people he cares for,     his sheep that walk by his side. his sheep that walk by his side. Listen to his voice today:
Psalms-95-8: 8     “Don’t be stubborn, as you were at Meribah, 8     “Don’t be stubborn, as you were at Meribah,     as you were at Massah[b] in the desert. as you were at Massah[b] in the desert.
Psalms-95-9: 9 Your ancestors doubted and tested me,     even after they saw what I could do! even after they saw what I could do!
Psalms-95-10: 10 I was angry with them for 40 years.     I said, ‘They are not faithful to me. I said, ‘They are not faithful to me.     They refuse to do what I say.’ They refuse to do what I say.’
Psalms-95-11: 11 So in my anger I made this vow:     ‘They will never enter my land of rest.’” ‘They will never enter my land of rest.’”
Psalms-96-1: 96 Sing a new song[a] to the Lord! 96 Sing a new song[a] to the Lord!     Let the whole world sing to the Lord! Let the whole world sing to the Lord!
Psalms-96-2: 2 Sing to the Lord and praise his name!     Tell the good news every day about how he saves us! Tell the good news every day about how he saves us!
Psalms-96-3: 3 Tell all the nations how wonderful he is!     Tell people everywhere about the amazing things he does. Tell people everywhere about the amazing things he does.
Psalms-96-4: 4 The Lord is great and worthy of praise.     He is more awesome than any of the “gods.” He is more awesome than any of the “gods.”
Psalms-96-5: 5 All the “gods” in other nations are nothing but statues,     but the Lord made the heavens. but the Lord made the heavens.
Psalms-96-6: 6 He lives in the presence of glory and honor.     His Temple is a place of power and beauty. His Temple is a place of power and beauty.
Psalms-96-7: 7 Praise the Lord, all people of every nation;     praise the Lord’s glory and power. praise the Lord’s glory and power.
Psalms-96-8: 8 Give the Lord praise worthy of his glory!     Come, bring your offerings into his courtyard. Come, bring your offerings into his courtyard.
Psalms-96-9: 9     Worship the Lord in all his holy beauty. 9     Worship the Lord in all his holy beauty. Everyone on earth should tremble before him.
Psalms-96-10: 10     Tell the nations that the Lord is King! 10     Tell the nations that the Lord is King! The world stands firm and cannot be moved.     He will judge all people fairly. He will judge all people fairly.
Psalms-96-11: 11 Let the heavens rejoice and the earth be happy!     Let the sea and everything in it shout for joy! Let the sea and everything in it shout for joy!
Psalms-96-12: 12 Let the fields and everything in them be happy!     Let the trees in the forest sing for joy Let the trees in the forest sing for joy
Psalms-96-13: 13 when they see the Lord coming!     He is coming to rule[b] the world. He is coming to rule[b] the world. He will rule all the nations of the world     with justice and fairness. with justice and fairness.
Psalms-97-1: 97 The Lord rules, and the earth is happy. 97 The Lord rules, and the earth is happy.     All the faraway lands are happy. All the faraway lands are happy.
Psalms-97-2: 2 Thick, dark clouds surround him.     Goodness and justice make his kingdom strong. Goodness and justice make his kingdom strong.
Psalms-97-3: 3 Fire goes before him     and destroys his enemies. and destroys his enemies.
Psalms-97-4: 4 His lightning flashes in the sky.     The earth sees it and trembles with fear. The earth sees it and trembles with fear.
Psalms-97-5: 5 The mountains melt like wax before the Lord,     before the Lord of all the earth. before the Lord of all the earth.
Psalms-97-6: 6 The skies tell about his goodness,     and the nations see his glory. and the nations see his glory.
Psalms-97-7: 7 People worship their idols.     They brag about their “gods.” They brag about their “gods.” But they will be embarrassed.     And all their “gods” will bow down before the Lord. And all their “gods” will bow down before the Lord.
Psalms-97-8: 8 Zion, listen and be happy!     Cities of Judah, be glad! Cities of Judah, be glad!     Rejoice because the Lord’s decisions are fair. Rejoice because the Lord’s decisions are fair.
Psalms-97-9: 9 Lord Most High, you really are the ruler of the earth.     You are much better than the “gods.” You are much better than the “gods.”
Psalms-97-10: 10 Hate evil, you who love the Lord.     He protects his followers and saves them from evil people. He protects his followers and saves them from evil people.
Psalms-97-11: 11 Light and happiness shine on those     who want to do right. who want to do right.
Psalms-97-12: 12 Good people, be happy in the Lord!     Praise his holy name! Praise his holy name!
Psalms-98-1: A song of praise. 98 Sing a new song[a] to the Lord, 98 Sing a new song[a] to the Lord,     because he has done amazing things! because he has done amazing things! His powerful and holy right arm[b]     has brought him another victory. has brought him another victory.
Psalms-98-2: 2 The Lord showed the nations his power to save.     He showed them his goodness. He showed them his goodness.
Psalms-98-3: 3 He has kept his promise of love and loyalty to the people of Israel.     People everywhere have seen our God’s power to save. People everywhere have seen our God’s power to save.
Psalms-98-4: 4 Everyone on earth, shout with joy to the Lord.     Start singing happy songs of praise! Start singing happy songs of praise!
Psalms-98-5: 5 Praise the Lord with harps.     Yes, praise him with music from the harps. Yes, praise him with music from the harps.
Psalms-98-6: 6 Blow the pipes and horns,     and shout for joy to the Lord our King! and shout for joy to the Lord our King!
Psalms-98-7: 7 Let the sea and everything in it,     the earth and all who live in it shout his praise! the earth and all who live in it shout his praise!
Psalms-98-8: 8 Rivers, clap your hands!     All together now, mountains sing out! All together now, mountains sing out!
Psalms-98-9: 9 Sing before the Lord     because he is coming to judge the world. because he is coming to judge the world. He will rule the world fairly.     He will rule the people with goodness. He will rule the people with goodness.
Psalms-99-1: 99 The Lord is King, 99 The Lord is King,     so let the nations shake with fear. so let the nations shake with fear. He sits as King above the Cherub angels,     so let the whole earth shake. so let the whole earth shake.
Psalms-99-2: 2 The Lord in Zion is great!     He is the great leader over all people. He is the great leader over all people.
Psalms-99-3: 3 Let all the nations praise your name.     Your name is great and awesome. Your name is great and awesome.     Your name is holy. Your name is holy.
Psalms-99-4: 4 You are the powerful King who loves justice.     You have made things right. You have made things right.     You have brought goodness and fairness to Jacob. You have brought goodness and fairness to Jacob.
Psalms-99-5: 5 Praise the Lord our God,     and bow down before his footstool,[a] for he is holy. and bow down before his footstool,[a] for he is holy.
Psalms-99-6: 6 Moses and Aaron were some of his priests,     and Samuel was one of the men who called on his name. and Samuel was one of the men who called on his name. They prayed to the Lord,     and he answered them. and he answered them.
Psalms-99-7: 7 God spoke from the tall cloud,     and they obeyed his commands and they obeyed his commands     and the law he gave them. and the law he gave them.
Psalms-99-8: 8 Lord our God, you answered their prayers.     You showed them that you are a forgiving God You showed them that you are a forgiving God     and that you punish people for the evil they do. and that you punish people for the evil they do.
Psalms-99-9: 9 Praise the Lord our God.     Bow down toward his holy mountain and worship him. Bow down toward his holy mountain and worship him.     The Lord our God is holy! The Lord our God is holy!
Psalms-100-1: A song of thanks. 100 Earth, sing to the Lord! 100 Earth, sing to the Lord!
Psalms-100-2: 2 Be happy as you serve the Lord!     Come before him with happy songs! Come before him with happy songs!
Psalms-100-3: 3 Know that the Lord is God.     He made us, and we belong to him. He made us, and we belong to him.     We are his people, the sheep he takes care of. We are his people, the sheep he takes care of.
Psalms-100-4: 4 Come through the gates to his Temple giving thanks to him.     Enter his courtyards with songs of praise. Enter his courtyards with songs of praise.     Honor him and bless his name. Honor him and bless his name.
Psalms-100-5: 5 The Lord is good!     There is no end to his faithful love. There is no end to his faithful love.     We can trust him forever and ever! We can trust him forever and ever!
Psalms-101-1: A song of David. 101 I will sing about love and justice. 101 I will sing about love and justice.     Lord, I will sing to you. Lord, I will sing to you.
Psalms-101-2: 2 I will be careful to live a pure life.     I will live in my house with complete honesty. I will live in my house with complete honesty.     When will you come to me? When will you come to me?
Psalms-101-3: 3 I will not even look at anything shameful.[a]     I hate all wrongdoing. I hate all wrongdoing.     I want no part of it! I want no part of it!
Psalms-101-4: 4 I will not be involved in anything dishonest.     I will have nothing to do with evil. I will have nothing to do with evil.
Psalms-101-5: 5 I will stop anyone who secretly     says bad things about a neighbor. says bad things about a neighbor. I will not allow people to be proud     and think they are better than others. and think they are better than others.
Psalms-101-6: 6 I will look throughout the land for those who can be trusted.     Only such people can live with me. Only such people can live with me.     Only those who live pure lives can be my servants. Only those who live pure lives can be my servants.
Psalms-101-7: 7 I will never let a dishonest person live in my house.     I will not let liars stay near me. I will not let liars stay near me.
Psalms-101-8: 8 My goal each day will be to destroy the wicked living in our land.     I will force all who do evil to leave the city of the Lord. I will force all who do evil to leave the city of the Lord.
Psalms-102-1: A prayer for a time of suffering, when anyone feels weak and wants to tell their complaints to the Lord. 102 Lord, hear my prayer. 102 Lord, hear my prayer.     Listen to my cry for help. Listen to my cry for help.
Psalms-102-2: 2 Don’t turn away from me when I have troubles.     Listen to me, and answer me quickly when I cry for help. Listen to me, and answer me quickly when I cry for help.
Psalms-102-3: 3 My life is passing away like smoke.     My life is like a fire slowly burning out. My life is like a fire slowly burning out.
Psalms-102-4: 4 My strength is gone—     I am like dry, dying grass. I am like dry, dying grass.     I even forget to eat. I even forget to eat.
Psalms-102-5: 5 Because of my sadness, I am losing so much weight     that my skin hangs from my bones. that my skin hangs from my bones.
Psalms-102-6: 6 I am lonely, like an owl living in the desert,     like an owl living among old ruined buildings. like an owl living among old ruined buildings.
Psalms-102-7: 7 I cannot sleep.     I am like a lonely bird on the roof. I am like a lonely bird on the roof.
Psalms-102-8: 8 My enemies insult me all the time.     They make fun of me and use me as an example in their curses. They make fun of me and use me as an example in their curses.
Psalms-102-9: 9 My great sadness is my only food.     My tears fall into my drink. My tears fall into my drink.
Psalms-102-10: 10 You were angry with me,     so you picked me up and threw me away. so you picked me up and threw me away.
Psalms-102-11: 11 My life is almost finished, like the long shadows at the end of the day.     I am like dry and dying grass. I am like dry and dying grass.
Psalms-102-12: 12 But you, Lord, will rule as king forever!     Your name will continue forever and ever! Your name will continue forever and ever!
Psalms-102-13: 13 You will rise up and comfort Zion.     The time has come for you to be kind to Zion. The time has come for you to be kind to Zion.
Psalms-102-14: 14 Your servants love her stones.     They love even the dust of that city! They love even the dust of that city!
Psalms-102-15: 15 The nations will worship the Lord’s name.     All the kings on earth will honor you. All the kings on earth will honor you.
Psalms-102-16: 16 The Lord will rebuild Zion,     and people will again see her glory. and people will again see her glory.
Psalms-102-17: 17 He will listen to the prayers of those in poverty.     He will not ignore them. He will not ignore them.
Psalms-102-18: 18 Write these things for future generations,     so that they will praise the Lord. so that they will praise the Lord.
Psalms-102-19: 19 The Lord will look down from his Holy Place above.     He will look down at the earth from heaven. He will look down at the earth from heaven.
Psalms-102-20: 20 And he will hear the prisoner’s prayers.     He will free those who were condemned to die. He will free those who were condemned to die.
Psalms-102-21: 21 Then people in Zion will tell about the Lord.     They will praise his name in Jerusalem They will praise his name in Jerusalem
Psalms-102-22: 22 when nations gather together     and kingdoms come to serve the Lord. and kingdoms come to serve the Lord.
Psalms-102-23: 23 My strength failed me.     My life is cut short. My life is cut short.
Psalms-102-24: 24 So I said, “Don’t let me die while I am still young.     God, you will live forever and ever! God, you will live forever and ever!
Psalms-102-25: 25 Long ago, you made the world.     You made the sky with your own hands! You made the sky with your own hands!
Psalms-102-26: 26 The earth and sky will end,     but you will live forever! but you will live forever! They will wear out like clothes,     and like clothes, you will change them. and like clothes, you will change them.
Psalms-102-27: 27 But you never change.     You will live forever! You will live forever!
Psalms-102-28: 28 We are your servants today.     Our children will live here, Our children will live here,     and their descendants will come here to worship you.” and their descendants will come here to worship you.”
Psalms-103-1: A song of David. 103 My soul, praise the Lord! 103 My soul, praise the Lord!     Every part of me, praise his holy name! Every part of me, praise his holy name!
Psalms-103-2: 2 My soul, praise the Lord     and never forget how kind he is! and never forget how kind he is!
Psalms-103-3: 3 He forgives all our sins     and heals all our sicknesses. and heals all our sicknesses.
Psalms-103-4: 4 He saves us from the grave,     and he gives us love and compassion. and he gives us love and compassion.
Psalms-103-5: 5 He gives us plenty of good things.     He makes us young again, He makes us young again,     like an eagle that grows new feathers. like an eagle that grows new feathers.
Psalms-103-6: 6 The Lord does what is fair.     He brings justice to all who have been hurt by others. He brings justice to all who have been hurt by others.
Psalms-103-7: 7 He taught his laws to Moses.     He let Israel see the powerful things he can do. He let Israel see the powerful things he can do.
Psalms-103-8: 8 The Lord is kind and merciful.     He is patient and full of love. He is patient and full of love.
Psalms-103-9: 9 He does not always criticize.     He does not stay angry with us forever. He does not stay angry with us forever.
Psalms-103-10: 10 We sinned against him,     but he didn’t give us the punishment we deserved. but he didn’t give us the punishment we deserved.
Psalms-103-11: 11 His love for his followers is     as high above us as heaven is above the earth. as high above us as heaven is above the earth.
Psalms-103-12: 12 And he has taken our sins     as far away from us as the east is from the west. as far away from us as the east is from the west.
Psalms-103-13: 13 The Lord is as kind to his followers     as a father is to his children. as a father is to his children.
Psalms-103-14: 14 He knows all about us.     He knows we are made from dust. He knows we are made from dust.
Psalms-103-15: 15 He knows our lives are short, that they are like grass.     He knows we are like a little wildflower that grows so quickly, He knows we are like a little wildflower that grows so quickly,
Psalms-103-16: 16 but when the hot wind blows, it dies.     Soon, you cannot even see where the flower was. Soon, you cannot even see where the flower was.
Psalms-103-17: 17 But the Lord has always loved his followers,     and he will continue to love them forever and ever! and he will continue to love them forever and ever!     He will be good to all their descendants, He will be good to all their descendants,
Psalms-103-18: 18 to those who are faithful to his agreement     and who remember to obey his commands. and who remember to obey his commands.
Psalms-103-19: 19 The Lord set his throne up in heaven,     and he rules over everything. and he rules over everything.
Psalms-103-20: 20 Angels, praise the Lord!     You angels are the powerful soldiers who obey his commands. You angels are the powerful soldiers who obey his commands.     You listen to him and obey his commands. You listen to him and obey his commands.
Psalms-103-21: 21 Praise the Lord, all his armies.[a]     You are his servants, You are his servants,     and you do what he wants. and you do what he wants.
Psalms-103-22: 22 Everything the Lord has made should praise him     throughout the world that he rules! throughout the world that he rules! My soul, praise the Lord!
Psalms-104-1: 104 My soul, praise the Lord! 104 My soul, praise the Lord!     Lord my God, you are very great! Lord my God, you are very great! You are clothed with glory and honor.
Psalms-104-2: 2     You wear light like a robe. 2     You wear light like a robe. You spread out the skies like a curtain.
Psalms-104-3: 3     You built your home above them.[a] 3     You built your home above them.[a] You use the thick clouds like a chariot     and ride across the sky on the wings of the wind. and ride across the sky on the wings of the wind.
Psalms-104-4: 4 You make the winds your messengers     and flames of fire your servants.[b] and flames of fire your servants.[b]
Psalms-104-5: 5 You built the earth on its foundations,     so it can never be moved. so it can never be moved.
Psalms-104-6: 6 You covered it with water like a blanket.     The water covered even the mountains. The water covered even the mountains.
Psalms-104-7: 7 But you gave the command, and the water turned back.     You shouted at the water, and it rushed away. You shouted at the water, and it rushed away.
Psalms-104-8: 8 The water flowed down from the mountains into the valleys,     to the places you made for it. to the places you made for it.
Psalms-104-9: 9 You set the limits for the seas,     and the water will never again rise to cover the earth. and the water will never again rise to cover the earth.
Psalms-104-10: 10 Lord, you cause water to flow from springs into the streams     that flow down between the mountains. that flow down between the mountains.
Psalms-104-11: 11 The streams provide water for all the wild animals.     Even the wild donkeys come there to drink. Even the wild donkeys come there to drink.
Psalms-104-12: 12 Wild birds come to live by the pools;     they sing in the branches of nearby trees. they sing in the branches of nearby trees.
Psalms-104-13: 13 You send rain down on the mountains.     The earth gets everything it needs from what you have made. The earth gets everything it needs from what you have made.
Psalms-104-14: 14 You make the grass grow to feed the animals.     You provide plants for the crops we grow— You provide plants for the crops we grow—     the plants that give us food from the earth. the plants that give us food from the earth.
Psalms-104-15: 15 You give us the wine that makes us happy,     the oil that makes our skin soft,[c] the oil that makes our skin soft,[c]     and the food that makes us strong. and the food that makes us strong.
Psalms-104-16: 16 The great cedar trees of Lebanon belong to the Lord.     He planted them and gives them the water they need. He planted them and gives them the water they need.
Psalms-104-17: 17 That’s where the birds make their nests,     and the storks live in the fir trees. and the storks live in the fir trees.
Psalms-104-18: 18 The high mountains are a home for wild goats.     The large rocks are hiding places for rock badgers. The large rocks are hiding places for rock badgers.
Psalms-104-19: 19 Lord, you made the moon to show us when the festivals begin.     And the sun always knows when to set. And the sun always knows when to set.
Psalms-104-20: 20 You made darkness to be the night—     the time when wild animals come out and roam around. the time when wild animals come out and roam around.
Psalms-104-21: 21 Lions roar as they attack,     as if they are asking God for the food he gives them. as if they are asking God for the food he gives them.
Psalms-104-22: 22 When the sun rises, they leave     and go back to their dens to rest. and go back to their dens to rest.
Psalms-104-23: 23 Then people go out to do their work,     and they work until evening. and they work until evening.
Psalms-104-24: 24 Lord, you created so many things!     With your wisdom you made them all. With your wisdom you made them all.     The earth is full of the living things you made. The earth is full of the living things you made.
Psalms-104-25: 25 Look at the ocean, so big and wide!     It is filled with all kinds of sea life. It is filled with all kinds of sea life.     There are creatures large and small—too many to count! There are creatures large and small—too many to count!
Psalms-104-26: 26 Ships sail over the ocean,     and playing there is Leviathan,[d] and playing there is Leviathan,[d]     the great sea creature you made. the great sea creature you made.
Psalms-104-27: 27 Lord, all living things depend on you.     You give them food at the right time. You give them food at the right time.
Psalms-104-28: 28 You give it, and they eat it.     They are filled with good food from your open hands. They are filled with good food from your open hands.
Psalms-104-29: 29 When you turn away from them,     they become frightened. they become frightened. When you take away their breath,[e]     they die, and their bodies return to the dust. they die, and their bodies return to the dust.
Psalms-104-30: 30 But when you send out your life-giving breath,[f]     things come alive, and the world is like new again! things come alive, and the world is like new again!
Psalms-104-31: 31 May the Lord’s glory continue forever!     May the Lord enjoy what he made. May the Lord enjoy what he made.
Psalms-104-32: 32 He just looks at the earth, and it trembles.     He just touches the mountains, and smoke rises from them. He just touches the mountains, and smoke rises from them.
Psalms-104-33: 33 I will sing to the Lord for the rest of my life.     I will sing praises to my God as long as I live. I will sing praises to my God as long as I live.
Psalms-104-34: 34 May my words be pleasing to him.     The Lord is the one who makes me happy. The Lord is the one who makes me happy.
Psalms-104-35: 35 I wish sinners would disappear from the earth.     I wish the wicked would be gone forever. I wish the wicked would be gone forever. My soul, praise the Lord!     Praise the Lord! Praise the Lord!
Psalms-105-1: 105 Give thanks to the Lord and call out to him! 105 Give thanks to the Lord and call out to him!     Tell the nations what he has done! Tell the nations what he has done!
Psalms-105-2: 2 Sing to him; sing praises to him.     Tell about the amazing things he has done. Tell about the amazing things he has done.
Psalms-105-3: 3 Be proud of his holy name.     You followers of the Lord, be happy! You followers of the Lord, be happy!
Psalms-105-4: 4 Depend on the Lord for strength.     Always go to him for help. Always go to him for help.
Psalms-105-5: 5 Remember the amazing things he has done.     Remember his miracles and his fair decisions. Remember his miracles and his fair decisions.
Psalms-105-6: 6 You belong to the family of his servant Abraham.     You are descendants of Jacob, the people God chose. You are descendants of Jacob, the people God chose.
Psalms-105-7: 7 The Lord is our God.     He rules the whole world. He rules the whole world.
Psalms-105-8: 8 He will remember his agreement forever.     He will always keep the promises he made to his people. He will always keep the promises he made to his people.
Psalms-105-9: 9 He will keep the agreement he made with Abraham     and the promise he made to Isaac. and the promise he made to Isaac.
Psalms-105-10: 10 He gave it as a law to Jacob.     He gave it to Israel as an agreement that will last forever! He gave it to Israel as an agreement that will last forever!
Psalms-105-11: 11 He said, “I will give you the land of Canaan.     It will be your very own.” It will be your very own.”
Psalms-105-12: 12 At the time God said this, there were only a few of his people,     and they were strangers there. and they were strangers there.
Psalms-105-13: 13 They traveled around from nation to nation,     from one kingdom to another. from one kingdom to another.
Psalms-105-14: 14 But the Lord did not let anyone mistreat them.     He warned kings not to harm them. He warned kings not to harm them.
Psalms-105-15: 15 He said, “Don’t hurt my chosen people.     Don’t harm my prophets.” Don’t harm my prophets.”
Psalms-105-16: 16 He caused a famine in that country,     and people did not have enough food. and people did not have enough food.
Psalms-105-17: 17 But he sent a man named Joseph to go ahead of them.     Joseph was sold like a slave. Joseph was sold like a slave.
Psalms-105-18: 18 They tied a rope around his feet     and put an iron ring around his neck. and put an iron ring around his neck.
Psalms-105-19: 19 Joseph was a slave until what he said had really happened.     The Lord’s message proved that Joseph was right. The Lord’s message proved that Joseph was right.
Psalms-105-20: 20 So the king of Egypt set him free.     That nation’s leader let him out of jail. That nation’s leader let him out of jail.
Psalms-105-21: 21 He put Joseph in charge of his house.     Joseph took care of everything the king owned. Joseph took care of everything the king owned.
Psalms-105-22: 22 Joseph gave instructions to the other leaders.     He taught the older men. He taught the older men.
Psalms-105-23: 23 Then Israel came to Egypt.     Jacob lived there in Ham’s country.[a] Jacob lived there in Ham’s country.[a]
Psalms-105-24: 24 Jacob’s family became very large     and more powerful than their enemies. and more powerful than their enemies.
Psalms-105-25: 25 So the Egyptians began to hate his people.     They made plans against his servants. They made plans against his servants.
Psalms-105-26: 26 So the Lord sent Moses, his servant,     and Aaron, his chosen priest. and Aaron, his chosen priest.
Psalms-105-27: 27 He used Moses and Aaron     to do many miracles in Ham’s country. to do many miracles in Ham’s country.
Psalms-105-28: 28 He sent darkness to cover their land,     but the Egyptians did not listen to him. but the Egyptians did not listen to him.
Psalms-105-29: 29 So he changed the water into blood,     and all their fish died. and all their fish died.
Psalms-105-30: 30 Their country was filled with frogs,     even in the king’s bedroom. even in the king’s bedroom.
Psalms-105-31: 31 The Lord gave the command,     and the flies and gnats came. and the flies and gnats came.     They were everywhere! They were everywhere!
Psalms-105-32: 32 He made the rain become hail.     Lightning struck throughout their land. Lightning struck throughout their land.
Psalms-105-33: 33 He destroyed their vines and fig trees.     He destroyed every tree in their country. He destroyed every tree in their country.
Psalms-105-34: 34 He gave the command, and the locusts and grasshoppers came.     There were too many to count! There were too many to count!
Psalms-105-35: 35 They ate all the plants in the country,     including all the crops in their fields. including all the crops in their fields.
Psalms-105-36: 36 Then the Lord killed every firstborn in their country.     He killed their oldest sons. He killed their oldest sons.
Psalms-105-37: 37 He led his people out of Egypt.     They were carrying gold and silver, They were carrying gold and silver,     and none of them stumbled or fell behind. and none of them stumbled or fell behind.
Psalms-105-38: 38 Egypt was happy to see his people go,     because they were afraid of them. because they were afraid of them.
Psalms-105-39: 39 The Lord spread out his cloud like a blanket.     He used his column of fire to give his people light at night. He used his column of fire to give his people light at night.
Psalms-105-40: 40 They asked for food, and he sent them quail.     He also gave them plenty of bread from heaven. He also gave them plenty of bread from heaven.
Psalms-105-41: 41 He split the rock, and water came bubbling out.     A river began flowing in the desert! A river began flowing in the desert!
Psalms-105-42: 42 The Lord remembered his holy promise     that he had made to his servant Abraham. that he had made to his servant Abraham.
Psalms-105-43: 43 He brought his people out of Egypt.     They came out rejoicing and singing their happy songs! They came out rejoicing and singing their happy songs!
Psalms-105-44: 44 Then he gave his people the lands of other nations.     His people got what others had worked for. His people got what others had worked for.
Psalms-105-45: 45 He did this so that his people would obey his laws     and follow his teachings. and follow his teachings. Praise the Lord!
Psalms-106-1: 106 Praise the Lord! 106 Praise the Lord! Give thanks to the Lord because he is good!     His faithful love will last forever! His faithful love will last forever!
Psalms-106-2: 2 No one can describe how great the Lord really is.     No one can praise him enough. No one can praise him enough.
Psalms-106-3: 3 Those who obey his commands are happy.     They do good things all the time. They do good things all the time.
Psalms-106-4: 4 Lord, remember me when you show kindness to your people.     Remember to save me too! Remember to save me too!
Psalms-106-5: 5 Let me share in the good things     that you do for your chosen people. that you do for your chosen people. Let me rejoice with your nation.     Let me join with your people in praise. Let me join with your people in praise.
Psalms-106-6: 6 We sinned just as our ancestors did.     We were wrong; we did bad things! We were wrong; we did bad things!
Psalms-106-7: 7 Lord, our ancestors learned nothing     from the miracles you did in Egypt. from the miracles you did in Egypt. They forgot your kindness at the Red Sea     and rebelled against you. and rebelled against you.
Psalms-106-8: 8 But the Lord saved our ancestors for the honor of his name.     He saved them to show his great power. He saved them to show his great power.
Psalms-106-9: 9 He gave the command, and the Red Sea became dry.     He led them through the deep sea on land as dry as the desert. He led them through the deep sea on land as dry as the desert.
Psalms-106-10: 10 He saved our ancestors     and rescued them from their enemies. and rescued them from their enemies.
Psalms-106-11: 11 He covered their enemies with the sea.     Not one of them escaped! Not one of them escaped!
Psalms-106-12: 12 Then our ancestors believed what he had said.     They sang praises to him. They sang praises to him.
Psalms-106-13: 13 But they quickly forgot about what he did.     They did not listen to his advice. They did not listen to his advice.
Psalms-106-14: 14 They became hungry in the desert,     and they tested him in the wilderness. and they tested him in the wilderness.
Psalms-106-15: 15 He gave them what they asked for,     but he also gave them a terrible disease. but he also gave them a terrible disease.
Psalms-106-16: 16 The people became jealous of Moses.     They became jealous of Aaron, the Lord’s holy priest. They became jealous of Aaron, the Lord’s holy priest.
Psalms-106-17: 17 The ground opened up and swallowed Dathan.     Then the ground closed up and covered Abiram’s group. Then the ground closed up and covered Abiram’s group.
Psalms-106-18: 18 Then a fire burned that mob of people.     It burned those wicked people. It burned those wicked people.
Psalms-106-19: 19 The people made a golden calf at Mount Horeb.     They worshiped a statue! They worshiped a statue!
Psalms-106-20: 20 They traded their glorious God     for a statue of a grass-eating bull! for a statue of a grass-eating bull!
Psalms-106-21: 21 They forgot all about God, the one who saved them,     the one who did the miracles in Egypt. the one who did the miracles in Egypt.
Psalms-106-22: 22 He did amazing things there in Ham’s country[a]!     He did awesome things at the Red Sea! He did awesome things at the Red Sea!
Psalms-106-23: 23 God wanted to destroy those people,     but Moses, the leader he chose, stood in the way. but Moses, the leader he chose, stood in the way. God was very angry, but Moses begged him to stop,     so God did not destroy the people.[b] so God did not destroy the people.[b]
Psalms-106-24: 24 But then they refused to go into the wonderful land of Canaan.     They did not believe that God would help them defeat the people there. They did not believe that God would help them defeat the people there.
Psalms-106-25: 25 Our ancestors complained in their tents     and refused to obey the Lord. and refused to obey the Lord.
Psalms-106-26: 26 So he swore that they would die     in the desert. in the desert.
Psalms-106-27: 27 He promised to scatter them among the nations     and to let other people defeat their descendants. and to let other people defeat their descendants.
Psalms-106-28: 28 At Baal Peor they joined in worshiping Baal     and ate sacrifices to honor the dead.[c] and ate sacrifices to honor the dead.[c]
Psalms-106-29: 29 The Lord became angry with his people,     so he made them sick. so he made them sick.
Psalms-106-30: 30 But Phinehas prayed[d] to God,     and God stopped the sickness. and God stopped the sickness.
Psalms-106-31: 31 He considered what Phinehas did a good work,     and it will be remembered forever and ever. and it will be remembered forever and ever.
Psalms-106-32: 32 At Meribah the people made the Lord angry     and created trouble for Moses. and created trouble for Moses.
Psalms-106-33: 33 They upset Moses,     and he spoke without stopping to think. and he spoke without stopping to think.
Psalms-106-34: 34 The Lord told the people to destroy the other nations living in Canaan.     But the Israelites did not obey him. But the Israelites did not obey him.
Psalms-106-35: 35 They mixed with the other people     and did what those people were doing. and did what those people were doing.
Psalms-106-36: 36 They began worshiping the false gods those people worshiped.     And their idols became a trap. And their idols became a trap.
Psalms-106-37: 37 They even offered their own children     as sacrifices to demons. as sacrifices to demons.
Psalms-106-38: 38 They killed their innocent sons and daughters     and offered them to the false gods of Canaan. and offered them to the false gods of Canaan.     So the land was polluted with the sin of murder. So the land was polluted with the sin of murder.
Psalms-106-39: 39 They were unfaithful to him,     and they became dirty with the sins of other nations. and they became dirty with the sins of other nations.
Psalms-106-40: 40 So the Lord became angry with his people.     He rejected those who belonged to him. He rejected those who belonged to him.
Psalms-106-41: 41 He gave his people to other nations     and let their enemies rule over them. and let their enemies rule over them.
Psalms-106-42: 42 Their enemies controlled them     and made life hard for them. and made life hard for them.
Psalms-106-43: 43 He saved his people many times,     but they turned against him and did what they wanted to do. but they turned against him and did what they wanted to do.     His people did many bad things. His people did many bad things.
Psalms-106-44: 44 But whenever they were in trouble,     he listened to their prayers. he listened to their prayers.
Psalms-106-45: 45 He always remembered his agreement,     and because of his faithful love, he comforted them. and because of his faithful love, he comforted them.
Psalms-106-46: 46 Other nations took them as prisoners,     but the Lord caused them to be kind to his people. but the Lord caused them to be kind to his people.
Psalms-106-47: 47 Lord our God, save us!     Bring us back together from those nations. Bring us back together from those nations. Then we will give thanks to your holy name     and joyfully praise you. and joyfully praise you.
Psalms-106-48: 48 Praise the Lord, the God of Israel!     He always was and will always be worthy of praise. He always was and will always be worthy of praise. Let all the people say, “Amen!” Praise the Lord!
Psalms-107-1: Book 5 (Psalms 107-150) 107 Praise the Lord, because he is good! 107 Praise the Lord, because he is good!     His faithful love will last forever! His faithful love will last forever!
Psalms-107-2: 2 Everyone the Lord has saved should repeat that word of thanks.     Praise him, all who have been rescued from the enemy. Praise him, all who have been rescued from the enemy.
Psalms-107-3: 3 He gathered his people together from many different countries.     He brought them from east and west, north and south.[a] He brought them from east and west, north and south.[a]
Psalms-107-4: 4 Some of them wandered in the dry desert.     They were looking for a place to live, They were looking for a place to live,     but they could not find a city. but they could not find a city.
Psalms-107-5: 5 They were hungry and thirsty     and growing weak. and growing weak.
Psalms-107-6: 6 Then they called to the Lord for help,     and he saved them from their troubles. and he saved them from their troubles.
Psalms-107-7: 7 He led them straight to the city where they would live.
Psalms-107-8: 8 Thank the Lord for his faithful love     and for the amazing things he does for people. and for the amazing things he does for people.
Psalms-107-9: 9 He satisfies those who are thirsty.     He fills those who are hungry with good things. He fills those who are hungry with good things.
Psalms-107-10: 10 Some of God’s people were prisoners,     locked behind bars in dark prisons. locked behind bars in dark prisons.
Psalms-107-11: 11 That was because they had fought against what God said.     They refused to listen to the advice of God Most High. They refused to listen to the advice of God Most High.
Psalms-107-12: 12 God made life hard for those people     because of what they did. because of what they did. They stumbled and fell,     and there was no one to help them. and there was no one to help them.
Psalms-107-13: 13 They were in trouble, so they called to the Lord for help,     and he saved them from their troubles. and he saved them from their troubles.
Psalms-107-14: 14 He took them out of their dark prisons.     He broke the ropes that held them. He broke the ropes that held them.
Psalms-107-15: 15 Thank the Lord for his faithful love     and for the amazing things he does for people. and for the amazing things he does for people.
Psalms-107-16: 16 He breaks down their bronze gates.     He shatters their iron bars. He shatters their iron bars.
Psalms-107-17: 17 Some people became fools and turned against God,     and they suffered for the evil they did. and they suffered for the evil they did.
Psalms-107-18: 18 They became so sick that they refused to eat,     so they almost died. so they almost died.
Psalms-107-19: 19 They were in trouble, so they called to the Lord for help,     and he saved them from their troubles. and he saved them from their troubles.
Psalms-107-20: 20 He gave the command and healed them,     so they were saved from the grave. so they were saved from the grave.
Psalms-107-21: 21 Thank the Lord for his faithful love     and for the amazing things he does for people. and for the amazing things he does for people.
Psalms-107-22: 22 Offer sacrifices of thanks to him.     Sing with joy about all that he has done. Sing with joy about all that he has done.
Psalms-107-23: 23 Some sailed the sea in ships.     Their work carried them across the water. Their work carried them across the water.
Psalms-107-24: 24 They saw what the Lord can do.     They saw the amazing things he did at sea. They saw the amazing things he did at sea.
Psalms-107-25: 25 He gave the command, and a strong wind began to blow.     The waves became higher and higher. The waves became higher and higher.
Psalms-107-26: 26 The waves lifted them high into the sky     and dropped them into the deep sea. and dropped them into the deep sea.     The storm was so dangerous that the men lost their courage. The storm was so dangerous that the men lost their courage.
Psalms-107-27: 27 They were stumbling and falling like someone who is drunk.     Their skill as sailors was useless. Their skill as sailors was useless.
Psalms-107-28: 28 They were in trouble, so they called to the Lord for help,     and he saved them from their troubles. and he saved them from their troubles.
Psalms-107-29: 29 He stopped the storm     and calmed the waves. and calmed the waves.
Psalms-107-30: 30 The sailors were happy that the sea became calm,     and he led them safely to where they wanted to go. and he led them safely to where they wanted to go.
Psalms-107-31: 31 Thank the Lord for his faithful love     and for the amazing things he does for people. and for the amazing things he does for people.
Psalms-107-32: 32 Praise God in the great assembly.     Praise him when the older leaders meet together. Praise him when the older leaders meet together.
Psalms-107-33: 33 He changed rivers into a desert.     He stopped springs from flowing. He stopped springs from flowing.
Psalms-107-34: 34 He made the fertile land become salty,     because the people living there did such evil things. because the people living there did such evil things.
Psalms-107-35: 35 He changed the desert into a land with pools of water.     He caused springs to flow from dry ground. He caused springs to flow from dry ground.
Psalms-107-36: 36 He led the hungry to that good land,     and they built a city to live in. and they built a city to live in.
Psalms-107-37: 37 They planted seeds in their fields and grapes in their vineyards,     and they had a good harvest. and they had a good harvest.
Psalms-107-38: 38 God blessed them with many children     and plenty of animals. and plenty of animals.
Psalms-107-39: 39 But because of disaster and troubles,     their families became small and weak. their families became small and weak.
Psalms-107-40: 40 God shames even great leaders     and makes them wander through empty deserts. and makes them wander through empty deserts.
Psalms-107-41: 41 But he rescues the poor from their misery.     He makes their families large like flocks of sheep. He makes their families large like flocks of sheep.
Psalms-107-42: 42 Good people see this and are happy.     But the wicked see it and don’t know what to say. But the wicked see it and don’t know what to say.
Psalms-107-43: 43 Whoever is wise will remember these things     and begin to understand the Lord’s faithful love. and begin to understand the Lord’s faithful love.
Psalms-108-1: A praise song of David. 108 God, I am ready, heart and soul, 108 God, I am ready, heart and soul,     to sing songs of praise. to sing songs of praise. Wake up, my soul!
Psalms-108-2: 2     Harps and lyres, wake up, 2     Harps and lyres, wake up,     and let’s wake the dawn! and let’s wake the dawn!
Psalms-108-3: 3 Lord, I will praise you before all people.     I will sing praises about you to every nation. I will sing praises about you to every nation.
Psalms-108-4: 4 Your faithful love is higher     than the highest clouds in the sky! than the highest clouds in the sky!
Psalms-108-5: 5 Rise above the heavens, God.     Let all the world see your glory. Let all the world see your glory.
Psalms-108-6: 6 Use your great power and help us!     Answer my prayer and save the people you love. Answer my prayer and save the people you love.
Psalms-108-7: 7 God has made this promise in his Temple[a]:     “I will win the war and rejoice in victory! “I will win the war and rejoice in victory! I will divide this land among my people.     I will give them Shechem. I will give them Shechem.     I will give them Succoth Valley. I will give them Succoth Valley.
Psalms-108-8: 8 Gilead and Manasseh will be mine.     Ephraim will be my helmet. Ephraim will be my helmet.     Judah will be my royal scepter. Judah will be my royal scepter.
Psalms-108-9: 9 Moab will be the bowl for washing my feet.     Edom will be the slave who carries my sandals. Edom will be the slave who carries my sandals.     I will defeat the Philistines and shout in victory!” I will defeat the Philistines and shout in victory!”
Psalms-108-10-Ps-108-11: 10-11 But, God, it seems that you have left us!     You do not go out with our army. You do not go out with our army. So who will lead me into the strong, protected city?     Who will lead me into battle against Edom? Who will lead me into battle against Edom?
Psalms-108-12: 12 Help us defeat the enemy!     No one on earth can rescue us. No one on earth can rescue us.
Psalms-108-13: 13 Only God can make us strong.     Only God can defeat our enemies! Only God can defeat our enemies!
Psalms-109-1: To the director: A praise song of David. 109 God, I praise you! 109 God, I praise you!     Hear my prayer and do something! Hear my prayer and do something!
Psalms-109-2: 2 Wicked people are telling lies about me.     They are saying things that are not true. They are saying things that are not true.
Psalms-109-3: 3 They are saying hateful things about me.     They are attacking me for no reason. They are attacking me for no reason.
Psalms-109-4: 4 I loved them, but they were against me.     So I said a prayer. So I said a prayer.
Psalms-109-5: 5 I did good things to them,     but they are doing bad things to me. but they are doing bad things to me. I loved them,     but they hated me. but they hated me.
Psalms-109-6: 6 They said, “Choose someone evil to represent him.     Let the one at his side really be his accuser. Let the one at his side really be his accuser.
Psalms-109-7: 7 Let even his prayer be used as evidence against him,     and let the court find him guilty. and let the court find him guilty.
Psalms-109-8: 8 Let his life be cut short,     and let someone else take over his work. and let someone else take over his work.
Psalms-109-9: 9 Let his children become orphans and his wife a widow.
Psalms-109-10: 10 Make his children wander around as beggars,     forced from homes that lie in ruins. forced from homes that lie in ruins.
Psalms-109-11: 11 Let the people he owes take everything he owns.     Let strangers get everything he worked for. Let strangers get everything he worked for.
Psalms-109-12: 12 Let no one be kind to him.     Let no one show mercy to his children. Let no one show mercy to his children.
Psalms-109-13: 13 May his family come to an end.     May his name be unknown to future generations. May his name be unknown to future generations.
Psalms-109-14: 14 May the Lord remember the sins of his father,     and may his mother’s sins never be erased. and may his mother’s sins never be erased.
Psalms-109-15: 15 May the Lord remember their sins forever,     and may he cause people to forget his family completely. and may he cause people to forget his family completely.
Psalms-109-16: 16 He never did anything good.     He never loved anyone. He never loved anyone.     He made life hard for the poor and the helpless. He made life hard for the poor and the helpless.
Psalms-109-17: 17 He loved to curse others,     so let those bad things happen to him. so let those bad things happen to him. He never blessed others,     so don’t let good things happen to him. so don’t let good things happen to him.
Psalms-109-18: 18 Cursing was a daily part of his life,     like the clothes he wears. like the clothes he wears. Cursing others became a part of him,     like the water he drinks and the oil he puts on his body. like the water he drinks and the oil he puts on his body.
Psalms-109-19: 19 So let curses cover him like the robe he wears     and always surround him like a belt.” and always surround him like a belt.”
Psalms-109-20: 20 My enemies said these evil things against me.     But may those curses be the way the Lord punishes them. But may those curses be the way the Lord punishes them.
Psalms-109-21: 21 My Lord God, treat me in a way that brings honor to your name.     Save me because of your faithful love. Save me because of your faithful love.
Psalms-109-22: 22 I am only a poor, helpless man.     I am so sad; my heart is broken. I am so sad; my heart is broken.
Psalms-109-23: 23 I feel my life is over, fading like a shadow at day’s end.     I feel like a bug that someone brushed away. I feel like a bug that someone brushed away.
Psalms-109-24: 24 My knees are weak from fasting.     I have lost weight and become thin. I have lost weight and become thin.
Psalms-109-25: 25 My enemies insult me.     They look at me and shake their heads. They look at me and shake their heads.
Psalms-109-26: 26 Lord my God, help me!     Show your faithful love and save me! Show your faithful love and save me!
Psalms-109-27: 27 Then they will know that you did it.     They will know that it was your power, Lord, that helped me. They will know that it was your power, Lord, that helped me.
Psalms-109-28: 28 They curse me, but you can bless me.     They attacked me, so defeat them. They attacked me, so defeat them.     Then I, your servant, will be happy. Then I, your servant, will be happy.
Psalms-109-29: 29 Humiliate my enemies!     Let them wear their shame like a coat. Let them wear their shame like a coat.
Psalms-109-30: 30 I give thanks to the Lord.     I praise him in front of everyone. I praise him in front of everyone.
Psalms-109-31: 31 He stands by the helpless     and saves them from those who try to put them to death. and saves them from those who try to put them to death.
Psalms-110-1: A praise song of David. 110 The Lord said to my lord,[a] 110 The Lord said to my lord,[a]     “Sit at my right side, while I put your enemies under your control.” “Sit at my right side, while I put your enemies under your control.”
Psalms-110-2: 2 The Lord will cause your kingdom to grow, beginning at Zion,     until you rule the lands of your enemies! until you rule the lands of your enemies!
Psalms-110-3: 3 Your people will gladly join you     when you gather your army together. when you gather your army together. You will wear your special clothes     and meet together early in the morning. and meet together early in the morning. Your young men will be all around you     like dew on the ground.[b] like dew on the ground.[b]
Psalms-110-4: 4 The Lord has made a promise with an oath     and will not change his mind: and will not change his mind: “You are a priest forever—     the kind of priest Melchizedek was.” the kind of priest Melchizedek was.”
Psalms-110-5: 5 My Lord is at your right side.     He will defeat the other kings when he becomes angry. He will defeat the other kings when he becomes angry.
Psalms-110-6: 6 He will judge the nations.     The ground will be covered with dead bodies. The ground will be covered with dead bodies.     He will punish the leaders of powerful nations all around the world. He will punish the leaders of powerful nations all around the world.
Psalms-110-7: 7 The king will drink from a stream on the way.     Then he will lift his head and become strong![c] Then he will lift his head and become strong![c]
Psalms-111-1: 111 [a] Praise the Lord! 111 [a] Praise the Lord! I thank the Lord with all my heart     in the assembly of his good people. in the assembly of his good people.
Psalms-111-2: 2 The Lord does wonderful things,     more than anyone could ask for.[b] more than anyone could ask for.[b]
Psalms-111-3: 3 The things he does are great and glorious!     There is no end to his goodness. There is no end to his goodness.
Psalms-111-4: 4 He does amazing things so that we will remember     that the Lord is kind and merciful. that the Lord is kind and merciful.
Psalms-111-5: 5 He gives food to his followers.     He remembers his agreement forever. He remembers his agreement forever.
Psalms-111-6: 6 He has shown his people how powerful he is     by giving them the land of other nations. by giving them the land of other nations.
Psalms-111-7: 7 Everything he does is good and fair.     All his commands can be trusted. All his commands can be trusted.
Psalms-111-8: 8 His commands will continue forever.     They must be done with truth and honesty. They must be done with truth and honesty.
Psalms-111-9: 9 He rescued his people and made his agreement with them forever.     His name is awesome and holy. His name is awesome and holy.
Psalms-111-10: 10 Wisdom begins with fear and respect for the Lord.     Those who obey him are very wise. Those who obey him are very wise.     Praises will be sung to him forever. Praises will be sung to him forever.
Psalms-112-1: 112 [a] Praise the Lord! 112 [a] Praise the Lord! Great blessings belong to those who fear and respect the Lord,     who are happy to do what he commands. who are happy to do what he commands.
Psalms-112-2: 2 Their descendants will be given power on earth.     Those who do right will be greatly blessed. Those who do right will be greatly blessed.
Psalms-112-3: 3 Their family will be very rich,     and their goodness will continue forever. and their goodness will continue forever.
Psalms-112-4: 4 A light shines in the dark for those who are good,     for those who are merciful, kind, and fair. for those who are merciful, kind, and fair.
Psalms-112-5: 5 It is good for people to be kind and generous     and to be fair in business. and to be fair in business.
Psalms-112-6: 6 Such good people will never fall.     They will always be remembered. They will always be remembered.
Psalms-112-7: 7 They will not be afraid of bad news.     They are confident because they trust in the Lord. They are confident because they trust in the Lord.
Psalms-112-8: 8 They remain confident and without fear,     so they defeat their enemies. so they defeat their enemies.
Psalms-112-9: 9 They freely give to the poor.     Their goodness will continue forever. Their goodness will continue forever.     They will be honored with victory. They will be honored with victory.
Psalms-112-10: 10 The wicked become angry when they see this.     They grind their teeth in anger, but then they disappear. They grind their teeth in anger, but then they disappear.     They will never get what they want most. They will never get what they want most.
Psalms-113-1: 113 Praise the Lord! 113 Praise the Lord! Servants of the Lord, praise him!     Praise the Lord’s name. Praise the Lord’s name.
Psalms-113-2: 2 May the Lord’s name be praised     now and forever. now and forever.
Psalms-113-3: 3 May the Lord’s name be praised     from where the sun rises to where it goes down. from where the sun rises to where it goes down.
Psalms-113-4: 4 The Lord is higher than all nations.     His glory rises to the skies. His glory rises to the skies.
Psalms-113-5: 5 There is no one like the Lord our God.     He sits on his throne high in heaven. He sits on his throne high in heaven.
Psalms-113-6: 6 He is so high above us that he must look down     to see the sky and the earth. to see the sky and the earth.
Psalms-113-7: 7 He lifts the poor out of the dirt     and rescues beggars from the garbage dump. and rescues beggars from the garbage dump.
Psalms-113-8: 8 He puts them in important positions,     giving them a place among the leaders of his people. giving them a place among the leaders of his people.
Psalms-113-9: 9 He gives children to the woman whose home is empty.     He makes her a happy mother. He makes her a happy mother. Praise the Lord!
Psalms-114-1: 114 The people of Israel escaped from Egypt. 114 The people of Israel escaped from Egypt.     Yes, Jacob’s descendants left that foreign country. Yes, Jacob’s descendants left that foreign country.
Psalms-114-2: 2 Then Judah became God’s special people,     and Israel became his kingdom. and Israel became his kingdom.
Psalms-114-3: 3 The Red Sea saw this and ran away.     The Jordan River turned and ran. The Jordan River turned and ran.
Psalms-114-4: 4 The mountains danced like rams.     The hills danced like lambs. The hills danced like lambs.
Psalms-114-5: 5 Red Sea, why did you run away?     Jordan River, why did you turn and run away? Jordan River, why did you turn and run away?
Psalms-114-6: 6 Mountains, why did you dance like rams?     Hills, why did you dance like lambs? Hills, why did you dance like lambs?
Psalms-114-7: 7 The earth shook in front of the Lord,     the God of Jacob. the God of Jacob.
Psalms-114-8: 8 He is the one who caused water to flow from a rock.     He made a spring of water flow from that hard rock. He made a spring of water flow from that hard rock.
Psalms-115-1: 115 Lord, you should receive the honor, not us. 115 Lord, you should receive the honor, not us.     The honor belongs to you The honor belongs to you     because of your faithful love and loyalty. because of your faithful love and loyalty.
Psalms-115-2: 2 Why should the nations wonder     where our God is? where our God is?
Psalms-115-3: 3 Our God is in heaven,     and he does whatever he wants. and he does whatever he wants.
Psalms-115-4: 4 The “gods” of those nations are only statues     that some human made from gold and silver. that some human made from gold and silver.
Psalms-115-5: 5 Those statues have mouths, but cannot talk.     They have eyes, but cannot see. They have eyes, but cannot see.
Psalms-115-6: 6 They have ears, but cannot hear.     They have noses, but cannot smell. They have noses, but cannot smell.
Psalms-115-7: 7 They have hands, but cannot feel.     They have feet, but cannot walk. They have feet, but cannot walk.     No sounds come from their throats. No sounds come from their throats.
Psalms-115-8: 8 The people who make and trust in those statues     will become like them! will become like them!
Psalms-115-9: 9 People of Israel, trust in the Lord!     He is your strength and shield. He is your strength and shield.
Psalms-115-10: 10 Aaron’s family, trust in the Lord!     He is your strength and shield. He is your strength and shield.
Psalms-115-11: 11 Followers of the Lord, trust in the Lord!     He is your strength and shield. He is your strength and shield.
Psalms-115-12: 12 The Lord remembers us.     He will bless us. He will bless us. He will bless Israel.     He will bless Aaron’s family. He will bless Aaron’s family.
Psalms-115-13: 13 The Lord will bless his followers,     great and small. great and small.
Psalms-115-14: 14 May the Lord give more and more to you     and to your children. and to your children.
Psalms-115-15: 15 May you receive blessings from the Lord,[a]     who made heaven and earth. who made heaven and earth.
Psalms-115-16: 16 Heaven belongs to the Lord,     but he gave the earth to people. but he gave the earth to people.
Psalms-115-17: 17 The dead don’t praise him.     Those in the grave don’t praise the Lord. Those in the grave don’t praise the Lord.
Psalms-115-18: 18 But we will praise the Lord     now and forever! now and forever! Praise the Lord!
Psalms-116-1: 116 I love the Lord for hearing me, 116 I love the Lord for hearing me,     for listening to my prayers. for listening to my prayers.
Psalms-116-2: 2 Yes, he paid attention to me,     so I will always call to him whenever I need help. so I will always call to him whenever I need help.
Psalms-116-3: 3 Death’s ropes were around me.     The grave was closing in on me. The grave was closing in on me.     I was worried and afraid. I was worried and afraid.
Psalms-116-4: 4 Then I called on the Lord’s name.     I said, “Lord, save me!” I said, “Lord, save me!”
Psalms-116-5: 5 The Lord is good and merciful;     our God is so kind. our God is so kind.
Psalms-116-6: 6 The Lord takes care of helpless people.     I was without help, and he saved me. I was without help, and he saved me.
Psalms-116-7: 7 My soul, relax!     The Lord is caring for you. The Lord is caring for you.
Psalms-116-8: 8 Lord, you saved my soul from death.     You stopped my tears. You stopped my tears.     You kept me from falling. You kept me from falling.
Psalms-116-9: 9 I will continue to serve the Lord     in the land of the living. in the land of the living.
Psalms-116-10: 10 I continued believing even when I said,     “I am completely ruined!” “I am completely ruined!”
Psalms-116-11: 11 Yes, even when I was upset and said,     “There is no one I can trust!” “There is no one I can trust!”
Psalms-116-12: 12 What can I give the Lord     for all that he has done for me? for all that he has done for me?
Psalms-116-13: 13 He saved me,     so I will give him a drink offering, so I will give him a drink offering,     and I will call on the Lord’s name. and I will call on the Lord’s name.
Psalms-116-14: 14 I will give the Lord what I promised.     I will go in front of all his people now. I will go in front of all his people now.
Psalms-116-15: 15 Very dear to the Lord are the lives of his followers.     He cares when they face death. He cares when they face death.
Psalms-116-16: 16 Lord, I am your servant!     Yes, I am your slave, as my mother was. Yes, I am your slave, as my mother was.     You set me free from the chains of death. You set me free from the chains of death.
Psalms-116-17: 17 I will give you a thank offering.     I will call on the Lord’s name. I will call on the Lord’s name.
Psalms-116-18: 18 I will stand before the gathering of his people     and give the Lord what I promised. and give the Lord what I promised.
Psalms-116-19: 19 I will do this in Jerusalem,     in the courtyards of the Lord’s Temple. in the courtyards of the Lord’s Temple. Praise the Lord!
Psalms-117-1: 117 Praise the Lord, all you nations. 117 Praise the Lord, all you nations.     Praise him, all you people. Praise him, all you people.
Psalms-117-2: 2 He loves us very much!     The Lord will be faithful to us forever! The Lord will be faithful to us forever! Praise the Lord!
Psalms-118-1: 118 Praise the Lord because he is good! 118 Praise the Lord because he is good!     His faithful love will last forever! His faithful love will last forever!
Psalms-118-2: 2 Israel, say it:     “His faithful love will last forever!” “His faithful love will last forever!”
Psalms-118-3: 3 Aaron’s family,[a] say it:     “His faithful love will last forever!” “His faithful love will last forever!”
Psalms-118-4: 4 You people worshiping the Lord, say it:     “His faithful love will last forever!” “His faithful love will last forever!”
Psalms-118-5: 5 I was in trouble, so I called to the Lord for help.     The Lord answered and made me free. The Lord answered and made me free.
Psalms-118-6: 6 The Lord is with me, so I will not be afraid.     No one on earth can do anything to harm me. No one on earth can do anything to harm me.
Psalms-118-7: 7 The Lord is my helper.     I will see my enemies defeated. I will see my enemies defeated.
Psalms-118-8: 8 It is better to trust in the Lord     than to trust in people. than to trust in people.
Psalms-118-9: 9 It is better to trust in the Lord     than to trust in great leaders. than to trust in great leaders.
Psalms-118-10: 10 Many enemies surrounded me,     but with the Lord’s power I defeated them. but with the Lord’s power I defeated them.
Psalms-118-11: 11 They surrounded me again and again,     but I defeated them with the Lord’s power. but I defeated them with the Lord’s power.
Psalms-118-12: 12 They surrounded me like a swarm of bees,     but they were quickly destroyed like a fast-burning bush. but they were quickly destroyed like a fast-burning bush.     I defeated them with the Lord’s power. I defeated them with the Lord’s power.
