Psalms-118-13: 13 My enemy attacked me and almost destroyed me,     but the Lord helped me. but the Lord helped me.
Psalms-118-14: 14 The Lord is my strength and my reason for singing.[b]     He saved me! He saved me!
Psalms-118-15: 15 You can hear the victory celebration in the homes of those who live right.     The Lord has shown his great power again! The Lord has shown his great power again!
Psalms-118-16: 16 The Lord’s arm is raised in victory.     The Lord has shown his great power again. The Lord has shown his great power again.
Psalms-118-17: 17 I will live and not die,     and I will tell what the Lord has done. and I will tell what the Lord has done.
Psalms-118-18: 18 The Lord punished me,     but he did not let me die. but he did not let me die.
Psalms-118-19: 19 Gates of goodness, open for me,     and I will come in and worship the Lord. and I will come in and worship the Lord.
Psalms-118-20: 20 Those are the Lord’s gates,     and only good people can go through them. and only good people can go through them.
Psalms-118-21: 21 Lord, I thank you for answering my prayer.     I thank you for saving me. I thank you for saving me.
Psalms-118-22: 22 The stone that the builders rejected     became the cornerstone. became the cornerstone.
Psalms-118-23: 23 The Lord made this happen,     and we think it is wonderful! and we think it is wonderful!
Psalms-118-24: 24 This is the day the Lord has made.     Let us rejoice and be happy today! Let us rejoice and be happy today!
Psalms-118-25: 25 The people say, “Praise the Lord!     The Lord saved us![c] The Lord saved us![c]
Psalms-118-26: 26 Welcome to the one who comes in the name of the Lord.”     The priests answer, “We welcome you to the Lord’s house! The priests answer, “We welcome you to the Lord’s house!
Psalms-118-27: 27 The Lord is God, and he accepts us.     Tie up the lamb for the sacrifice and carry it to the horns of the altar.” Tie up the lamb for the sacrifice and carry it to the horns of the altar.”
Psalms-118-28: 28 Lord, you are my God, and I thank you.     My God, I praise you! My God, I praise you!
Psalms-118-29: 29 Praise the Lord because he is good.     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-119-1: Aleph[a] 119 Great blessings belong to those who live pure lives! 119 Great blessings belong to those who live pure lives!     They follow the Lord’s teachings. They follow the Lord’s teachings.
Psalms-119-2: 2 Great blessings belong to those who follow his rules!     They seek him with all their heart. They seek him with all their heart.
Psalms-119-3: 3 They don’t do wrong.     They follow his ways. They follow his ways.
Psalms-119-4: 4 Lord, you gave us your instructions     and told us to always obey them. and told us to always obey them.
Psalms-119-5: 5 How I wish I could be more faithful     in obeying your laws! in obeying your laws!
Psalms-119-6: 6 Then I would never feel ashamed     when I look closely at your commands. when I look closely at your commands.
Psalms-119-7: 7 The more I understand how fair your laws are,     the more sincerely I will praise you. the more sincerely I will praise you.
Psalms-119-8: 8 I will obey your laws,     so please don’t leave me! so please don’t leave me!
Psalms-119-9: Beth 9 How can a young person live a pure life?     By obeying your word. By obeying your word.
Psalms-119-10: 10 I try with all my heart to serve you.     Help me obey your commands. Help me obey your commands.
Psalms-119-11: 11 I study your teachings very carefully     so that I will not sin against you. so that I will not sin against you.
Psalms-119-12: 12 Lord, you are worthy of praise!     Teach me your laws. Teach me your laws.
Psalms-119-13: 13 I will repeat the laws we have heard from you.
Psalms-119-14: 14 I enjoy following your rules     as much as others enjoy great riches. as much as others enjoy great riches.
Psalms-119-15: 15 I will study your instructions.     I will give thought to your way of life. I will give thought to your way of life.
Psalms-119-16: 16 I enjoy your laws.     I will not forget your word. I will not forget your word.
Psalms-119-17: Gimel 17 Be good to me, your servant,     so that I may live to obey your word. so that I may live to obey your word.
Psalms-119-18: 18 Open my eyes so that I can see     all the wonderful things in your teachings. all the wonderful things in your teachings.
Psalms-119-19: 19 I feel like a stranger visiting here on earth.     I need to know your commands. I need to know your commands.     Don’t keep them hidden from me. Don’t keep them hidden from me.
Psalms-119-20: 20 I constantly feel a hunger     to understand your laws. to understand your laws.
Psalms-119-21: 21 You tell the proud how angry you are with them.     All those who refuse to obey your word are cursed. All those who refuse to obey your word are cursed.
Psalms-119-22: 22 Don’t let me be ashamed and embarrassed.     I have obeyed your rules. I have obeyed your rules.
Psalms-119-23: 23 Even if rulers say bad things about me,     I am your servant, I am your servant,     and I continue to study your laws. and I continue to study your laws.
Psalms-119-24: 24 Your rules make me happy.     They give me good advice. They give me good advice.
Psalms-119-25: Daleth 25 I lie here like a dying man.     Say the word, and I will live again.[b] Say the word, and I will live again.[b]
Psalms-119-26: 26 I told you about my life, and you answered me.     Now, teach me your laws. Now, teach me your laws.
Psalms-119-27: 27 Help me understand your instructions,     and I will think about your wonderful teachings.[c] and I will think about your wonderful teachings.[c]
Psalms-119-28: 28 I am sad and tired.     Say the word, and make me strong again. Say the word, and make me strong again.
Psalms-119-29: 29 Don’t let me live a lie.     Guide me with your teachings. Guide me with your teachings.
Psalms-119-30: 30 I have chosen to be loyal to you.     I respect your laws. I respect your laws.
Psalms-119-31: 31 I follow your rules closely, Lord.     Don’t let me be put to shame. Don’t let me be put to shame.
Psalms-119-32: 32 I do my best to follow your commands,     because you are the one who gives me the desire. because you are the one who gives me the desire.
Psalms-119-33: He 33 Lord, teach me your laws,     and I will always follow them. and I will always follow them.
Psalms-119-34: 34 Help me understand your teachings,     and I will follow them. and I will follow them.     Obeying them will be my greatest desire. Obeying them will be my greatest desire.
Psalms-119-35: 35 Help me follow your commands,     because that makes me happy. because that makes me happy.
Psalms-119-36: 36 Give me the desire to follow your rules,     not the desire to get rich. not the desire to get rich.
Psalms-119-37: 37 Don’t let me look at worthless things.     Help me live your way. Help me live your way.
Psalms-119-38: 38 Do what you promised me, your servant,     so that people will respect you. so that people will respect you.
Psalms-119-39: 39 Take away the shame I fear.     Your laws are good. Your laws are good.
Psalms-119-40: 40 See how much I want to obey your instructions!     Be good to me, and let me live. Be good to me, and let me live.
Psalms-119-41: Waw 41 Lord, show me your faithful love.     Save me, as you promised. Save me, as you promised.
Psalms-119-42: 42 Then I will have an answer for those who make fun of me     for trusting what you say. for trusting what you say.
Psalms-119-43: 43 Let me always say what is true.     I depend on your judgment to be fair. I depend on your judgment to be fair.
Psalms-119-44: 44 I will follow your teachings forever and ever.
Psalms-119-45: 45 So I will live in freedom,     because I do my best to know your instructions. because I do my best to know your instructions.
Psalms-119-46: 46 I will discuss your rules with kings,     and no one will embarrass me. and no one will embarrass me.
Psalms-119-47: 47 What joy your commands give me!     How I love them! How I love them!
Psalms-119-48: 48 Not only do I love your commands, but I also honor them.     I will study your laws. I will study your laws.
Psalms-119-49: Zain 49 Remember your promise to me, your servant.     It gives me hope. It gives me hope.
Psalms-119-50: 50 You comfort me in my suffering,     because your promise gives me new life. because your promise gives me new life.
Psalms-119-51: 51 People full of pride are always making fun of me,     but I have not stopped following your teachings. but I have not stopped following your teachings.
Psalms-119-52: 52 I remember the laws you gave us long ago, Lord,     and they bring me comfort. and they bring me comfort.
Psalms-119-53: 53 I am overcome with anger when I see wicked people,     who have stopped following your teachings. who have stopped following your teachings.
Psalms-119-54: 54 Your laws are the songs I sing     wherever I am living. wherever I am living.
Psalms-119-55: 55 Lord, in the night I remembered your name,     and I obeyed your teachings. and I obeyed your teachings.
Psalms-119-56: 56 This happened because I carefully obey your instructions.
Psalms-119-57: Heth 57 Lord, I decided that my duty is to obey your commandments.
Psalms-119-58: 58 I beg you with all my heart,     be kind to me, as you promised. be kind to me, as you promised.
Psalms-119-59: 59 I thought very carefully about my life,     and I decided to follow your rules. and I decided to follow your rules.
Psalms-119-60: 60 Without wasting any time,     I hurried back to obey your commands. I hurried back to obey your commands.
Psalms-119-61: 61 The wicked tried to trap me,     but I have not forgotten your teachings. but I have not forgotten your teachings.
Psalms-119-62: 62 In the middle of the night, I get up to thank you     because your laws are so fair. because your laws are so fair.
Psalms-119-63: 63 I am a friend to everyone who worships you.     I am a friend to everyone who obeys your instructions. I am a friend to everyone who obeys your instructions.
Psalms-119-64: 64 Lord, your faithful love fills the earth.     Teach me your laws. Teach me your laws.
Psalms-119-65: Teth 65 Lord, you did good things for me, your servant.     You did what you promised to do. You did what you promised to do.
Psalms-119-66: 66 Give me the knowledge to make wise decisions.     I trust your commands. I trust your commands.
Psalms-119-67: 67 Before I suffered, I did many wrong things.     But now I carefully obey everything you say. But now I carefully obey everything you say.
Psalms-119-68: 68 You are good, and you do good things.     Teach me your laws. Teach me your laws.
Psalms-119-69: 69 People full of pride made up lies about me.     But I keep obeying your instructions with all my heart. But I keep obeying your instructions with all my heart.
Psalms-119-70: 70 Those people are so stupid that they care for nothing,     but I enjoy studying your teachings. but I enjoy studying your teachings.
Psalms-119-71: 71 Suffering was good for me;     I learned your laws. I learned your laws.
Psalms-119-72: 72 Your teachings are worth more to me     than a thousand pieces of silver and gold. than a thousand pieces of silver and gold.
Psalms-119-73: Yod 73 With your hands you made me and helped me become what I am.     Now help me learn and understand your commands. Now help me learn and understand your commands.
Psalms-119-74: 74 Your followers will see me and be happy,     because I trust in your word. because I trust in your word.
Psalms-119-75: 75 Lord, I know that your decisions are fair,     and you were right to punish me. and you were right to punish me.
Psalms-119-76: 76 Now comfort me with your faithful love,     as you promised. as you promised.
Psalms-119-77: 77 Comfort me and let me live.     I enjoy your teachings. I enjoy your teachings.
Psalms-119-78: 78 Bring shame on those proud people who lied about me.     All I want to do is study your instructions. All I want to do is study your instructions.
Psalms-119-79: 79 Let your followers come back to me     so that they may learn your rules. so that they may learn your rules.
Psalms-119-80: 80 Let me obey your laws perfectly     so that I will not be ashamed. so that I will not be ashamed.
Psalms-119-81: Kaph 81 I feel weaker and weaker as I wait for you to save me.     But I put my trust in your word. But I put my trust in your word.
Psalms-119-82: 82 I keep looking for what you promised, but my eyes are feeling tired.     When will you comfort me? When will you comfort me?
Psalms-119-83: 83 Even when I am like a dried wineskin on the trash pile,     I will not forget your laws. I will not forget your laws.
Psalms-119-84: 84 How long must I wait for you     to punish those who persecute me? to punish those who persecute me?
Psalms-119-85: 85 Proud people have tried to trap me     and make me disobey your teachings. and make me disobey your teachings.
Psalms-119-86: 86 All your commands can be trusted.     Those people are wrong to persecute me. Those people are wrong to persecute me.     Help me! Help me!
Psalms-119-87: 87 They have almost destroyed me,     but I have not stopped obeying your instructions. but I have not stopped obeying your instructions.
Psalms-119-88: 88 Show me your faithful love and let me live.     I will do whatever you say. I will do whatever you say.
Psalms-119-89: Lamedh 89 Lord, your word continues forever in heaven.
Psalms-119-90: 90 You are loyal forever and ever.     You made the earth, and it still stands. You made the earth, and it still stands.
Psalms-119-91: 91 All things continue today because of your laws.     Like slaves, they all obey you. Like slaves, they all obey you.
Psalms-119-92: 92 If I had not found joy in your teachings,     my suffering would have destroyed me. my suffering would have destroyed me.
Psalms-119-93: 93 I will never forget your commands,     because through them you gave me new life. because through them you gave me new life.
Psalms-119-94: 94 I am yours, so save me!     I have done my best to know your instructions. I have done my best to know your instructions.
Psalms-119-95: 95 The wicked tried to destroy me,     but your rules made me wise. but your rules made me wise.
Psalms-119-96: 96 Everything has its limits,     except your commands. except your commands.
Psalms-119-97: Mem 97 Oh, how I love your teachings!     I talk about them all the time. I talk about them all the time.
Psalms-119-98: 98 Your commands are always with me,     and they make me wiser than my enemies. and they make me wiser than my enemies.
Psalms-119-99: 99 I am wiser than all my teachers,     because I study your rules. because I study your rules.
Psalms-119-100: 100 I understand more than those who are older,     because I obey your instructions. because I obey your instructions.
Psalms-119-101: 101 I have avoided every path that leads to evil     so that I could obey your word. so that I could obey your word.
Psalms-119-102: 102 You are my teacher,     so I will always do whatever you decide. so I will always do whatever you decide.
Psalms-119-103: 103 Your words are so sweet to me,     like the taste of honey! like the taste of honey!
Psalms-119-104: 104 I gain understanding from your instructions,     so I hate anything that leads people the wrong way. so I hate anything that leads people the wrong way.
Psalms-119-105: Nun 105 Your word is like a lamp that guides my steps,     a light that shows the path I should take. a light that shows the path I should take.
Psalms-119-106: 106 Your laws are good and fair.     I have promised to obey them, and I will keep my promise. I have promised to obey them, and I will keep my promise.
Psalms-119-107: 107 Lord, I have suffered for a long time.     Say the word, and I will live again![d] Say the word, and I will live again![d]
Psalms-119-108: 108 Lord, accept the praise I want to give you,     and teach me your laws. and teach me your laws.
Psalms-119-109: 109 My life is always in danger,     but I have not forgotten your teachings. but I have not forgotten your teachings.
Psalms-119-110: 110 The wicked try to trap me,     but I have not disobeyed your instructions. but I have not disobeyed your instructions.
Psalms-119-111: 111 The rules you have given me to follow will be mine forever.     They give me great joy. They give me great joy.
Psalms-119-112: 112 More than anything I want to obey your laws always,     until the end of my life. until the end of my life.
Psalms-119-113: Samekh 113 Lord, I hate those who are not completely loyal to you,     but I love your teachings. but I love your teachings.
Psalms-119-114: 114 Hide me and protect me.     I trust what you say. I trust what you say.
Psalms-119-115: 115 Don’t come near me, you who are evil,     so that I can obey my God’s commands. so that I can obey my God’s commands.
Psalms-119-116: 116 Support me, Lord, as you promised, and I will live.     I trust in you, so don’t disappoint me. I trust in you, so don’t disappoint me.
Psalms-119-117: 117 Help me and I will be saved.     And I will always give attention to your laws. And I will always give attention to your laws.
Psalms-119-118: 118 You reject all who don’t obey your laws,     because they are liars and did not do what they said. because they are liars and did not do what they said.
Psalms-119-119: 119 You throw away the wicked of this world like trash.     So I love your rules. So I love your rules.
Psalms-119-120: 120 I am shaking with fear before you.     I fear and respect your judgments. I fear and respect your judgments.
Psalms-119-121: Ain 121 I have done what is right and good.     Don’t let me fall into the hands of those who want to hurt me. Don’t let me fall into the hands of those who want to hurt me.
Psalms-119-122: 122 Promise to be good to me, your servant.     Don’t let those proud people do harm to me. Don’t let those proud people do harm to me.
Psalms-119-123: 123 I have worn out my eyes looking for your help,     waiting for you to save me, as you promised. waiting for you to save me, as you promised.
Psalms-119-124: 124 Show your faithful love to me, your servant.     Teach me your laws. Teach me your laws.
Psalms-119-125: 125 I am your servant.     Give me wisdom to understand your rules. Give me wisdom to understand your rules.
Psalms-119-126: 126 Lord, it is time for you to do something.     The people do what is against your teachings. The people do what is against your teachings.
Psalms-119-127: 127 I love your commands more than gold,     more than the purest gold. more than the purest gold.
Psalms-119-128: 128 I carefully obey all your commands.     So I hate anything that leads people the wrong way. So I hate anything that leads people the wrong way.
Psalms-119-129: Pe 129 Lord, your rules are wonderful.     That is why I follow them. That is why I follow them.
Psalms-119-130: 130 As people understand your word, it brings light to their lives.     Your word makes even simple people wise. Your word makes even simple people wise.
Psalms-119-131: 131 My desire to hear your commands is so strong     that I wait with open mouth, gasping for breath. that I wait with open mouth, gasping for breath.
Psalms-119-132: 132 Look at me, and be kind to me,     just as you always are to those who love your name. just as you always are to those who love your name.
Psalms-119-133: 133 Guide me, as you promised.     Don’t let evil rule over me. Don’t let evil rule over me.
Psalms-119-134: 134 Save me from those who want to hurt me,     and I will obey your instructions. and I will obey your instructions.
Psalms-119-135: 135 Accept your servant,     and teach me your laws. and teach me your laws.
Psalms-119-136: 136 I have cried a river of tears     because people don’t obey your teachings. because people don’t obey your teachings.
Psalms-119-137: Tsadhe 137 Lord, you do what is right,     and your decisions are fair. and your decisions are fair.
Psalms-119-138: 138 The rules you have given us are right.     We can trust them completely. We can trust them completely.
Psalms-119-139: 139 Something that really upsets me is the thought     that my enemies ignore your commands. that my enemies ignore your commands.
Psalms-119-140: 140 I love your word.     Time and again it has been proven true. Time and again it has been proven true.
Psalms-119-141: 141 I am young, and people don’t respect me.     But I have not forgotten your instructions. But I have not forgotten your instructions.
Psalms-119-142: 142 Your goodness is forever,     and your teachings can be trusted. and your teachings can be trusted.
Psalms-119-143: 143 Even though I have troubles and hard times,     your commands give me joy. your commands give me joy.
Psalms-119-144: 144 Your rules are always right.     Help me understand them so that I can live. Help me understand them so that I can live.
Psalms-119-145: Qoph 145 Lord, I call to you with all my heart.     Answer me, and I will obey your laws. Answer me, and I will obey your laws.
Psalms-119-146: 146 I call to you.     Save me, and I will obey your rules. Save me, and I will obey your rules.
Psalms-119-147: 147 I get up early in the morning to pray to you.     I trust what you say. I trust what you say.
Psalms-119-148: 148 Late into the night I stay awake     to think about your word. to think about your word.
Psalms-119-149: 149 I know your love is true, so listen to me.     Lord, you always do what is right, so let me live. Lord, you always do what is right, so let me live.
Psalms-119-150: 150 Here come those who have evil plans to hurt me.     They live far away from your teachings. They live far away from your teachings.
Psalms-119-151: 151 But you are near me, Lord,     and all your commands can be trusted. and all your commands can be trusted.
Psalms-119-152: 152 Long ago, I learned from your rules     that you made them to last forever. that you made them to last forever.
Psalms-119-153: Resh 153 Look at my suffering and rescue me.     I have not forgotten your teachings. I have not forgotten your teachings.
Psalms-119-154: 154 Argue my case, and set me free.     Let me live, as you promised. Let me live, as you promised.
Psalms-119-155: 155 The wicked have no hope of being saved,     because they don’t follow your laws. because they don’t follow your laws.
Psalms-119-156: 156 Lord, you are very kind.     You always do what is right, so let me live. You always do what is right, so let me live.
Psalms-119-157: 157 I have many enemies trying to hurt me,     but I have not stopped following your rules. but I have not stopped following your rules.
Psalms-119-158: 158 I look at those traitors and hate what I see,     because they refuse to do what you say. because they refuse to do what you say.
Psalms-119-159: 159 See how much I love your instructions!     Lord, I know your love is true, so let me live. Lord, I know your love is true, so let me live.
Psalms-119-160: 160 Every word you say can be trusted.     Your laws are fair and will last forever. Your laws are fair and will last forever.
Psalms-119-161: Shin 161 Powerful leaders attack me for no reason,     but the only thing I fear is your command. but the only thing I fear is your command.
Psalms-119-162: 162 Your word makes me happy,     like someone who has found a great treasure. like someone who has found a great treasure.
Psalms-119-163: 163 I hate lies; they make me sick!     But I love your teachings. But I love your teachings.
Psalms-119-164: 164 Seven times a day I praise you     because your laws are fair. because your laws are fair.
Psalms-119-165: 165 Those who love your teachings will find true peace.     Nothing can make them fall. Nothing can make them fall.
Psalms-119-166: 166 Lord, I am waiting for you to save me.     I obey your commands. I obey your commands.
Psalms-119-167: 167 I follow your rules.     I love them very much. I love them very much.
Psalms-119-168: 168 I obey all your instructions and rules,     because you know everything I do. because you know everything I do.
Psalms-119-169: Taw 169 Lord, listen to my cry for help.     Make me wise, as you promised. Make me wise, as you promised.
Psalms-119-170: 170 Listen to my prayer.     Save me, as you promised. Save me, as you promised.
Psalms-119-171: 171 I will burst into songs of praise,     because you have taught me your laws. because you have taught me your laws.
Psalms-119-172: 172 Let my voice sing about your word,     because all your commands are good. because all your commands are good.
Psalms-119-173: 173 I have chosen to follow your instructions,     so reach out and help me! so reach out and help me!
Psalms-119-174: 174 Lord, I want you to save me.     Your teachings make me happy. Your teachings make me happy.
Psalms-119-175: 175 Let me live to praise you.     Let me find the help I need in your laws. Let me find the help I need in your laws.
Psalms-119-176: 176 I have wandered away like a lost sheep.     Come and find me. Come and find me. I am your servant,     and I have not forgotten your commands. and I have not forgotten your commands.
Psalms-120-1: A song for going up to the Temple. 120 I was in trouble. 120 I was in trouble.     I called to the Lord for help, I called to the Lord for help,     and he answered me! and he answered me!
Psalms-120-2: 2 I said, “Lord, save me from liars,     from those who say things that are not true.” from those who say things that are not true.”
Psalms-120-3: 3 Liars, do you know what the Lord has for you?     Do you know what you will get? Do you know what you will get?
Psalms-120-4: 4 You will get a soldier’s sharp arrow     and hot coals to punish you. and hot coals to punish you.
Psalms-120-5: 5 How I hate living here among these people!     It’s like living in Meshech or in the tents of Kedar.[a] It’s like living in Meshech or in the tents of Kedar.[a]
Psalms-120-6: 6 I have lived too long     with those who hate peace. with those who hate peace.
Psalms-120-7: 7 I ask for peace,     but they want war. but they want war.
Psalms-121-1: A song for going up to the Temple. 121 I look up to the hills, 121 I look up to the hills,     but where will my help really come from? but where will my help really come from?
Psalms-121-2: 2 My help will come from the Lord,     the Creator of heaven and earth. the Creator of heaven and earth.
Psalms-121-3: 3 He will not let you fall.     Your Protector will not fall asleep. Your Protector will not fall asleep.
Psalms-121-4: 4 Israel’s Protector does not get tired.     He never sleeps. He never sleeps.
Psalms-121-5: 5 The Lord is your Protector.     The Lord stands by your side, shading and protecting you. The Lord stands by your side, shading and protecting you.
Psalms-121-6: 6 The sun cannot harm you during the day,     and the moon cannot harm you at night. and the moon cannot harm you at night.
Psalms-121-7: 7 The Lord will protect you from every danger.     He will protect your soul. He will protect your soul.
Psalms-121-8: 8 The Lord will protect you as you come and go,[a]     both now and forever! both now and forever!
Psalms-122-1: A song of David for going up to the Temple. 122 I was happy when the people said, 122 I was happy when the people said,     “Let us go to the Lord’s Temple.” “Let us go to the Lord’s Temple.”
Psalms-122-2: 2 Here we are, standing at the gates of Jerusalem.
Psalms-122-3: 3 This is New Jerusalem!     The city has been rebuilt as one united city. The city has been rebuilt as one united city.
Psalms-122-4: 4 This is where the tribes come, the tribes who belong to the Lord.     The people of Israel come here to praise the Lord’s name. The people of Israel come here to praise the Lord’s name.
Psalms-122-5: 5 The kings from David’s family put their thrones here.     They set up their thrones to judge the people. They set up their thrones to judge the people.
Psalms-122-6: 6 Pray for peace in Jerusalem:     “May those who love you find peace. “May those who love you find peace.
Psalms-122-7: 7 May there be peace within your walls.     May there be safety in your great buildings.” May there be safety in your great buildings.”
Psalms-122-8: 8 For the good of my family and neighbors,     I pray that there will be peace here. I pray that there will be peace here.
Psalms-122-9: 9 For the good of the Temple of the Lord our God,     I pray that good things will happen to this city. I pray that good things will happen to this city.
Psalms-123-1: A song for going up to the Temple. 123 Lord, I look up and pray to you. 123 Lord, I look up and pray to you.     You sit as King in heaven. You sit as King in heaven.
Psalms-123-2: 2 A slave looks to his master to provide what he needs,     and a servant girl depends on the woman she serves. and a servant girl depends on the woman she serves. So we depend on the Lord our God,     waiting for him to have mercy on us. waiting for him to have mercy on us.
Psalms-123-3: 3 Lord, be merciful to us,     because we have been insulted much too long. because we have been insulted much too long.
Psalms-123-4: 4 We have had enough of the hateful words of those proud people     who make fun of us and show us no respect. who make fun of us and show us no respect.
Psalms-124-1: A song of David for going up to the Temple. 124 What would have happened to us if the Lord had not been on our side? 124 What would have happened to us if the Lord had not been on our side?     Tell us about it, Israel. Tell us about it, Israel.
Psalms-124-2: 2 What would have happened to us if the Lord had not been on our side     when people attacked us? when people attacked us?
Psalms-124-3: 3 They would have swallowed us alive     when they became angry with us. when they became angry with us.
Psalms-124-4: 4 Their armies would have been     like a flood washing over us, like a flood washing over us,     like a river drowning us. like a river drowning us.
Psalms-124-5: 5 Those proud people would have been     like water rising up to our mouth and drowning us. like water rising up to our mouth and drowning us.
Psalms-124-6: 6 Praise the Lord!     He did not let our enemies tear us apart. He did not let our enemies tear us apart.
Psalms-124-7: 7 We escaped like a bird from the net of a hunter.     The net broke, and we escaped! The net broke, and we escaped!
Psalms-124-8: 8 Our help came from the Lord,     the one who made heaven and earth! the one who made heaven and earth!
Psalms-125-1: A song for going up to the Temple. 125 Those who trust in the Lord are like Mount Zion. 125 Those who trust in the Lord are like Mount Zion.     They will never be shaken. They will never be shaken.     They will continue forever. They will continue forever.
Psalms-125-2: 2 Like the mountains that surround Jerusalem,     the Lord surrounds and protects his people now and forever. the Lord surrounds and protects his people now and forever.
Psalms-125-3: 3 The wicked will not always control the land of those who do right.     If they did, even those who do right might start doing wrong. If they did, even those who do right might start doing wrong.
Psalms-125-4: 4 Lord, be good to those who are good,     to those who have pure hearts. to those who have pure hearts.
Psalms-125-5: 5 But, Lord, when you punish those who do evil,     also punish those who have stopped following your way. also punish those who have stopped following your way. Let Israel always enjoy peace!
Psalms-126-1: A song for going up to the Temple. 126 It will be like a dream 126 It will be like a dream     when the Lord comes back with the captives of Zion.[a] when the Lord comes back with the captives of Zion.[a]
Psalms-126-2: 2 We will laugh and sing happy songs!     Then the other nations will say, Then the other nations will say,     “The Lord did a great thing for Zion!” “The Lord did a great thing for Zion!”
Psalms-126-3: 3 Yes, we will be happy     because the Lord did a great thing for us. because the Lord did a great thing for us.
Psalms-126-4: 4 So, Lord, bring back the good times,     like a desert stream filled again with flowing water. like a desert stream filled again with flowing water.
Psalms-126-5: 5 Then those who were sad when they planted     will be happy when they gather the harvest! will be happy when they gather the harvest!
Psalms-126-6: 6 Those who cried as they carried the seeds[b]     will be happy when they bring in the crops! will be happy when they bring in the crops!
Psalms-127-1: A song from Solomon for going up to the Temple. 127 If it is not the Lord who builds a house, 127 If it is not the Lord who builds a house,     the builders are wasting their time. the builders are wasting their time. If it is not the Lord who watches over the city,     the guards are wasting their time. the guards are wasting their time.
Psalms-127-2: 2 It is a waste of time to get up early and stay up late,     trying to make a living. trying to make a living. The Lord provides for those he loves,     even while they are sleeping. even while they are sleeping.
Psalms-127-3: 3 Children are a gift[a] from the Lord,     a reward from a mother’s womb. a reward from a mother’s womb.
Psalms-127-4: 4 A young man’s sons     are like the arrows in a soldier’s hand. are like the arrows in a soldier’s hand.
Psalms-127-5: 5 The man who fills his quiver with sons     will be very blessed. will be very blessed. He will never be defeated     when he opposes his enemy at the city gates.[b] when he opposes his enemy at the city gates.[b]
Psalms-128-1: A song for going up to the Temple. 128 Great blessings belong to those who fear and respect the Lord 128 Great blessings belong to those who fear and respect the Lord     and live the way he wants. and live the way he wants.
Psalms-128-2: 2 You will get what you work for.     You will enjoy the Lord’s blessings, and all will go well for you. You will enjoy the Lord’s blessings, and all will go well for you.
Psalms-128-3: 3 At home, your wife will have many children, like a vine full of grapes.     The children around your table will be like an orchard full of olive trees. The children around your table will be like an orchard full of olive trees.
Psalms-128-4: 4 Yes, the Lord will really bless those who respect him.
Psalms-128-5: 5 May the Lord bless you from Mount Zion.     May you enjoy the blessings of Jerusalem all your life. May you enjoy the blessings of Jerusalem all your life.
Psalms-128-6: 6 And may you live to see your grandchildren. Let Israel always enjoy peace!
Psalms-129-1: A song for going up to the Temple. 129 All my life enemies have attacked me. 129 All my life enemies have attacked me.     Say it again, Israel. Say it again, Israel.
Psalms-129-2: 2 All my life enemies have attacked me,     but they have never defeated me. but they have never defeated me.
Psalms-129-3: 3 They beat me until I had deep cuts.     My back looked like a freshly plowed field. My back looked like a freshly plowed field.
Psalms-129-4: 4 But the Lord does what is right;     he cut the ropes and set me free from those wicked people. he cut the ropes and set me free from those wicked people.
Psalms-129-5: 5 May those who hate Zion be put to shame.     May they be stopped and chased away. May they be stopped and chased away.
Psalms-129-6: 6 They will be like grass on a flat roof     that dies before it has time to grow. that dies before it has time to grow.
Psalms-129-7: 7 The one who goes to harvest it     will not find enough to cut and stack. will not find enough to cut and stack.
Psalms-129-8: 8 May no one walking by those wicked people ever say,     “May the Lord bless you! “May the Lord bless you!     We bless you in the name of the Lord.” We bless you in the name of the Lord.”
Psalms-130-1: A song for going up to the Temple. 130 Lord, I am in deep trouble, 130 Lord, I am in deep trouble,     so I am calling to you for help. so I am calling to you for help.
Psalms-130-2: 2 My Lord, listen to me.     Listen to my cry for help. Listen to my cry for help.
Psalms-130-3: 3 Lord, if you punished people for all their sins,     no one would be left alive. no one would be left alive.
Psalms-130-4: 4 But you forgive people,     so they fear and respect you. so they fear and respect you.
Psalms-130-5: 5 I am waiting for the Lord to help me.     My soul waits for him. My soul waits for him.     I trust what he says. I trust what he says.
Psalms-130-6: 6 I am waiting for my Lord,     like a guard waiting and waiting for the morning to come. like a guard waiting and waiting for the morning to come.
Psalms-130-7: 7 Israel, trust in the Lord.     The Lord is the one who is faithful and true. The Lord is the one who is faithful and true. He saves us again and again,
Psalms-130-8: 8     and he is the one who will save the people of Israel from all their sins. 8     and he is the one who will save the people of Israel from all their sins.
Psalms-131-1: A song of David for going up to the Temple. 131 Lord, I don’t feel proud. 131 Lord, I don’t feel proud.     I don’t see myself as better than others. I don’t see myself as better than others. I am not thinking about doing great things     or reaching impossible goals. or reaching impossible goals.
Psalms-131-2: 2 No, right now I am calm and quiet,     like a child after nursing, like a child after nursing,     content in its mother’s arms.[a] content in its mother’s arms.[a]
Psalms-131-3: 3 Israel, trust in the Lord.     Trust in him now and forever! Trust in him now and forever!
Psalms-132-1: A song for going up to the Temple. 132 Lord, remember how David suffered. 132 Lord, remember how David suffered.
Psalms-132-2: 2 He made a promise to you, Lord,     an oath to the Mighty God of Jacob. an oath to the Mighty God of Jacob.
Psalms-132-3: 3 He said, “I will not go into my house     or lie down on my bed. or lie down on my bed.
Psalms-132-4: 4 I will not sleep     or let my eyes rest, or let my eyes rest,
Psalms-132-5: 5 until I find a home for the Lord,     a tent for the Mighty God of Jacob!” a tent for the Mighty God of Jacob!”
Psalms-132-6: 6 We heard about this in Ephrathah.[a]     We found the Box of the Agreement at Kiriath Jearim.[b] We found the Box of the Agreement at Kiriath Jearim.[b]
Psalms-132-7: 7 Now, let’s go to the Lord’s house.     Let’s worship at his throne.[c] Let’s worship at his throne.[c]
Psalms-132-8: 8 Lord, get up[d] and go to your resting place;     go with the Box that shows your power. go with the Box that shows your power.
Psalms-132-9: 9 May your priests be clothed in victory     and your loyal followers be filled with joy. and your loyal followers be filled with joy.
Psalms-132-10: 10 For the sake of your servant David,     don’t reject your chosen king.[e] don’t reject your chosen king.[e]
Psalms-132-11: 11 The Lord made a promise to David, an oath of loyalty to him:     “I will always put one of your descendants on your throne. “I will always put one of your descendants on your throne.
Psalms-132-12: 12 If your descendants obey my agreement and the laws I teach them,     then the king will always be someone from your family.” then the king will always be someone from your family.”
Psalms-132-13: 13 The Lord has chosen Zion to be the place for his Temple,     the place he wanted for his home. the place he wanted for his home.
Psalms-132-14: 14 He said, “This will always be my place of rest.     This is where I want to sit on my throne. This is where I want to sit on my throne.
Psalms-132-15: 15 I will bless this city with plenty of food.     Even the poor will have enough to eat. Even the poor will have enough to eat.
Psalms-132-16: 16 I will clothe the priests with salvation,     and my followers will be filled with joy. and my followers will be filled with joy.
Psalms-132-17: 17 This is where I will make David’s family strong.     I will never let the lamp of my chosen king stop burning. I will never let the lamp of my chosen king stop burning.
Psalms-132-18: 18 I will cover his enemies with shame,     and on his head will be a shining crown.” and on his head will be a shining crown.”
Psalms-133-1: A song of David for going up to the Temple. 133 Oh, how wonderful, how pleasing it is 133 Oh, how wonderful, how pleasing it is     when God’s people all come together as one[a]! when God’s people all come together as one[a]!
Psalms-133-2: 2 It is like the sweet-smelling oil that is poured over the high priest’s[b] head,     that runs down his beard flowing over his robes. that runs down his beard flowing over his robes.
Psalms-133-3: 3 It is like a gentle rain[c] from Mount Hermon falling on Mount Zion.     It is there that the Lord has promised his blessing of eternal life. It is there that the Lord has promised his blessing of eternal life.
Psalms-134-1: A song for going up to the Temple. 134 Praise the Lord, all his servants 134 Praise the Lord, all his servants     who serve in the Temple at night. who serve in the Temple at night.
Psalms-134-2: 2 Lift your hands toward the Temple,     and praise the Lord. and praise the Lord.
Psalms-134-3: 3 May the Lord, who made heaven and earth,     bless you from Zion. bless you from Zion.
Psalms-135-1: 135 Praise the Lord! 135 Praise the Lord! Praise the name of the Lord!     Praise him, you servants of the Lord, Praise him, you servants of the Lord,
Psalms-135-2: 2 you who serve in the Lord’s Temple,     in the courtyard of the Temple of our God. in the courtyard of the Temple of our God.
Psalms-135-3: 3 Praise the Lord, because he is good.     Praise his name, because it brings such joy! Praise his name, because it brings such joy!
Psalms-135-4: 4 The Lord chose Jacob to be his own.     Yes, he chose Israel to be his own people. Yes, he chose Israel to be his own people.
Psalms-135-5: 5 I know the Lord is great!     Our Lord is greater than all the gods! Our Lord is greater than all the gods!
Psalms-135-6: 6 The Lord does whatever he wants,     in heaven and on earth, in the seas and the deep oceans. in heaven and on earth, in the seas and the deep oceans.
Psalms-135-7: 7 He brings the clouds from the other side of the earth.     He sends the lightning and the rain, He sends the lightning and the rain,     and he opens the doors to release the winds. and he opens the doors to release the winds.
Psalms-135-8: 8 He destroyed the firstborn males of the people in Egypt and their animals.
Psalms-135-9: 9 He did great wonders and miracles in Egypt.     He used them against Pharaoh and his officials. He used them against Pharaoh and his officials.
Psalms-135-10: 10 He defeated many nations     and killed powerful kings. and killed powerful kings.
Psalms-135-11: 11 He defeated Sihon, king of the Amorites,     Og, king of Bashan, Og, king of Bashan,     and all the kingdoms in Canaan. and all the kingdoms in Canaan.
Psalms-135-12: 12 Then he gave their land to Israel, his people.
Psalms-135-13: 13 Lord, your name will be famous forever!     Lord, people will remember you forever and ever. Lord, people will remember you forever and ever.
Psalms-135-14: 14 The Lord defends his people;     he is kind to his servants. he is kind to his servants.
Psalms-135-15: 15 The gods of other nations are only gold and silver idols     that people have made. that people have made.
Psalms-135-16: 16 They have mouths, but cannot speak.     They have eyes, but cannot see. They have eyes, but cannot see.
Psalms-135-17: 17 They have ears, but cannot hear.     They have mouths, but no breath. They have mouths, but no breath.
Psalms-135-18: 18 Those who make idols and trust in them     will become just like the idols they have made. will become just like the idols they have made.
Psalms-135-19: 19 Family of Israel, praise the Lord!     Aaron’s family, praise the Lord! Aaron’s family, praise the Lord!
Psalms-135-20: 20 Levi’s family, praise the Lord!     All you who worship the Lord, praise the Lord! All you who worship the Lord, praise the Lord!
Psalms-135-21: 21 The Lord should be praised from Zion,     from Jerusalem, his home. from Jerusalem, his home. Praise the Lord!
Psalms-136-1: 136 Praise the Lord because he is good. 136 Praise the Lord because he is good.     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-2: 2 Praise the God of gods!     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-3: 3 Praise the Lord of lords!     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-4: 4 Praise him who alone does wonderful miracles!     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-5: 5 Praise the one who used wisdom to make the skies!     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-6: 6 He spread the land over the sea.     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-7: 7 He made the great lights.     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-8: 8 He made the sun to rule the day.     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-9: 9 He made the moon and stars to rule the night.     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-10: 10 He killed the firstborn males in Egypt, both men and animals.     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-11: 11 He took Israel out of Egypt.     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-12: 12 He used his powerful arms and strong hands.     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-13: 13 He split the Red Sea into two parts.     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-14: 14 He led Israel through the sea.     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-15: 15 He drowned Pharaoh and his army in the Red Sea.     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-16: 16 He led his people through the desert.     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-17: 17 He defeated powerful kings.     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-18: 18 He defeated strong kings.     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-19: 19 He defeated Sihon king of the Amorites.     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-20: 20 He defeated Og king of Bashan.     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-21: 21 He gave their land to Israel.     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-22: 22 He gave it as a gift to Israel, his servant.     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-23: 23 He remembered us when we were defeated.     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-24: 24 He saved us from our enemies.     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-25: 25 He provides food for all living things.     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-136-26: 26 Praise the God of heaven!     His faithful love will last forever. His faithful love will last forever.
Psalms-137-1: 137 We sat by the rivers in Babylon 137 We sat by the rivers in Babylon     and cried as we remembered Zion. and cried as we remembered Zion.
Psalms-137-2: 2 We hung our harps nearby, there on the willow trees.[a]
Psalms-137-3: 3 There in Babylon, those who captured us told us to sing.     Our enemies told us to entertain them. Our enemies told us to entertain them.     They said, “Sing us one of your songs about Zion.” They said, “Sing us one of your songs about Zion.”
Psalms-137-4: 4 But we cannot sing the Lord’s songs     in a foreign country! in a foreign country!
Psalms-137-5: 5 Jerusalem, if I ever forget you,     may I never play a song again. may I never play a song again.
Psalms-137-6: 6 If I fail to remember you,     may I never sing again. may I never sing again. I will always remember Jerusalem     as my greatest joy! as my greatest joy!
Psalms-137-7: 7 Lord, be sure to punish the Edomites for what they did     when Jerusalem was captured. when Jerusalem was captured. They shouted, “Destroy its buildings!     Pull them down to the ground!” Pull them down to the ground!”
Psalms-137-8: 8 Babylon, you will be destroyed!     Bless the one who pays you back for what you did to us. Bless the one who pays you back for what you did to us.
Psalms-137-9: 9 Bless the one who grabs your babies     and smashes them against a rock. and smashes them against a rock.
Psalms-138-1: A song of David. 138 Lord, I praise you with all my heart. 138 Lord, I praise you with all my heart.     I sing songs of praise to you before the gods. I sing songs of praise to you before the gods.
Psalms-138-2: 2 I bow down toward your holy Temple,     and I praise your name for your love and loyalty. and I praise your name for your love and loyalty. You are famous,     and doing what you promised will make you even more famous! and doing what you promised will make you even more famous!
Psalms-138-3: 3 When I called to you for help,     you answered me and gave me strength. you answered me and gave me strength.
Psalms-138-4: 4 Lord, all the kings on earth will praise you     when they hear what you say. when they hear what you say.
Psalms-138-5: 5 They will sing about what the Lord has done,     because the glory of the Lord is very great. because the glory of the Lord is very great.
Psalms-138-6: 6 The Lord has the highest place above all others,     but he still cares for the humble. but he still cares for the humble. Even from there, so high above,     he knows what the proud do. he knows what the proud do.
Psalms-138-7: 7 If I am in trouble, you keep me alive.     If my enemies are angry, you save me from them. If my enemies are angry, you save me from them.
Psalms-138-8: 8 Lord, I know you will do what you have promised.     Lord, your faithful love will last forever. Lord, your faithful love will last forever.     You are the one who made us, so don’t leave us! You are the one who made us, so don’t leave us!
Psalms-139-1: To the director: A praise song of David. 139 Lord, you have tested me, 139 Lord, you have tested me,     so you know all about me. so you know all about me.
Psalms-139-2: 2 You know when I sit down and when I get up.     You know my thoughts from far away. You know my thoughts from far away.
Psalms-139-3: 3 You know where I go and where I lie down.     You know everything I do. You know everything I do.
Psalms-139-4: 4 Lord, you know what I want to say,     even before the words leave my mouth. even before the words leave my mouth.
Psalms-139-5: 5 You are all around me—in front of me and behind me.     I feel your hand on my shoulder. I feel your hand on my shoulder.
Psalms-139-6: 6 I am amazed at what you know;     it is too much for me to understand. it is too much for me to understand.
Psalms-139-7: 7 Your Spirit is everywhere I go.     I cannot escape your presence. I cannot escape your presence.
Psalms-139-8: 8 If I go up to heaven, you will be there.     If I go down to the place of death, you will be there. If I go down to the place of death, you will be there.
Psalms-139-9: 9 If I go east where the sun rises     or go to live in the west beyond the sea, or go to live in the west beyond the sea,
Psalms-139-10: 10 even there you will take my hand and lead me.     Your strong right hand will protect me. Your strong right hand will protect me.
Psalms-139-11: 11 Suppose I wanted to hide from you and said,     “Surely the darkness will hide me. “Surely the darkness will hide me.     The day will change to night and cover me.” The day will change to night and cover me.”
Psalms-139-12: 12 Even the darkness is not dark to you.     The night is as bright as the day. The night is as bright as the day.     Darkness and light are the same. Darkness and light are the same.
Psalms-139-13: 13 You formed the way I think and feel.[a]     You put me together in my mother’s womb. You put me together in my mother’s womb.
Psalms-139-14: 14 I praise you because you made me in such a wonderful way.     I know how amazing that was! I know how amazing that was!
Psalms-139-15: 15 You could see my bones grow as my body took shape,     hidden in my mother’s womb.[b] hidden in my mother’s womb.[b]
Psalms-139-16: 16 You could see my body grow each passing day.[c]     You listed all my parts, and not one of them was missing. You listed all my parts, and not one of them was missing.
Psalms-139-17: 17 Your thoughts are beyond my understanding.[d]     They cannot be measured! They cannot be measured!
Psalms-139-18: 18 If I could count them, they would be more than all the grains of sand.     But when I finished, I would have just begun.[e] But when I finished, I would have just begun.[e]
Psalms-139-19: 19 You murderers, get away from me!     God, kill those wicked people— God, kill those wicked people—
Psalms-139-20: 20 those who say bad things about you.     Your enemies use your name falsely.[f] Your enemies use your name falsely.[f]
Psalms-139-21: 21 Lord, I hate those who hate you.     I hate those who are against you. I hate those who are against you.
Psalms-139-22: 22 I hate them completely!     Your enemies are also my enemies. Your enemies are also my enemies.
Psalms-139-23: 23 God, examine me and know my mind.     Test me and know all my worries. Test me and know all my worries.
Psalms-139-24: 24 Make sure that I am not going the wrong way.[g]     Lead me on the path that has always been right.[h] Lead me on the path that has always been right.[h]
Psalms-140-1: To the director: A praise song of David. 140 Lord, save me from people who are evil. 140 Lord, save me from people who are evil.     Protect me from those who are cruel, Protect me from those who are cruel,
Psalms-140-2: 2 from those who plan to do evil     and always cause trouble. and always cause trouble.
Psalms-140-3: 3 Their words are as harmful as the fangs of a snake,     as deadly as its venom. Selah as deadly as its venom. Selah
Psalms-140-4: 4 Lord, save me from the wicked!     Protect me from these cruel people who plan to hurt me. Protect me from these cruel people who plan to hurt me.
Psalms-140-5: 5 These proud people are trying to trap me.     They spread nets to catch me; They spread nets to catch me;     they set traps in my path. Selah they set traps in my path. Selah
Psalms-140-6: 6 Lord, you are my God.     Lord, listen to my prayer. Lord, listen to my prayer.
Psalms-140-7: 7 My Lord God, you are the powerful one who saves me.     You protect my head in battle. You protect my head in battle.
Psalms-140-8: 8 Lord, don’t let the wicked have what they want.     Don’t let their plans succeed. Selah Don’t let their plans succeed. Selah
Psalms-140-9: 9 My enemies are planning trouble for me.     Lord, make that trouble fall on them. Lord, make that trouble fall on them.
Psalms-140-10: 10 Pour burning coals on their heads.     Throw them into the fire. Throw them into the fire.     Throw them into pits they can never escape. Throw them into pits they can never escape.
Psalms-140-11: 11 Don’t let those cruel liars enjoy success here.     Let disaster hunt them down. Let disaster hunt them down.
Psalms-140-12: 12 I know the Lord will provide justice for the poor     and will defend the helpless. and will defend the helpless.
Psalms-140-13: 13 Those who do what is right will praise your name;     those who are honest will live in your presence. those who are honest will live in your presence.
Psalms-141-1: A praise song of David. 141 Lord, I call to you for help. 141 Lord, I call to you for help.     Listen to me as I pray. Listen to me as I pray.     Please hurry and help me! Please hurry and help me!
Psalms-141-2: 2 Accept my prayer like a gift of burning incense,     the words I lift up like an evening sacrifice. the words I lift up like an evening sacrifice.
Psalms-141-3: 3 Lord, help me control what I say.     Don’t let me say anything bad. Don’t let me say anything bad.
Psalms-141-4: 4 Take away any desire to do evil.     Keep me from joining the wicked in doing wrong. Keep me from joining the wicked in doing wrong.     Help me stay away from their feasts. Help me stay away from their feasts.
Psalms-141-5: 5 If good people correct me,     I will consider it a good thing. I will consider it a good thing. If they criticize me,     I will accept it like a warm welcome.[a] I will accept it like a warm welcome.[a] But my prayer will always be against the wicked and the evil they do.
Psalms-141-6: 6 Let their judges be put to death.[b]     Then everyone will know that I told the truth. Then everyone will know that I told the truth.
Psalms-141-7: 7 Like rocks in a field that a farmer has plowed,     so our bones will be scattered in the grave. so our bones will be scattered in the grave.
Psalms-141-8: 8 My Lord God, I look to you for help.     I look to you for protection; don’t let me die. I look to you for protection; don’t let me die.
Psalms-141-9: 9 Those evil people are trying to trap me.     Don’t let me fall into their traps. Don’t let me fall into their traps.
Psalms-141-10: 10 Let the wicked fall into their own traps,     while I walk away unharmed. while I walk away unharmed.
Psalms-142-1: A maskil of David written when he was in the cave. A prayer. 142 I cry out to the Lord. 142 I cry out to the Lord.     I beg the Lord to help me. I beg the Lord to help me.
Psalms-142-2: 2 I tell him my problems;     I tell him about my troubles. I tell him about my troubles.
Psalms-142-3: 3 I am ready to give up.     But you, Lord, know the path I am on, But you, Lord, know the path I am on,     and you know that my enemies have set a trap for me. and you know that my enemies have set a trap for me.
Psalms-142-4: 4 I look around,     and I don’t see anyone I know. and I don’t see anyone I know. I have no place to run.     There is no one to save me. There is no one to save me.
Psalms-142-5: 5 Lord, I cry out to you for help:     “You are my place of safety. “You are my place of safety.     You are all I need in life.” You are all I need in life.”
Psalms-142-6: 6 Listen to my prayer.     I am so weak. I am so weak. Save me from those who are chasing me.     They are stronger than I am. They are stronger than I am.
Psalms-142-7: 7 Help me escape this trap,[a]     so that I can praise your name. so that I can praise your name. Then good people will celebrate with me,     because you took care of me. because you took care of me.
Psalms-143-1: A praise song of David. 143 Lord, hear my prayer. 143 Lord, hear my prayer.     Listen to my call for help and answer my prayer. Listen to my call for help and answer my prayer.     Show me how good and loyal you are. Show me how good and loyal you are.
Psalms-143-2: 2 Don’t judge me, your servant.     No one alive could be judged innocent by your standards. No one alive could be judged innocent by your standards.
Psalms-143-3: 3 My enemies are chasing me.     They have crushed me into the dirt. They have crushed me into the dirt. They are pushing me into the dark grave,     like people who died long ago. like people who died long ago.
Psalms-143-4: 4 I am ready to give up.     I am losing my courage. I am losing my courage.
Psalms-143-5: 5 But I remember what happened long ago.     I am thinking about all you have done. I am thinking about all you have done.     I am talking about what you made with your hands! I am talking about what you made with your hands!
Psalms-143-6: 6 I lift my hands in prayer to you.     I am waiting for your help, like a dry land waiting for rain. Selah I am waiting for your help, like a dry land waiting for rain. Selah
Psalms-143-7: 7 Hurry and answer me, Lord!     I have lost my courage. I have lost my courage. Don’t turn away from me.     Don’t let me die and become like the people lying in the grave. Don’t let me die and become like the people lying in the grave.
Psalms-143-8: 8 Show me your faithful love this morning.     I trust in you. I trust in you. Show me what I should do.     I put my life in your hands! I put my life in your hands!
Psalms-143-9: 9 Lord, I come to you for protection.     Save me from my enemies. Save me from my enemies.
Psalms-143-10: 10 Show me what you want me to do.     You are my God. You are my God. Let your good Spirit lead me over level ground.
Psalms-143-11: 11 Lord, let me live     so that people will praise your name. so that people will praise your name. Show me how good you are     and save me from my trouble. and save me from my trouble.
Psalms-143-12: 12 Show me your love     and defeat my enemies. and defeat my enemies. Destroy those who are trying to kill me     because I am your servant. because I am your servant.
Psalms-144-1: A song of David. 144 Praise the Lord! 144 Praise the Lord!     He is my Rock. He is my Rock. He prepares me for war.     He trains me for battle. He trains me for battle.
Psalms-144-2: 2 He loves me and protects me.     He is my safe place high on the mountain. He is my safe place high on the mountain. He rescues me.     He is my shield. He is my shield. I trust in him.     He helps me rule my people. He helps me rule my people.
Psalms-144-3: 3 Lord, why are people important to you?     Why do you even notice us? Why do you even notice us?
Psalms-144-4: 4 Our life is like a puff of air.     It is like a passing shadow. It is like a passing shadow.
Psalms-144-5: 5 Lord, tear open the skies and come down.     Touch the mountains, and smoke will rise from them. Touch the mountains, and smoke will rise from them.
Psalms-144-6: 6 Send the lightning and make my enemies run away.     Shoot your “arrows” and make them run away. Shoot your “arrows” and make them run away.
Psalms-144-7: 7 Reach down from heaven and save me!     Don’t let me drown in this sea of enemies. Don’t let me drown in this sea of enemies.     Save me from these foreigners. Save me from these foreigners.
Psalms-144-8: 8 They are all liars,     even when they swear to tell the truth. even when they swear to tell the truth.
Psalms-144-9: 9 God, I will sing a new song[a] for you.     I will play a ten-stringed harp and sing praise to you. I will play a ten-stringed harp and sing praise to you.
Psalms-144-10: 10 You are the one who gives victory to kings.     You saved your servant David from the sword of his enemy. You saved your servant David from the sword of his enemy.
Psalms-144-11: 11 Save me from these foreigners.     They are all liars, They are all liars,     even when they swear to tell the truth. even when they swear to tell the truth.
Psalms-144-12: 12 May our sons be as strong as trees     and our daughters as beautiful as the carved columns of a palace. and our daughters as beautiful as the carved columns of a palace.
Psalms-144-13: 13 May our barns be filled     with crops of all kinds. with crops of all kinds. May our sheep produce so many lambs,     that thousands of sheep will fill our fields. that thousands of sheep will fill our fields.
Psalms-144-14: 14     And may our cows be heavy with calves. 14     And may our cows be heavy with calves. May no enemy break through our walls     or carry away any of our people. or carry away any of our people.     May there be no cries of pain in our streets. May there be no cries of pain in our streets.
Psalms-144-15: 15 How wonderful to have such blessings!     Yes, great blessings belong to those who have the Lord as their God. Yes, great blessings belong to those who have the Lord as their God.
Psalms-145-1: A song of David. 145 I will tell of your greatness, my God and King. 145 I will tell of your greatness, my God and King.     I will praise your name forever and ever. I will praise your name forever and ever.
Psalms-145-2: 2 I will praise you every day.     I will praise your name forever and ever. I will praise your name forever and ever.
Psalms-145-3: 3 The Lord is great and deserves all our praise!     No one can fully understand his greatness! No one can fully understand his greatness!
Psalms-145-4: 4 Each generation will praise you     and tell the next generation about the great things you do. and tell the next generation about the great things you do.
Psalms-145-5: 5 Your majesty and glory are wonderful.     I will tell about your miracles. I will tell about your miracles.
Psalms-145-6: 6 People will tell about the amazing things you do,     and I will tell everyone how great you are. and I will tell everyone how great you are.
Psalms-145-7: 7 They will talk about your goodness     and sing about your justice. and sing about your justice.
Psalms-145-8: 8 The Lord is kind and merciful,     patient and full of love. patient and full of love.
Psalms-145-9: 9 The Lord is good to everyone.     He shows his mercy to everything he made. He shows his mercy to everything he made.
Psalms-145-10: 10 Lord, all you have made will give thanks to you.     Your loyal followers will praise you. Your loyal followers will praise you.
Psalms-145-11: 11 They will tell how great your kingdom is.     They will tell how great you are. They will tell how great you are.
Psalms-145-12: 12 So others will learn about the mighty things you do,     about the glory of your kingdom—how marvelous it is! about the glory of your kingdom—how marvelous it is!
Psalms-145-13: 13 Your kingdom will never end,     and you will rule forever. and you will rule forever. The Lord can be trusted in all that he says.     He is loyal in all that he does.[a] He is loyal in all that he does.[a]
Psalms-145-14: 14 The Lord lifts up people who have fallen.     He helps those who are in trouble. He helps those who are in trouble.
Psalms-145-15: 15 All living things look to you for their food,     and you give them their food at the right time. and you give them their food at the right time.
Psalms-145-16: 16 You open your hands     and give every living thing all that it needs. and give every living thing all that it needs.
Psalms-145-17: 17 Everything the Lord does is good.     Everything he does shows how loyal he is. Everything he does shows how loyal he is.
Psalms-145-18: 18 The Lord is near to everyone     who sincerely calls to him for help. who sincerely calls to him for help.
Psalms-145-19: 19 He listens to his followers and does what they want.     He answers their prayers and saves them. He answers their prayers and saves them.
Psalms-145-20: 20 The Lord protects everyone who loves him,     but he destroys all who do evil. but he destroys all who do evil.
Psalms-145-21: 21 I will praise the Lord!     Let everyone praise his holy name forever and ever! Let everyone praise his holy name forever and ever!
Psalms-146-1: 146 Praise the Lord! 146 Praise the Lord!     My soul, praise the Lord! My soul, praise the Lord!
Psalms-146-2: 2 I will praise the Lord all my life.     I will sing praises to him as long as I live. I will sing praises to him as long as I live.
Psalms-146-3: 3 Don’t depend on your leaders for help.     Don’t depend on people, because they cannot save you. Don’t depend on people, because they cannot save you.
Psalms-146-4: 4 People die and are buried.     Then all their plans to help are gone. Then all their plans to help are gone.
Psalms-146-5: 5 It is a great blessing for people to have the God of Jacob to help them.     They depend on the Lord their God. They depend on the Lord their God.
Psalms-146-6: 6 He made heaven and earth.     He made the sea and everything in it. He made the sea and everything in it. He can be trusted to do what he says.
Psalms-146-7: 7 He does what is right for those who have been hurt.     He gives food to the hungry. He gives food to the hungry. The Lord frees people locked up in prison.
Psalms-146-8: 8     The Lord makes the blind see again. 8     The Lord makes the blind see again. The Lord helps those who are in trouble.     The Lord loves those who do right. The Lord loves those who do right.
Psalms-146-9: 9 The Lord protects strangers in our country.     He cares for widows and orphans, He cares for widows and orphans,     but he destroys the wicked. but he destroys the wicked.
Psalms-146-10: 10 The Lord will rule forever!     Zion, your God will rule forever and ever! Zion, your God will rule forever and ever! Praise the Lord!
Psalms-147-1: 147 Praise the Lord because he is good. 147 Praise the Lord because he is good.     Sing praises to our God. Sing praises to our God.     It is good and pleasant to praise him. It is good and pleasant to praise him.
Psalms-147-2: 2 The Lord rebuilds Jerusalem.     He brings back the Israelites who were taken as prisoners. He brings back the Israelites who were taken as prisoners.
Psalms-147-3: 3 He heals their broken hearts     and bandages their wounds. and bandages their wounds.
Psalms-147-4: 4 He counts the stars     and knows each of them by name. and knows each of them by name.
Psalms-147-5: 5 Our Lord is great and powerful.     There is no limit to what he knows. There is no limit to what he knows.
Psalms-147-6: 6 The Lord supports the humble,     but he shames the wicked. but he shames the wicked.
Psalms-147-7: 7 Give thanks to the Lord.     Praise our God with harps. Praise our God with harps.
Psalms-147-8: 8 He fills the sky with clouds.     He sends rain to the earth. He sends rain to the earth.     He makes the grass grow on the mountains. He makes the grass grow on the mountains.
Psalms-147-9: 9 He gives food to the animals.     He feeds the young birds that cry out. He feeds the young birds that cry out.
Psalms-147-10: 10 War horses and powerful soldiers     are not what he cares about. are not what he cares about.
Psalms-147-11: 11 The Lord enjoys people who worship him     and trust in his faithful love. and trust in his faithful love.
Psalms-147-12: 12 Jerusalem, praise the Lord!     Zion, praise your God! Zion, praise your God!
Psalms-147-13: 13 He makes your gates strong,     and he blesses the people in your city. and he blesses the people in your city.
Psalms-147-14: 14 He brought peace to your country,     so you have plenty of grain for food. so you have plenty of grain for food.
Psalms-147-15: 15 He gives a command to the earth,     and it quickly obeys. and it quickly obeys.
Psalms-147-16: 16 He makes the snow fall until the ground is as white as wool.     He makes sleet blow through the air like dust. He makes sleet blow through the air like dust.
Psalms-147-17: 17 He makes hail fall like rocks from the sky.     No one can stand the cold he sends. No one can stand the cold he sends.
Psalms-147-18: 18 Then he gives another command, and warm air begins to blow.     The ice melts, and water begins to flow. The ice melts, and water begins to flow.
Psalms-147-19: 19 He gave his commands to Jacob.     He gave his laws and rules to Israel. He gave his laws and rules to Israel.
Psalms-147-20: 20 He did not do this for any other nation.     He did not teach his laws to other people. He did not teach his laws to other people. Praise the Lord!
Psalms-148-1: 148 Praise the Lord! 148 Praise the Lord! Angels above,     praise the Lord from heaven! praise the Lord from heaven!
Psalms-148-2: 2 Praise him, all you angels!     Praise him, all his army[a]! Praise him, all his army[a]!
Psalms-148-3: 3 Sun and moon, praise him!     Stars and lights in the sky, praise him! Stars and lights in the sky, praise him!
Psalms-148-4: 4 Praise him, highest heaven!     Waters above the sky, praise him! Waters above the sky, praise him!
Psalms-148-5: 5 Let them praise the Lord’s name,     because he gave the command and created them all! because he gave the command and created them all!
Psalms-148-6: 6 He made all these continue forever.     He made the laws that will never end. He made the laws that will never end.
Psalms-148-7: 7 Everything on earth, praise him!     Great sea animals and all the oceans, praise the Lord! Great sea animals and all the oceans, praise the Lord!
Psalms-148-8: 8 Praise him, fire and hail, snow and clouds,     and the stormy winds that obey him. and the stormy winds that obey him.
Psalms-148-9: 9 Praise him, mountains and hills,     fruit trees and cedar trees. fruit trees and cedar trees.
Psalms-148-10: 10 Praise him, wild animals and cattle, reptiles and birds.
Psalms-148-11: 11 Praise him, kings of the earth and all nations,     princes and all rulers on earth. princes and all rulers on earth.
Psalms-148-12: 12 Praise him, young men and women,     old people and children. old people and children.
Psalms-148-13: 13 Praise the Lord’s name!     Honor his name forever! Honor his name forever! His name is greater than any other.     He is more glorious than heaven and earth. He is more glorious than heaven and earth.
Psalms-148-14: 14 He made his people strong.     His loyal followers praise him. His loyal followers praise him. Israel, his precious people, praise the Lord!
Psalms-149-1: 149 Praise the Lord! 149 Praise the Lord! Sing a new song[a] to the Lord!     Sing his praise in the assembly of his followers. Sing his praise in the assembly of his followers.
Psalms-149-2: 2 Let Israel be happy with their Maker.     Let the people of Zion rejoice with their King. Let the people of Zion rejoice with their King.
Psalms-149-3: 3 Let them praise him by dancing     and playing their tambourines and harps. and playing their tambourines and harps.
Psalms-149-4: 4 The Lord is happy with his people.     He did a wonderful thing for his humble people. He did a wonderful thing for his humble people.     He saved them! He saved them!
Psalms-149-5: 5 Let his followers rejoice in this victory!     Let them sing for joy, even in their beds! Let them sing for joy, even in their beds!
Psalms-149-6: 6 Let the people shout praise to God.     And with a sharp sword in their hand, And with a sharp sword in their hand,
Psalms-149-7: 7 let them take revenge on the other nations.     Let them go punish those people. Let them go punish those people.
Psalms-149-8: 8 They will put their kings in chains     and their leaders in chains of iron. and their leaders in chains of iron.
Psalms-149-9: 9 They will punish those nations as God commanded.     This is an honor for all his followers. This is an honor for all his followers. Praise the Lord!
Psalms-150-1: 150 Praise the Lord! 150 Praise the Lord! Praise God in his Temple!     Praise him in heaven, his strong fortress! Praise him in heaven, his strong fortress!
Psalms-150-2: 2 Praise him for the great things he does!     Praise him for all his greatness! Praise him for all his greatness!
Psalms-150-3: 3 Praise him with trumpets and horns!     Praise him with harps and lyres! Praise him with harps and lyres!
Psalms-150-4: 4 Praise him with tambourines and dancing!     Praise him with stringed instruments and flutes! Praise him with stringed instruments and flutes!
Psalms-150-5: 5 Praise him with loud cymbals!     Praise him with crashing cymbals! Praise him with crashing cymbals!
Psalms-150-6: 6 Everything that breathes, praise the Lord! Praise the Lord!
